com.temenos.t24.api.records.ldloansanddeposits

Class LdLoansAndDepositsRecord

Packaged in : LD.Contract.jar

  • public class LdLoansAndDepositsRecord

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Constructor with Generic structure..

      Default constructor. Create an empty LdLoansAndDepositsRecord.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • addActivity

      • addAmount

        public void addAmount(java.lang.CharSequence param)
        Appends the specified Amount to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The principal amount of the contract. In order to facilitate the efficient entry of the amount, an input feature has been provided which allows for the suppression of trailing zeros. e.g. INPUT VALUE 1T 1,000.00 2M 2,000,000.00 4.5B 4,500,000,000.00 The user may also input commas to assist in the entry of large amounts, the system will ignore their use and implement the amount based on the numeric input. This field will include the impact of principal increases (or decreases for Commitment contracts) plus the effect of capitalised interest. It therefore provides the user with a record of the maximum liability in relation to this contract. In the case of Syndications this field indicates the liability of the counterparty to the user and not to the syndicate as a whole. In case of Deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field, the system calculates the amount and populates the value in this field. The user may, if required, modify the system calculated amount either upwards or downwards. While doing so the system performs a tolerance check on the amount entered by the user based on the settings in LD.TXN.TYPE table for the relevant category code. The tolerance check could be either as a percentage on the system calculated amount or as an absolute amount on the system calculated amount. Beyond the permitted tolerance level an error message would be indicated. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Mandatory input. Multivalue field.) Value must be greater than Zero, unless SYNDICATE.AGT bears a value of "AGENT". Multiple amounts can be input for Commitment Contract types only. If the contract is linked to a commitment the amount must be less than or equal to the available amount indicated in COMMT.AVAIL.AMT. If linked to a commitment the value must be a multiple of D.D.MULT.AMT. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        param - the Amount to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addAmount

        public void addAmount(TField param)
        Appends the specified Amount to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The principal amount of the contract. In order to facilitate the efficient entry of the amount, an input feature has been provided which allows for the suppression of trailing zeros. e.g. INPUT VALUE 1T 1,000.00 2M 2,000,000.00 4.5B 4,500,000,000.00 The user may also input commas to assist in the entry of large amounts, the system will ignore their use and implement the amount based on the numeric input. This field will include the impact of principal increases (or decreases for Commitment contracts) plus the effect of capitalised interest. It therefore provides the user with a record of the maximum liability in relation to this contract. In the case of Syndications this field indicates the liability of the counterparty to the user and not to the syndicate as a whole. In case of Deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field, the system calculates the amount and populates the value in this field. The user may, if required, modify the system calculated amount either upwards or downwards. While doing so the system performs a tolerance check on the amount entered by the user based on the settings in LD.TXN.TYPE table for the relevant category code. The tolerance check could be either as a percentage on the system calculated amount or as an absolute amount on the system calculated amount. Beyond the permitted tolerance level an error message would be indicated. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Mandatory input. Multivalue field.) Value must be greater than Zero, unless SYNDICATE.AGT bears a value of "AGENT". Multiple amounts can be input for Commitment Contract types only. If the contract is linked to a commitment the amount must be less than or equal to the available amount indicated in COMMT.AVAIL.AMT. If linked to a commitment the value must be a multiple of D.D.MULT.AMT. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        param - the Amount to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addBillNumber

        public void addBillNumber(TField param)
        Appends the specified BillNumber to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the number of a Trade Bill to be discounted or re-discounted. Details of individual trade bills are held in the application BILL.REGISTER. In order to discount or rediscount a bill or bundle of bills the key should be entered in this field. This will default the following information: AMOUNT The value of the Bill from BILL REGISTER CUSTOMER The DRAWEE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER CURRENCY The CURRENCY of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER MATURITY.DATE The MATURITY.DATE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER consequently operations on bundles of bills can only be applied where the customer, currency and maturity date are the same. DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be discounted when they have first been ACCEPTED. A Bill is accepted using the MD.DEAL module, once accepted the status in the BILL.REGISTER is set to ACCEPTED. When a bill is discounted the bank takes ownership of the Bill in return for payment of an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity of the Bill. A discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to be paid. The amount to be paid is: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Discount Rate * No Days) where: Bill Amount is held in BILL.REGISTER, No.Days is the number of days between value date and maturity date. A Bill Discount transaction should therefore entered in the Loans and Deposits application as a Discounted Loan using the following fields: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = Discount Rate RE-DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be re-discounted when they have already been DISCOUNTED. A Bill is discounted as described above, ince discounted the status of the BILL.REGISTER record is set to DISCOUNTED. When a Bill is re-discounted the bank sells the Bill on in return for an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity date of the Bill. A re-discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to receive. The amount to be received can be calculated as: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Re-discount Rate * No Days) Once Bills are re-discounted they are no longer owned by the bank and should not appear in the books. The re-discount transaction is therefore entered as a deposit to offset the original discount. Since the discount and re-discount are unlikely to take place at the same rate, a profit or loss will be made on the rediscount transaction which should be realised immediately. In order to offset the discount transaction an amount is calculated based on the original discount rate for the remaining life of the Bill. This amount is held in the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC field for all bills, the resulting ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT should be accrued over the remaining life of the contract to offset the discount accrual. The remaining profit or loss from the re-discount is stored in the CHRG.AMNT fields (see BILL.REDISC.RATE for details). The sum of the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC and CHRG.AMNT fields is the total amount to be received. The following fields should be entered for a re-discount: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = 0 BILL.REDISC.RATE = Rediscount Rate Validation Rules: Up to 12 characters as defined for the BILL.NUMBER id for the BILL.REGISTER. (Optional input) Must be a valid bill number on the BILL.REGISTER file. A loan (discount) transaction can only be entered if the STATUS in BILL.REGISTER is ACCEPTED. A deposit (re-discount) transaction can only be entered if the STATUS in BILL.REGISTER is DISCOUNTED. The CURRENCY and DRAWEE must be the same for all Bills.

        Parameters:
        param - the BillNumber to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addBillNumber

        public void addBillNumber(java.lang.CharSequence param)
        Appends the specified BillNumber to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the number of a Trade Bill to be discounted or re-discounted. Details of individual trade bills are held in the application BILL.REGISTER. In order to discount or rediscount a bill or bundle of bills the key should be entered in this field. This will default the following information: AMOUNT The value of the Bill from BILL REGISTER CUSTOMER The DRAWEE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER CURRENCY The CURRENCY of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER MATURITY.DATE The MATURITY.DATE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER consequently operations on bundles of bills can only be applied where the customer, currency and maturity date are the same. DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be discounted when they have first been ACCEPTED. A Bill is accepted using the MD.DEAL module, once accepted the status in the BILL.REGISTER is set to ACCEPTED. When a bill is discounted the bank takes ownership of the Bill in return for payment of an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity of the Bill. A discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to be paid. The amount to be paid is: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Discount Rate * No Days) where: Bill Amount is held in BILL.REGISTER, No.Days is the number of days between value date and maturity date. A Bill Discount transaction should therefore entered in the Loans and Deposits application as a Discounted Loan using the following fields: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = Discount Rate RE-DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be re-discounted when they have already been DISCOUNTED. A Bill is discounted as described above, ince discounted the status of the BILL.REGISTER record is set to DISCOUNTED. When a Bill is re-discounted the bank sells the Bill on in return for an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity date of the Bill. A re-discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to receive. The amount to be received can be calculated as: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Re-discount Rate * No Days) Once Bills are re-discounted they are no longer owned by the bank and should not appear in the books. The re-discount transaction is therefore entered as a deposit to offset the original discount. Since the discount and re-discount are unlikely to take place at the same rate, a profit or loss will be made on the rediscount transaction which should be realised immediately. In order to offset the discount transaction an amount is calculated based on the original discount rate for the remaining life of the Bill. This amount is held in the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC field for all bills, the resulting ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT should be accrued over the remaining life of the contract to offset the discount accrual. The remaining profit or loss from the re-discount is stored in the CHRG.AMNT fields (see BILL.REDISC.RATE for details). The sum of the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC and CHRG.AMNT fields is the total amount to be received. The following fields should be entered for a re-discount: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = 0 BILL.REDISC.RATE = Rediscount Rate Validation Rules: Up to 12 characters as defined for the BILL.NUMBER id for the BILL.REGISTER. (Optional input) Must be a valid bill number on the BILL.REGISTER file. A loan (discount) transaction can only be entered if the STATUS in BILL.REGISTER is ACCEPTED. A deposit (re-discount) transaction can only be entered if the STATUS in BILL.REGISTER is DISCOUNTED. The CURRENCY and DRAWEE must be the same for all Bills.

        Parameters:
        param - the BillNumber to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addBkToBkInfo

        public void addBkToBkInfo(java.lang.CharSequence param)
        Appends the specified BkToBkInfo to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Provides instructions or additional information from the sending bank for the receiver, intermediary account with institution or beneficiary institution. Any details input by the user will be relayed to the receiver. Whenever this field is used in a message transmitted between countries with different languages, it is recommended that English is used. This field corresponds to field 72 on SWIFT messages, and must never be used for information for which another field is intended, or for instructions not required in a message. Validation Rules: Up to 35 characters (uppercase alpha or numeric) - Type S. Multivalue field. A maximum of 6 lines of 35 characters each will be allowed. If this field is used, the first multivalue must contain a code word followed by further information. All code words must be present on the SWIFT.CODE.WORDS files, and must be enclosed between slashes '/' at the beginning of the line. Further code words and information can be entered in subsequent multivalues, but additional information continued on a new line must be preceded by double slashes '//'.

        Parameters:
        param - the BkToBkInfo to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addBkToBkInfo

        public void addBkToBkInfo(TField param)
        Appends the specified BkToBkInfo to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Provides instructions or additional information from the sending bank for the receiver, intermediary account with institution or beneficiary institution. Any details input by the user will be relayed to the receiver. Whenever this field is used in a message transmitted between countries with different languages, it is recommended that English is used. This field corresponds to field 72 on SWIFT messages, and must never be used for information for which another field is intended, or for instructions not required in a message. Validation Rules: Up to 35 characters (uppercase alpha or numeric) - Type S. Multivalue field. A maximum of 6 lines of 35 characters each will be allowed. If this field is used, the first multivalue must contain a code word followed by further information. All code words must be present on the SWIFT.CODE.WORDS files, and must be enclosed between slashes '/' at the beginning of the line. Further code words and information can be entered in subsequent multivalues, but additional information continued on a new line must be preceded by double slashes '//'.

        Parameters:
        param - the BkToBkInfo to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addBusDayDefn

        public void addBusDayDefn(java.lang.CharSequence param)
        Appends the specified BusDayDefn to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates those countries whose calendars must be checked with regard to holiday validation. The default value will be the Country of the currency of the Contract but the User can input any number of extra codes if required. For example, the country of the participants. Validation Rules: 4 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) The code must have a valid entry on the REGION/HOLIDAY table. Once authorised a change in this field will require redefinition of the schedules.

        Parameters:
        param - the BusDayDefn to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addCancelledInt

        public void addCancelledInt(java.lang.CharSequence param)
        Appends the specified CancelledInt to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the details of the cancelled interest amount by the split current month, previous month and previous year. The first multivalue specifies the amount for the current month, the second multivalue for the previous month and the third multivalue for the previous year. Validation Rules: Up to 19 type AMT numeric characters. (Multivalue field). This is a NOINPUT field. Multivalue 1 contains the interest amount for the current month. Multivalue 2 contains the interest amount for the previous month. Multivalue 3 contains the interest amount for the previous year.

        Parameters:
        param - the CancelledInt to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addCancelledInt

The first multivalue specifies the amount for the current month, the second multivalue for the previous month and the third multivalue for the previous year.       • addCommRate

        public void addCommRate(TField param)
        Appends the specified CommRate to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the annual commission rate applicable to the contract. This is the rate used for commission computation purposes on Loan and Commitment contracts. For Commitments contracts any rates input are tied to values input in AMOUNT. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. Multivalue field for Commitments only. Optional input. Default = NO COMM RATE). Input allowed for Loan and Commitment contract types only. Mandatory input if a value in COMM.PAYMT.METHOD. Must be greater than zero. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. Mandatory input if a value in TOTAL.COMM.AMOUNT.

        Parameters:
        param - the CommRate to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addCommRate

If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. Mandatory input if a value in TOTAL.COMM.AMOUNT.

      • addCustRemarks

        public void addCustRemarks(TField param)
        Appends the specified CustRemarks to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Narrative to be printed on the customers confirmations and advices. The remarks entered in this field are printed on confirmations/advices to the customer. The remarks are deleted from the contract (written to history) once they have been printed. Any amendments to this field will impact on the subsequent confirmation/ advice. Validation Rules: Free format of up to 4 lines maximum 35 type (alphanumeric) characters per line. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Only 4 lines allowed. Mandatory input if a value in field ALONE.MERGE.IND.

        Parameters:
        param - the CustRemarks to append
        Returns:
        nothing

        Field description: Drawdowns can be expressed in multiples of this amount. The value will be construed to be in the currency of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Must be less than or equal to the commitment amount. Valid for Commitment contracts only.

        Parameters:
        param - the DDMultAmt to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addIntAddress

        public void addIntAddress(java.lang.CharSequence param)
        Appends the specified IntAddress to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the interest amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified or this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and INT.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK1 or INT.BEN.BANK2.

        Parameters:
        param - the IntAddress to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addIntAddress

        public void addIntAddress(TField param)
        Appends the specified IntAddress to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the interest amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified or this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and INT.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK1 or INT.BEN.BANK2.

        Parameters:
        param - the IntAddress to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addIntTaxLcy

        public void addIntTaxLcy(TField param)
        Appends the specified IntTaxLcy to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: INT.TAX.LCY This field details the local currency equivalent amount of tax on interest Validation Rules: NO INPUT

        Parameters:
        param - the IntTaxLcy to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addInterestRate

        public void addInterestRate(java.lang.CharSequence param)
        Appends the specified InterestRate to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the annual interest/commitment fee rate applicable on the contract. This is the rate used for interest computation purposes on Loans and Deposits contracts and for commitment fee computation purposes in the case of Commitment contracts. Negative rates can be input in some cases. To enable this, the value in field NEGATIVE.RATE should be YES. The helptext for NEGATIVE.RATE will clarify the type of contracts for which negative rates can be used. Validation Rules: 1- 10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Input prohibited for floating rate contracts. Must be greater than zero for discounted contracts. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Input mandatory for the first period on PERIODIC rate contracts. Input mandatory for fixed interest contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Input prohibited for Sundry and Accounts Receivable contract types.

        Parameters:
        param - the InterestRate to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addInterestRate

        public void addInterestRate(TField param)
        Appends the specified InterestRate to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the annual interest/commitment fee rate applicable on the contract. This is the rate used for interest computation purposes on Loans and Deposits contracts and for commitment fee computation purposes in the case of Commitment contracts. Negative rates can be input in some cases. To enable this, the value in field NEGATIVE.RATE should be YES. The helptext for NEGATIVE.RATE will clarify the type of contracts for which negative rates can be used. Validation Rules: 1- 10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Input prohibited for floating rate contracts. Must be greater than zero for discounted contracts. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Input mandatory for the first period on PERIODIC rate contracts. Input mandatory for fixed interest contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Input prohibited for Sundry and Accounts Receivable contract types.

        Parameters:

When commission payment method is discounted, rate must be greater than zero. Input prohibited unless a value is present in field COMM.RATE. Must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100.         public void addNewIntRate(TField param)

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: New interest rate to be applied. Represents the new interest rate on a contract, or in the case of Commitment contracts the rate (or rate tier) applicable to commitment fee accruals. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Input prohibited for FLOATING rate contracts. Input prohibited for interest basis "S". One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Input prohibited prior to first authroised contract. Input prohibited for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Zero rate allowed for Commitments only. Input must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Multiple rates on commitment contracts required for each amount input. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field.

      • addOverride

        public void addOverride(TField param)
        Appends the specified Override to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains all the override messages which the user has confirmed during input. At validation,the system may generate a series of screen override messages to indicate some anomaly within the transaction (e.g. maturity date is not a working day for this currency). User may change the data or override the message. If the contract is subsequently displayed or printed, all override messages are shown. Validation Rules: (System generated. Multivalue field.) This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        param - the Override to append
        Returns:
        nothing

        Field description: Indicates the identity of the relevant participant. An expansion in this field results in the expansion of all syndicate related fields. Permitted for Syndicated loan and Syndicated Commitment contracts only. If the value in SYNDICATE.AGT is other than "AGENT" then this information will be held on a memorandum basis only. The borrower cannot be a participant.

      • addPrinAddress

        public void addPrinAddress(TField param)
        Appends the specified PrinAddress to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the Principal Amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified, or it will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) For Loans, DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits, PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Once a Loan contract has been authorised any amendment will impact future events only. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited when input in both PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 and PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or PRIN.BEN.BANK.2.

        Parameters:
        param - the PrinAddress to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addPrinAddress

        public void addPrinAddress(java.lang.CharSequence param)
        Appends the specified PrinAddress to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the Principal Amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified, or it will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. For Deposits, PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Once a Loan contract has been authorised any amendment will impact future events only.       • addStmtNo

        public void addStmtNo(java.lang.CharSequence param)
        Appends the specified StmtNo to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Number to identify either a Statement Entry or a Category Entry in respect of the contract. When a new contract is input,there will be an entry on the Drawdown Account and field entries will be generated e.g. Value .1 STMT NO. 664445752.06 Value .2 STMT NO. 1 Value .3 STMT NO. 1 where value .1 indicates a reference number unique to the transaction, and value .2 indicates the number of events which have occurred in relation to this transaction, Value .3 indicates a Category Entry reference no.These suffices can be appended to the unique reference no. for the purpose of 'SEEing' information on the terminal screen. Validation Rules: 11 Numeric characters of the form: nnnnnnnnn.nn System generated Multivalue field This field is NOINPUT

        Parameters:
        param - the StmtNo to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addWalkInCust

        public void addWalkInCust(java.lang.CharSequence param)
        Appends the specified WalkInCust to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates a) the name and the address of any short term or 'casual' walk in customer or b) an alternative address for correspondence purposes. This field will be used where a branch does not wish to open a specific customer record for 'one off' or casual customers. It will be used in conjunction with a miscellaneous customer number. Alternatively this field will be used in instances where an existing customer requires correspondence to go to an alternative address. The values recorded here will always take priority over the values held on the customer record. This field can be changed at any point during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input. Default value = none.) Input prohibited unless a valid customer number is present in CUSTOMER.ID. Input in this field will generate an override message. Input prohibited if DELIVERY LINK is SWIFT.

        Parameters:
        param - the WalkInCust to append
        Returns:
        nothing

      • addWalkInCust

        public void addWalkInCust(TField param)
        Appends the specified WalkInCust to the end of the collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates a) the name and the address of any short term or 'casual' walk in customer or b) an alternative address for correspondence purposes. This field will be used where a branch does not wish to open a specific customer record for 'one off' or casual customers. It will be used in conjunction with a miscellaneous customer number. Alternatively this field will be used in instances where an existing customer requires correspondence to go to an alternative address. The values recorded here will always take priority over the values held on the customer record. This field can be changed at any point during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input. Default value = none.) Input prohibited unless a valid customer number is present in CUSTOMER.ID. Input in this field will generate an override message. Input prohibited if DELIVERY LINK is SWIFT.

      • clearActivity

        public void clearActivity()
        Clear the collection of Activity
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearAmount

        public void clearAmount()
        Clear the collection of Amount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The principal amount of the contract. In order to facilitate the efficient entry of the amount, an input feature has been provided which allows for the suppression of trailing zeros. e.g. INPUT VALUE 1T 1,000.00 2M 2,000,000.00 4.5B 4,500,000,000.00 The user may also input commas to assist in the entry of large amounts, the system will ignore their use and implement the amount based on the numeric input. This field will include the impact of principal increases (or decreases for Commitment contracts) plus the effect of capitalised interest. It therefore provides the user with a record of the maximum liability in relation to this contract. In the case of Syndications this field indicates the liability of the counterparty to the user and not to the syndicate as a whole. In case of Deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field, the system calculates the amount and populates the value in this field. The user may, if required, modify the system calculated amount either upwards or downwards. While doing so the system performs a tolerance check on the amount entered by the user based on the settings in LD.TXN.TYPE table for the relevant category code. The tolerance check could be either as a percentage on the system calculated amount or as an absolute amount on the system calculated amount. Beyond the permitted tolerance level an error message would be indicated. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Mandatory input. Multivalue field.) Value must be greater than Zero, unless SYNDICATE.AGT bears a value of "AGENT". Multiple amounts can be input for Commitment Contract types only. If the contract is linked to a commitment the amount must be less than or equal to the available amount indicated in COMMT.AVAIL.AMT. If linked to a commitment the value must be a multiple of D.D.MULT.AMT. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearBillNumber

        public void clearBillNumber()
        Clear the collection of BillNumber
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the number of a Trade Bill to be discounted or re-discounted. Details of individual trade bills are held in the application BILL.REGISTER. In order to discount or rediscount a bill or bundle of bills the key should be entered in this field. This will default the following information: AMOUNT The value of the Bill from BILL REGISTER CUSTOMER The DRAWEE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER CURRENCY The CURRENCY of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER MATURITY.DATE The MATURITY.DATE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER consequently operations on bundles of bills can only be applied where the customer, currency and maturity date are the same. DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be discounted when they have first been ACCEPTED. A Bill is accepted using the MD.DEAL module, once accepted the status in the BILL.REGISTER is set to ACCEPTED. When a bill is discounted the bank takes ownership of the Bill in return for payment of an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity of the Bill. A discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to be paid. The amount to be paid is: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Discount Rate * No Days) where: Bill Amount is held in BILL.REGISTER, No.Days is the number of days between value date and maturity date. A Bill Discount transaction should therefore entered in the Loans and Deposits application as a Discounted Loan using the following fields: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = Discount Rate RE-DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be re-discounted when they have already been DISCOUNTED. A Bill is discounted as described above, ince discounted the status of the BILL.REGISTER record is set to DISCOUNTED. When a Bill is re-discounted the bank sells the Bill on in return for an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity date of the Bill. A re-discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to receive. The amount to be received can be calculated as: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Re-discount Rate * No Days) Once Bills are re-discounted they are no longer owned by the bank and should not appear in the books. The re-discount transaction is therefore entered as a deposit to offset the original discount. Since the discount and re-discount are unlikely to take place at the same rate, a profit or loss will be made on the rediscount transaction which should be realised immediately. In order to offset the discount transaction an amount is calculated based on the original discount rate for the remaining life of the Bill. This amount is held in the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC field for all bills, the resulting ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT should be accrued over the remaining life of the contract to offset the discount accrual. The remaining profit or loss from the re-discount is stored in the CHRG.AMNT fields (see BILL.REDISC.RATE for details). The sum of the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC and CHRG.AMNT fields is the total amount to be received. The following fields should be entered for a re-discount: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = 0 BILL.REDISC.RATE = Rediscount Rate Validation Rules: Up to 12 characters as defined for the BILL.NUMBER id for the BILL.REGISTER. (Optional input) Must be a valid bill number on the BILL.REGISTER file. A loan (discount) transaction can only be entered if the STATUS in BILL.REGISTER is ACCEPTED. A deposit (re-discount) transaction can only be entered if the STATUS in BILL.REGISTER is DISCOUNTED. The CURRENCY and DRAWEE must be the same for all Bills.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearBkToBkInfo

        public void clearBkToBkInfo()
        Clear the collection of BkToBkInfo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Provides instructions or additional information from the sending bank for the receiver, intermediary account with institution or beneficiary institution. Any details input by the user will be relayed to the receiver. Whenever this field is used in a message transmitted between countries with different languages, it is recommended that English is used. This field corresponds to field 72 on SWIFT messages, and must never be used for information for which another field is intended, or for instructions not required in a message. Validation Rules: Up to 35 characters (uppercase alpha or numeric) - Type S. Multivalue field. A maximum of 6 lines of 35 characters each will be allowed. If this field is used, the first multivalue must contain a code word followed by further information. All code words must be present on the SWIFT.CODE.WORDS files, and must be enclosed between slashes '/' at the beginning of the line. Further code words and information can be entered in subsequent multivalues, but additional information continued on a new line must be preceded by double slashes '//'.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearBusDayDefn

        public void clearBusDayDefn()
        Clear the collection of BusDayDefn
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates those countries whose calendars must be checked with regard to holiday validation. The default value will be the Country of the currency of the Contract but the User can input any number of extra codes if required. For example, the country of the participants. Validation Rules: 4 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) The code must have a valid entry on the REGION/HOLIDAY table. Once authorised a change in this field will require redefinition of the schedules.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearCancelledInt

        public void clearCancelledInt()
        Clear the collection of CancelledInt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the details of the cancelled interest amount by the split current month, previous month and previous year. The first multivalue specifies the amount for the current month, the second multivalue for the previous month and the third multivalue for the previous year. Validation Rules: Up to 19 type AMT numeric characters. (Multivalue field). This is a NOINPUT field. Multivalue 1 contains the interest amount for the current month. Multivalue 2 contains the interest amount for the previous month. Multivalue 3 contains the interest amount for the previous year.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearChrgCode

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearCommRate

        public void clearCommRate()
        Clear the collection of CommRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the annual commission rate applicable to the contract. This is the rate used for commission computation purposes on Loan and Commitment contracts. For Commitments contracts any rates input are tied to values input in AMOUNT. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. Multivalue field for Commitments only. Optional input. Default = NO COMM RATE). Input allowed for Loan and Commitment contract types only. Mandatory input if a value in COMM.PAYMT.METHOD. Must be greater than zero. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. Mandatory input if a value in TOTAL.COMM.AMOUNT.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearCrossRefNo

        Clear the collection of CrossRefNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the reference number of a second contract or a record of another valid reference. This field can be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 12 type A (alphanumeric) characters per line. (Multivalue field. Optional input. Default value = null.) Any validation to be defined locally.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearCustRemarks

        public void clearCustRemarks()
        Clear the collection of CustRemarks
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Narrative to be printed on the customers confirmations and advices. The remarks entered in this field are printed on confirmations/advices to the customer. The remarks are deleted from the contract (written to history) once they have been printed. Any amendments to this field will impact on the subsequent confirmation/ advice. Validation Rules: Free format of up to 4 lines maximum 35 type (alphanumeric) characters per line. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Only 4 lines allowed. Mandatory input if a value in field ALONE.MERGE.IND.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Drawdowns can be expressed in multiples of this amount. The value will be construed to be in the currency of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Must be less than or equal to the commitment amount. Valid for Commitment contracts only.

      • clearIntAddress

        public void clearIntAddress()
        Clear the collection of IntAddress
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the interest amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified or this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and INT.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK1 or INT.BEN.BANK2.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearInterestRate

        public void clearInterestRate()
        Clear the collection of InterestRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the annual interest/commitment fee rate applicable on the contract. This is the rate used for interest computation purposes on Loans and Deposits contracts and for commitment fee computation purposes in the case of Commitment contracts. Negative rates can be input in some cases. To enable this, the value in field NEGATIVE.RATE should be YES. The helptext for NEGATIVE.RATE will clarify the type of contracts for which negative rates can be used. Validation Rules: 1- 10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Input prohibited for floating rate contracts. Must be greater than zero for discounted contracts. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Input mandatory for the first period on PERIODIC rate contracts. Input mandatory for fixed interest contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Input prohibited for Sundry and Accounts Receivable contract types.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearNewComRate

        public void clearNewComRate()
        Clear the collection of NewComRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the new commission rate for the contract. Indicates the new commission rate for the contract, or in the case of Commitment contracts the rate (or rate tier) applicable to commitment commission accruals. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus decimal point. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Input allowed for Loans and Commitments only. When commission payment method is discounted, rate must be greater than zero. Input prohibited unless a value is present in field COMM.RATE. Must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Multivalue field for Commitments only. Input prohibited prior to first authorisation of contract. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearNewIntRate

        public void clearNewIntRate()
        Clear the collection of NewIntRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: New interest rate to be applied. Represents the new interest rate on a contract, or in the case of Commitment contracts the rate (or rate tier) applicable to commitment fee accruals. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Input prohibited for FLOATING rate contracts. Input prohibited for interest basis "S". One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Input prohibited prior to first authroised contract. Input prohibited for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Zero rate allowed for Commitments only. Input must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Multiple rates on commitment contracts required for each amount input. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearOverride

        public void clearOverride()
        Clear the collection of Override
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains all the override messages which the user has confirmed during input. At validation,the system may generate a series of screen override messages to indicate some anomaly within the transaction (e.g. maturity date is not a working day for this currency). User may change the data or override the message. If the contract is subsequently displayed or printed, all override messages are shown. Validation Rules: (System generated. Multivalue field.) This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearParticipantNo

        public void clearParticipantNo()
        Clear the collection of ParticipantNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the identity of the relevant participant. An expansion in this field results in the expansion of all syndicate related fields. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric customer number or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) customer mnemonic. (Mandatory input. Multivalue field.) Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Permitted for Syndicated loan and Syndicated Commitment contracts only. If the value in SYNDICATE.AGT is other than "AGENT" then this information will be held on a memorandum basis only. The borrower cannot be a participant.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearPrinAddress

        public void clearPrinAddress()
        Clear the collection of PrinAddress
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the Principal Amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified, or it will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) For Loans, DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits, PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Once a Loan contract has been authorised any amendment will impact future events only. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited when input in both PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 and PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or PRIN.BEN.BANK.2.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearStmtNo

        public void clearStmtNo()
        Clear the collection of StmtNo
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Number to identify either a Statement Entry or a Category Entry in respect of the contract. When a new contract is input,there will be an entry on the Drawdown Account and field entries will be generated e.g. Value .1 STMT NO. 664445752.06 Value .2 STMT NO. 1 Value .3 STMT NO. 1 where value .1 indicates a reference number unique to the transaction, and value .2 indicates the number of events which have occurred in relation to this transaction, Value .3 indicates a Category Entry reference no.These suffices can be appended to the unique reference no. for the purpose of 'SEEing' information on the terminal screen. Validation Rules: 11 Numeric characters of the form: nnnnnnnnn.nn System generated Multivalue field This field is NOINPUT

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • clearWalkInCust

        public void clearWalkInCust()
        Clear the collection of WalkInCust
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates a) the name and the address of any short term or 'casual' walk in customer or b) an alternative address for correspondence purposes. This field will be used where a branch does not wish to open a specific customer record for 'one off' or casual customers. It will be used in conjunction with a miscellaneous customer number. Alternatively this field will be used in instances where an existing customer requires correspondence to go to an alternative address. The values recorded here will always take priority over the values held on the customer record. This field can be changed at any point during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input. Default value = none.) Input prohibited unless a valid customer number is present in CUSTOMER.ID. Input in this field will generate an override message. Input prohibited if DELIVERY LINK is SWIFT.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        nothing

      • createLocalRefGroup

        public LocalRefGroup createLocalRefGroup(java.lang.String name)
        Create a new LocalRefGroup. This group must be then added to the list retrieved via a getLocalRefGroups.
        Throws a T24IllegalArgumentException if this fields is not a group of Local References (see LocalRefField.isGroup()())
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the local references. (See LOCAL.REF.TABLE)
        Returns:
        LocalRefGroup -

      • getAccrualParam

        public TField getAccrualParam()
        Returns the AccrualParam

        Field description: This field will hold a valid ID of EB.ACCRUAL.PARAM for the interest / commission / accrual calculations. Based on the definition of this field a contract can be configured to do the following, Include first day of the interest period and exclude the last of the interest period Exclude the first day of the interest period and include the last of the interest period. Include both first (only value date) and last day of accrual period. Adjust the principal increase and decrease effective dates for interest calculation and accrual calculation purposes. By default the field shall hold null in which case the system shall include first day of the interest period and exclude the last of the interest period. This would be a NOCHANGE field after authorization.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AccrualParam

      • getAccrualRate

        public TField getAccrualRate()
        Returns the AccrualRate

        Field description: Indicates a special conversion rate to be utilised in the conversion to local currency of the month-end interest and commission accruals. Monthly Profit and Loss accruals will be computed for reporting purposes using this rate instead of taking the CURRENCY table middle rate. This rate will be applicable during the current status only of the contract. For penalty interest, the system will not consider the value of this field but instead take the middle rate as defined in the CURRENCY table. The accruals will still be computed and held in the contract currency. Changes can be effected at any time during the life of the contract, but will impact future accruals only. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point of the form: 999999.9999 (Optional input) An override will be required if the value in this field is outside the tolerance indicated on the CURRENCY table. Input must not exceed a tolerance of 25%. Input in this field is allowed only if the currency of the contract is different from local currency. Input must be a positive value.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AccrualRate

      • getActivity

        public ActivityClass getActivity(int idx)
        Returns the Activity at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to return
        Returns:
        ActivityClass -
