        public List<ActivityClass> getActivity()
        Returns the unmodifiable collection of Activity
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<ActivityClass> -

      • getAgreementDate

        public TField getAgreementDate()
        Returns the AgreementDate

        Field description: Indicates the date when the contract was agreed. Indicates when the Loan or Deposit terms were agreed with the client. Validation Rules: Standard date format. (Optional Input. Default = system date.) Must be less than or equal to the value in VALUE.DATE. Must be a valid date. Cannot be a forward date. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. Once authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AgreementDate

      • getAloneMergeInd

        public TField getAloneMergeInd()
        Returns the AloneMergeInd

        Field description: Defines if customer remarks are to be included on customer advices. Defines whether the values in CUST.REMARKS are to be included on customer advices. A = Customer remarks will be sent as a separate advice. M = Customer remarks will be merged to the advice being sent as a result of the contract being entered. Validation Rules: 1 type AAA (alpha A-Z, a-z) character of the form: A = Alone M = Merged (Optional input.) Mandatory if a value has been input in CUST.REMARKS. A - Alone prohibited when DELIVERY LINK is via SWIFT or TELEX.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AloneMergeInd

      • getAmount

        public TField getAmount(int idx)
        Returns the Amount at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: The principal amount of the contract. In order to facilitate the efficient entry of the amount, an input feature has been provided which allows for the suppression of trailing zeros. e.g. INPUT VALUE 1T 1,000.00 2M 2,000,000.00 4.5B 4,500,000,000.00 The user may also input commas to assist in the entry of large amounts, the system will ignore their use and implement the amount based on the numeric input. This field will include the impact of principal increases (or decreases for Commitment contracts) plus the effect of capitalised interest. It therefore provides the user with a record of the maximum liability in relation to this contract. In the case of Syndications this field indicates the liability of the counterparty to the user and not to the syndicate as a whole. In case of Deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field, the system calculates the amount and populates the value in this field. The user may, if required, modify the system calculated amount either upwards or downwards. While doing so the system performs a tolerance check on the amount entered by the user based on the settings in LD.TXN.TYPE table for the relevant category code. The tolerance check could be either as a percentage on the system calculated amount or as an absolute amount on the system calculated amount. Beyond the permitted tolerance level an error message would be indicated. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Mandatory input. Multivalue field.) Value must be greater than Zero, unless SYNDICATE.AGT bears a value of "AGENT". Multiple amounts can be input for Commitment Contract types only. If the contract is linked to a commitment the amount must be less than or equal to the available amount indicated in COMMT.AVAIL.AMT. If linked to a commitment the value must be a multiple of D.D.MULT.AMT. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getAmount

        public List<TField> getAmount()
        Returns the collection of Amount

        Field description: The principal amount of the contract. In order to facilitate the efficient entry of the amount, an input feature has been provided which allows for the suppression of trailing zeros. e.g. INPUT VALUE 1T 1,000.00 2M 2,000,000.00 4.5B 4,500,000,000.00 The user may also input commas to assist in the entry of large amounts, the system will ignore their use and implement the amount based on the numeric input. This field will include the impact of principal increases (or decreases for Commitment contracts) plus the effect of capitalised interest. It therefore provides the user with a record of the maximum liability in relation to this contract. In the case of Syndications this field indicates the liability of the counterparty to the user and not to the syndicate as a whole. In case of Deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field, the system calculates the amount and populates the value in this field. The user may, if required, modify the system calculated amount either upwards or downwards. While doing so the system performs a tolerance check on the amount entered by the user based on the settings in LD.TXN.TYPE table for the relevant category code. The tolerance check could be either as a percentage on the system calculated amount or as an absolute amount on the system calculated amount. Beyond the permitted tolerance level an error message would be indicated. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Mandatory input. Multivalue field.) Value must be greater than Zero, unless SYNDICATE.AGT bears a value of "AGENT". Multiple amounts can be input for Commitment Contract types only. If the contract is linked to a commitment the amount must be less than or equal to the available amount indicated in COMMT.AVAIL.AMT. If linked to a commitment the value must be a multiple of D.D.MULT.AMT. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getAmountIncrease

        public TField getAmountIncrease()
        Returns the AmountIncrease

        Field description: The amount of increase or decrease in the principal amount of the contract. Represents the value of a principal increase or decrease. The amount specified here will be posted to the DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT with value date of AMT.V.DATE, unless a CANCELLATION.DATE is specified, when the movement will be posted to the cancellation suspense account, value the CANCELLATION.DATE. The effective date for intrest purposes of this amount is always the AMT.V.DATE. Validation Rules: 1-19 numeric characters plus decimal point and commas. (Optional input.) Input allowed in conjunction with AMOUNT.INCREASE.V.DATE field. Principal schedules must be redefined. Contract must have status CUR. One forward action can be outstanding at any one time. Override required for drawdowns under Commitment contracts with status of "PDO". Input prohibited prior to first authorisation of contract. Prohibited for contracts with either Interest or Commission or both on Special "S" Basis. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input of a decrease must be preceded by a '-' (negative sign). Decrease must be dated prior to the process date. Annuity contracts cannot have forward increases here (use a 'B' schedule) Input prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AmountIncrease

      • getAmtVDate

        public TField getAmtVDate()
        Returns the AmtVDate

        Field description: The effective date of the principal increase. The date when the principal increase becomes effective for interest purposes. The CANCELLATION.DATE may be entered if required to post the principal movement to the cancellation suspense account (Account Class record LDCANCEL). Validation Rules: Standard date format. (Optional input.) If less than process date, must be greater than the last interest or commission schedule date and date. If SUSPEND.INCOME is flagged to YES in the relevant category PD.PARAMETER, then back valuing cannot be for a date prior to the date on which OVERDUE.STATUS changed to NAB. Must be prior to first redefined principal repayment schedule. Cannot be greater than process date for Commitments, unless COMMIT.DRAWING is set to NO. Mandatory input if a value in AMOUNT.INCREASE. For discounted contracts date must coincide with next interest start period. For Commitments must not be prior to the last actioned date. One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Must be a valid date. Schedules must be redefined. Cannot be greater than the value in FIN.MAT.DATE. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. Input prohibited prior to first authorisation of contract. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited prior or equal to value date of Negotiated deal date of Principal, Interest or Commission.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AmtVDate

      • getAnnuityPayMethod

        public TField getAnnuityPayMethod()
        Returns the AnnuityPayMethod

        Field description: This field specifies the annuity payment method. Valid input is either BEGIN or END. BEGIN - payment due at beginning of period END - payment due at end of period When BEGIN is specified, the first payment will be principal repayment only. This field must be specified before 'A' schedule can be used in the LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE screen. Validation Rules: Optional input field. No default value. Mandatory input field if 'A' schedule is to be used. This is a NOCHANGE field. If this field is invoked, currency of the PRIN.LIQ.ACCT & INT.LIQ.ACCT should be the same.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AnnuityPayMethod

      • getAnnuityRepayAmt

        public TField getAnnuityRepayAmt()
        Returns the AnnuityRepayAmt

        Field description: This field records the current annuity repayment amount of the LD contract. The value here can be based on a combination of Principal, Interest, Commission and Charges. Typically an Annuity amount is a fixed monthly payment, set for the contract period, to enable customers to have set repayment amounts. Ths necessitates using a formula which equalises the payments by including the Principal, Interest, Commisisons and charges. Validation Rules: This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AnnuityRepayAmt

      • getAssetClass

        public TField getAssetClass()
        Returns the AssetClass

        Field description: Indicates the asset classification for the contract. If the contract is eligible for Provisioning, system updates this field during COB according to the rules stated in ASSET.CLASS.PARAMETER. Allows Manual input as well (by changing PROVISION.METHOD field to MANUAL) to override the System classification. Accounting entries would be raised online in accordance with the new asset class. When PD exists for the contract, asset classification should match the Classification in the corresponding PD contract. Validation Rules: Input allowed only when PROVISION.METHOD is MANUAL Should be a valid key to LN.ASSET.CLASS table. Holds Null when there is no asset classification. Maximum of 3 Numeric characters.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AssetClass

      • getAssetReference

        public TField getAssetReference()
        Returns the AssetReference

        Field description: The ASSET.REGISTER key for Annuity leasing capital accruals. Validation Rules: Must be a valid ASSET.REGISTER key Can only be input for Annuity contracts, i.e. where ANNUITY.PAY.METHOD is set to BEGIN or END. The LMM.INSTALL.CONDS (record 1) must have the capital and financial charge categories set up, i.e. FIN.LEASE.REQ must be set to YES. The asset must be available for use or used by this contract, i.e. ASSET.STATUS = "OPEN" or TRANS.REF = this contract id. Currency of contract must equal ASSET.REGISTER currency Drawdown account must equal ASSET.REGISTER asset account number The contract amount must equal the asset ORIGINAL.VALUE If ASSET.REGISTER SCHED.TYPE is set then the only permissible type is "CA" The residual amount on this loan contract must equal the absolute value of the ASSET.REGISTER RESIDUAL.VALUE.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AssetReference

      • getAuditDateTime

        public String getAuditDateTime()
        Returns the AuditDateTime
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The AuditDateTime

      • getAuditorCode

        public String getAuditorCode()
        Returns the AuditorCode
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The AuditorCode

      • getAuthoriser

        public String getAuthoriser()
        Returns the Authoriser
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The Authoriser

      • getAutoScheds

        public TField getAutoScheds()
        Returns the AutoScheds

        Field description: If "yes", upon validation schedules will be created/redefined automatically by the system with inception and/or maturity actions only. All events will be processed by the system on the inception and/or maturity dates as applicable. Validation Rules: 1-3 alphabetic characters of the form: (Y)es (N)o (Optional input. Default = (Y)es.) (Y)es mandatory for Accounts Receivables, Sundries, Call and Notice Contracts. (Y)es prohibited for PERIODIC.MANUAL rate type. (Y)es prohibited for PERIODIC.AUTOMATIC interest rate type. (Y)es prohibited if the value in DEFINE.SCHEDS =(Y)es.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The AutoScheds

      • getBandLevelInd

        public TField getBandLevelInd()
        Returns the BandLevelInd

        Field description: Used in Commitment contracts when there are various commitment interest rates depending on the amount unused.It states whether the total amount unused is to be charged at a single rate (level),or whether the amount is split into several different bands,and each 'band' charged at a different rate. Level type Will charge interest on a 'level' method e.g. : AMT 1M rate 1/4 % = 0-1M charge 1/4 % AMT 4M rate 1/2 % = 1-4M charge 1/2 % AMT 5M rate 3/4 % = 4-5M charge 3/4 % So, 3M unused would be charged at 1/2 %, but if 4M is unused, the whole amount would be charged at 3/4 %. Banded type Will charge interest on a banded basis, e.g.: 1M rate 1/4 % = on first 1M charge 1/4 % 4M rate 1/2/% = on next 3M charge 1/2 % 5M rate 3/4 % = on final 1M charge 3/4 % e.g. If 4M unused, 1M would be charged at 1/4 %, and 3M charged at 1/2 %. Caution : The amounts and their respective rates can be input in any order, however, the system will take the largest amount as the Available Commitment Amount. e.g.: Field 4.1 2M Field 16.1 10 % Field 4.2 5M Field 16.2 5% Field 4.3 3M Field 16.3 3% Field 4.4 1M Field 16.4 2% will be sorted by the system to : 4.4 16.4 4.1 16.1 4.3 16.3 4.2 16.2 It is recommended that the last amount and rate should be commitment available amount, and previous amounts/rates represent sub-limits. Validation Rules: 1 type AAA (alpha) character of the form: B or L (Optional input.) Valid for Commitment contracts only. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed. Mandatory input if multivalues in AMOUNT. Input prohibited if the value in L.C.U.CALC.BASE is (O)riginal.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The BandLevelInd

      • getBaseDateKey

        public TField getBaseDateKey()
        Returns the BaseDateKey

        Field description: This field provides the user with the option to specify the basis under which subsequent event dates will be derived. The value in this field indicates to the system how the future event dates are to be computed. The values that can be input are : Base : The system will use the first scheduled date entered to compute the subsequent event date(s). Prev : The system will use the last computed schedule date in order to compute the subsequent event date. Validation Rules: Input allowed should be either BASE or PREV Input mandatory when the fields INTEREST.DUE.DATE or COMM.DUE.DATE are populated

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The BaseDateKey

      • getBenIntAcct

        public TField getBenIntAcct()
        Returns the BenIntAcct

        Field description: The Account details (number or name) of the ultimate beneficiary to be credited with the interest amount. This field concerns transfers where the customer is requesting the delivery of funds outside the branch. In the case where the customer is able to provide the branch with account details, such information may be entered in this field for use in the Payment and Receipt function. This field may be amended at any time during the life of the contract. 'Autorouting of payments' Standard payment details held on the Agency table for the contract customer will be used in this field when payment is required only if no input is made by the user. It is permitted to enter non-standard instructions whenever necessary. Validation Rules: 1-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input.) Optional input if a value in INT.BEN.BANK.1. Optional input if a value in INT.BEN.BANK.2. Optional input if a value in INT.ADDRESS. Valid for Deposit contracts only.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The BenIntAcct

      • getBenefPrinAcct

        public TField getBenefPrinAcct()
        Returns the BenefPrinAcct

        Field description: The Account details (number or name) of the ultimate beneficiary to be credited with the Principal Amount. This field concerns transfers where the customer is requesting the delivery of funds outside the branch. In the case where the customer is able to provide the branch with account details, such information may be entered in this field for use in the Payment and Receipt function. This field may be amended at any time during the life of the contract. 'Autorouting of payments' Standard payment details held on the Agency table for the contract customer will be used in this field when payment is required only if no input is made by the user. It is permitted to enter non-standard instructions whenever necessary. Validation Rules: 1-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input.) Optional input if a value in PRIN.ADDRESS. Optional input if a value in PRIN.BEN.BANK.1. Optional input if a value in PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for Commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The BenefPrinAcct

      • getBillNumber

        public List<TField> getBillNumber()
        Returns the collection of BillNumber

        Field description: Specifies the number of a Trade Bill to be discounted or re-discounted. Details of individual trade bills are held in the application BILL.REGISTER. In order to discount or rediscount a bill or bundle of bills the key should be entered in this field. This will default the following information: AMOUNT The value of the Bill from BILL REGISTER CUSTOMER The DRAWEE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER CURRENCY The CURRENCY of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER MATURITY.DATE The MATURITY.DATE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER consequently operations on bundles of bills can only be applied where the customer, currency and maturity date are the same. DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be discounted when they have first been ACCEPTED. A Bill is accepted using the MD.DEAL module, once accepted the status in the BILL.REGISTER is set to ACCEPTED. When a bill is discounted the bank takes ownership of the Bill in return for payment of an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity of the Bill. A discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to be paid. The amount to be paid is: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Discount Rate * No Days) where: Bill Amount is held in BILL.REGISTER, No.Days is the number of days between value date and maturity date. A Bill Discount transaction should therefore entered in the Loans and Deposits application as a Discounted Loan using the following fields: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = Discount Rate RE-DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be re-discounted when they have already been DISCOUNTED. A Bill is discounted as described above, ince discounted the status of the BILL.REGISTER record is set to DISCOUNTED. When a Bill is re-discounted the bank sells the Bill on in return for an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity date of the Bill. A re-discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to receive. The amount to be received can be calculated as: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Re-discount Rate * No Days) Once Bills are re-discounted they are no longer owned by the bank and should not appear in the books. The re-discount transaction is therefore entered as a deposit to offset the original discount. Since the discount and re-discount are unlikely to take place at the same rate, a profit or loss will be made on the rediscount transaction which should be realised immediately. In order to offset the discount transaction an amount is calculated based on the original discount rate for the remaining life of the Bill. This amount is held in the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC field for all bills, the resulting ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT should be accrued over the remaining life of the contract to offset the discount accrual. The remaining profit or loss from the re-discount is stored in the CHRG.AMNT fields (see BILL.REDISC.RATE for details). The sum of the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC and CHRG.AMNT fields is the total amount to be received. The following fields should be entered for a re-discount: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = 0 BILL.REDISC.RATE = Rediscount Rate Validation Rules: Up to 12 characters as defined for the BILL.NUMBER id for the BILL.REGISTER. (Optional input) Must be a valid bill number on the BILL.REGISTER file. A loan (discount) transaction can only be entered if the STATUS in BILL.REGISTER is ACCEPTED. A deposit (re-discount) transaction can only be entered if the STATUS in BILL.REGISTER is DISCOUNTED. The CURRENCY and DRAWEE must be the same for all Bills.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getBillNumber

        public TField getBillNumber(int idx)
        Returns the BillNumber at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Specifies the number of a Trade Bill to be discounted or re-discounted. Details of individual trade bills are held in the application BILL.REGISTER. In order to discount or rediscount a bill or bundle of bills the key should be entered in this field. This will default the following information: AMOUNT The value of the Bill from BILL REGISTER CUSTOMER The DRAWEE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER CURRENCY The CURRENCY of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER MATURITY.DATE The MATURITY.DATE of the Bill from BILL.REGISTER consequently operations on bundles of bills can only be applied where the customer, currency and maturity date are the same. DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be discounted when they have first been ACCEPTED. A Bill is accepted using the MD.DEAL module, once accepted the status in the BILL.REGISTER is set to ACCEPTED. When a bill is discounted the bank takes ownership of the Bill in return for payment of an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity of the Bill. A discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to be paid. The amount to be paid is: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Discount Rate * No Days) where: Bill Amount is held in BILL.REGISTER, No.Days is the number of days between value date and maturity date. A Bill Discount transaction should therefore entered in the Loans and Deposits application as a Discounted Loan using the following fields: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = Discount Rate RE-DISCOUNT of Bills Bills can only be re-discounted when they have already been DISCOUNTED. A Bill is discounted as described above, ince discounted the status of the BILL.REGISTER record is set to DISCOUNTED. When a Bill is re-discounted the bank sells the Bill on in return for an amount which will be greater the closer to the maturity date of the Bill. A re-discount rate is quoted which is used to calculate the amount to receive. The amount to be received can be calculated as: Bill Amount - (Bill Amount * Re-discount Rate * No Days) Once Bills are re-discounted they are no longer owned by the bank and should not appear in the books. The re-discount transaction is therefore entered as a deposit to offset the original discount. Since the discount and re-discount are unlikely to take place at the same rate, a profit or loss will be made on the rediscount transaction which should be realised immediately. In order to offset the discount transaction an amount is calculated based on the original discount rate for the remaining life of the Bill. This amount is held in the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC field for all bills, the resulting ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT should be accrued over the remaining life of the contract to offset the discount accrual. The remaining profit or loss from the re-discount is stored in the CHRG.AMNT fields (see BILL.REDISC.RATE for details). The sum of the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC and CHRG.AMNT fields is the total amount to be received. The following fields should be entered for a re-discount: INT.PAYMT.METHOD = 2 INTEREST.RATE = 0 BILL.REDISC.RATE = Rediscount Rate Validation Rules: Up to 12 characters as defined for the BILL.NUMBER id for the BILL.REGISTER. (Optional input) Must be a valid bill number on the BILL.REGISTER file. A loan (discount) transaction can only be entered if the STATUS in BILL.REGISTER is ACCEPTED. A deposit (re-discount) transaction can only be entered if the STATUS in BILL.REGISTER is DISCOUNTED. The CURRENCY and DRAWEE must be the same for all Bills.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getBillRediscRate

        public TField getBillRediscRate()
        Returns the BillRediscRate

        Field description: Specifies the rate to be used when Trade Bills are re-discounted. The bill or bills to be rediscounted are specfied in the BILL.NUMBER field, the details of each Bill are held in the BILL.REGISTER application. In order for a bill to be re-discounted it must first be discounted. When a bill is re-discounted a profit or loss will be made on the difference between the discount rate (held on Bill Register) and the Re-discount rate for the remaining period of the Bill. A profit is made is of the Discount rate is greater than the Re-discount rate. The profit and/or loss for all bills being re-discounted is recorded in the CHRG.AMNT fields together with a LMM.CHARGE.CONDITION code in the field CHRG.CODE. The codes defaulted are held in the field BILL.CHG.CODE in LMM.INSTALL.CONDS (value 1 is the profit code, value 2 is the loss code). The profit or loss for each bill is calculated as: Bill Amount * (Discount Rate - Re-discount Rate) * No.Days where Bill Amount and Discount Rate are held on BILL.REGISTER, and No.Days is the number of days between Value Date and ,Maturity Date according to the INTEREST.BASIS. The total amount to be recieved for the rediscount is the sum of the DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC and CHRG.AMNT fields. The DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC is the sum of the value of the original discount for the remaining term for all bills being re-discounted. This is calculated for each bill as: Bill Amount * Discount Rate * No days where Bill Amount and Discount Rate are held on BILL.REGISTER, and No.Days is the number of days between Value Date and ,Maturity Date according to the INTEREST.BASIS. Validation Rules: Optional Rate Field. Only allowed if BILL.NUMBER is entered. Only allowed for Deposit contracts

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The BillRediscRate

      • getBillTxnAmount

        public TField getBillTxnAmount()
        Returns the BillTxnAmount

        Field description: Holds the total amount to be paid or received for the discount or rediscount of Trade Bills respectively. Bills to be discounted/rediscounted are held in the BILL.NUMBER field, details of each Bill are held in BILL.REGISTER. For a Discount of Bills this is calculated as: The sum of Bill Amounts - (Sum of Bill Amounts * Discount Rate * No Days) where: Bill Amount is the amount of an individual Bill held in BILL.REGISTER Discount Rate is the INTEREST.RATE No Days is the number of days from the VALUE.DATE to FIN.MAT.DATE (i.e remaining to Maturity) For Rediscount of Bills this is calculated as: The sum of Bill Amounts - (Sum of Bill Amounts * Rediscount Rate * No Days) where: Bill Amount is the amount of an individual Bill held in BILL.REGISTER Rediscount Rate is the BILL.REDISC.RATE No Days is the number of days from the VALUE.DATE to FIN.MAT.DATE (i.e remaining to Maturity) Validation Rules: This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The BillTxnAmount

      • getBkToBkInfo

        public TField getBkToBkInfo(int idx)
        Returns the BkToBkInfo at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Provides instructions or additional information from the sending bank for the receiver, intermediary account with institution or beneficiary institution. Any details input by the user will be relayed to the receiver. Whenever this field is used in a message transmitted between countries with different languages, it is recommended that English is used. This field corresponds to field 72 on SWIFT messages, and must never be used for information for which another field is intended, or for instructions not required in a message. Validation Rules: Up to 35 characters (uppercase alpha or numeric) - Type S. Multivalue field. A maximum of 6 lines of 35 characters each will be allowed. If this field is used, the first multivalue must contain a code word followed by further information. All code words must be present on the SWIFT.CODE.WORDS files, and must be enclosed between slashes '/' at the beginning of the line. Further code words and information can be entered in subsequent multivalues, but additional information continued on a new line must be preceded by double slashes '//'.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getBkToBkInfo

        public List<TField> getBkToBkInfo()
        Returns the collection of BkToBkInfo

        Field description: Provides instructions or additional information from the sending bank for the receiver, intermediary account with institution or beneficiary institution. Any details input by the user will be relayed to the receiver. Whenever this field is used in a message transmitted between countries with different languages, it is recommended that English is used. This field corresponds to field 72 on SWIFT messages, and must never be used for information for which another field is intended, or for instructions not required in a message. Validation Rules: Up to 35 characters (uppercase alpha or numeric) - Type S. Multivalue field. A maximum of 6 lines of 35 characters each will be allowed. If this field is used, the first multivalue must contain a code word followed by further information. All code words must be present on the SWIFT.CODE.WORDS files, and must be enclosed between slashes '/' at the beginning of the line. Further code words and information can be entered in subsequent multivalues, but additional information continued on a new line must be preceded by double slashes '//'.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getBrokerAmount

        public TField getBrokerAmount()
        Returns the BrokerAmount

        Field description: Contains the amount of brokerage to be credit to the broker account specified in the broker currency defined above. If a brokerage amount has been entered above, then this field will identify the amount to be credited to the broker account. If no input is made a default will be calculated from the brokerage using the current mid market exchange rates. If the brokerage is specified in the same currency as the broker currency then the brokerage will be copied to this field. Validation Rules: Standard amount format for currency. (Optional Input. Default calculated from the brokerage at mid market rates.) Input is not allowed in this field when the broker code has not been entered. Input not allowed in this field if no BROKERAGE, or BROKERAGE.CCY has been specified. The amount must be in a valid format for the brokerage currency. Input not allowed for Internal or Negotiated deals.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The BrokerAmount

      • getBrokerCcy

        public TField getBrokerCcy()
        Returns the BrokerCcy

        Field description: The valid currency code of the Broker or the currency mnemonic. The system allows brokerage to be settled in any currency providing it has been set up in the brokerage conditions on the BROKER table. The user may enter the currency as an alpha code or its numeric equivalent. Validation Rules: 3 characters - type SSS (uppercase alpha) or 1-3 numeric characters currency code. (Input only allowed when brokerage has been entered.) Default as the first currency in the BROKER record field CCY.FOR.PAYMENT. The currency must appear on the CURRENCY table. The currency must be specified on the BROKER table. Input is not allowed in this field when the broker has not been specified. This field cannot be amended once the deal has been authorised.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The BrokerCcy

      • getBrokerCode

        public TField getBrokerCode()
        Returns the BrokerCode

        Field description: Indicates the Broker code or deal method that applies to the contract. Indicates the method under which the deal has been booked. This can be via a broker or telex/telephone. Validation Rules: 1-10 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input.) Must be a valid entry on the "BROKER" table or "FX DEAL METHOD".

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The BrokerCode

      • getBrokerage

        public TField getBrokerage()
        Returns the Brokerage

        Field description: Contains the amount of brokerage to be paid to the broker defined above. Expressed in terms of the deal currency. If no value is entered here but a broker code is defined above, then the system will attempt to calculate a default brokerage amount based on the conditions set up on the BROKER file. If an amount is calculated successfully then it will be defaulted in this field, and will be expressed in the deal currency. Validation Rules: 1-19 numeric characters. (Optional Input, Default calculated using the BROKER file.) Only allowed if broker code entered above. Input only allowed when BROKER CODE field is entered.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Brokerage

        Return the date/time of the creation of this class

        String - the date/time of the creation of this class

      • getBusDayDefn

        public List<TField> getBusDayDefn()
        Returns the collection of BusDayDefn

        Field description: Indicates those countries whose calendars must be checked with regard to holiday validation. The default value will be the Country of the currency of the Contract but the User can input any number of extra codes if required. For example, the country of the participants. Validation Rules: 4 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) The code must have a valid entry on the REGION/HOLIDAY table. Once authorised a change in this field will require redefinition of the schedules.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getBusDayDefn

        public TField getBusDayDefn(int idx)
        Returns the BusDayDefn at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Indicates those countries whose calendars must be checked with regard to holiday validation. The default value will be the Country of the currency of the Contract but the User can input any number of extra codes if required. For example, the country of the participants. Validation Rules: 4 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) The code must have a valid entry on the REGION/HOLIDAY table. Once authorised a change in this field will require redefinition of the schedules.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getCancellationDate

        public TField getCancellationDate()
        Returns the CancellationDate

        Field description: Specifies whether the principal change entered, usually a decrease, is for a cancellation of a bond issue. If a date is entered in this field the associated PRIN.INCREASE will be posted to an internal suspense account identified by the ACCOUNT.CLASS record LDCANCEL, instead of to the usual DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT. The date entered here is the value date used to post the accounting movements as a result of the principal change. The AMT.V.DATE entered is the effective date of the change for interest purposes. In the case of bonds any change in the nominal should be valued at the coupon period start in order to ensure that the correct amount of interest is calculated for settlement to the PRIN.LIQ.ACCT at the next coupon payment date. Validation Rules: Only allowed when AMOUNT.INCREASE is specified Cannot be prior to AMT.V.DATE

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CancellationDate

      • getCancelledInt

        public TField getCancelledInt(int idx)
        Returns the CancelledInt at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Contains the details of the cancelled interest amount by the split current month, previous month and previous year. The first multivalue specifies the amount for the current month, the second multivalue for the previous month and the third multivalue for the previous year. Validation Rules: Up to 19 type AMT numeric characters. (Multivalue field). This is a NOINPUT field. Multivalue 1 contains the interest amount for the current month. Multivalue 2 contains the interest amount for the previous month. Multivalue 3 contains the interest amount for the previous year.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getCancelledInt

        public List<TField> getCancelledInt()
        Returns the collection of CancelledInt

        Field description: Contains the details of the cancelled interest amount by the split current month, previous month and previous year. The first multivalue specifies the amount for the current month, the second multivalue for the previous month and the third multivalue for the previous year. Validation Rules: Up to 19 type AMT numeric characters. (Multivalue field). This is a NOINPUT field. Multivalue 1 contains the interest amount for the current month. Multivalue 2 contains the interest amount for the previous month. Multivalue 3 contains the interest amount for the previous year.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getCapitalisation

        public TField getCapitalisation()
        Returns the Capitalisation

        Field description: Indicates whether automatic capitalisation of accrued interest will occur. This field has been defined to permit the automatic capitalisation of interest at each interest due date on all transaction types. It is possible to modify this field throughout the life of a contract i.e. even after the contract has been authorised. The system will combine the principal amount with the full amount of interest accrued and will continue until the final maturity date is reached. However, if the interest on a deposit transaction is subject to local taxes, only the net amount of the interest will be capitalised and the amount of taxes will be credited to the corresponding tax sundry account. Validation Rules: 1-3 alpha characters of the form: (Y)es or (N)o. (Optional input. Default value = NO). Prohibited if interest is discounted. Only allowed for liquidation codes 1 or 2. If capitalisation = (Y)es, then "I" schedules must be defined in LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE or interest frequency should be defined in INT.DUE.DATE field (in case of bullet repayment contracts). Prohibited for Commitment contracts, Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Prohibited for contracts of less than 2 days duration. Prohibited if Interest Basis is "S" - Special. Prohibited for contracts with Withholding Tax. Prohibited for drawdowns under Commitment contracts. For deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field, the period of capitalisation should be in multiples of months. Further each period of capitalisation must be uniform. No input allowed if FIN.MAT.DATE is less than or equal to process date.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Capitalisation

      • getCategory

        public TField getCategory()
        Returns the Category

        Field description: Contains the Category Code to which this transaction will be assigned. The Category code must be within the following ranges for the Loans and Deposits Application:

        Contract TypeDescriptionCategory Range
        DEPOSITDeposit21001 - 21039
        SUNDRYSundry Deposit21045 - 21049
        LOANLoan21050 - 21074
        ACC.RECAccount Receivable21090 - 21094
        COMMITMENTCommitment21095 - 21099
        LIAB COMMITMENTLiability Commitment21101 - 21105
        Reserved for future21106 - 21124
        Validation Rules: 1-5 numeric characters. (Mandatory input.) Must exist on the CATEGORY table. Once authorised the contract Category code can be changed only to another number within the original Category range.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Category

      • getCentralBankCode

        public TField getCentralBankCode()
        Returns the CentralBankCode

        Field description: A free format field. The content and validation of this field to be defined locally. Validation Rules: 1-10 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input.) No validation.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CentralBankCode

      • getChrgCode

        public List<ChrgCodeClass> getChrgCode()
        Returns the unmodifiable collection of ChrgCode
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<ChrgCodeClass> -

      • getChrgCode

        public ChrgCodeClass getChrgCode(int idx)
        Returns the ChrgCode at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to return
        Returns:
        ChrgCodeClass -

      • getChrgLiqAcct

        public TField getChrgLiqAcct()
        Returns the ChrgLiqAcct

        Field description: Represents the account to which the fees/charges will be debited. This field indicates the account which will be debited with any charges applicable to a Loan or Deposit contract. Fees and Charges are always expressed in the contract currency. If the account, through which delivery is to be made is not known, the user can choose to enter one digit (from 1-9) which will identify a text defined in LMM.TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the customer. This will also result in the funds being applied to an interim suspsense account in the applicable currency (as set in ACCOUNT.CLASS record SUSPLMMDR or SUSPLMMCR). This field can be changed at any time; such changes will not be retrospective. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner proceeds for settlement may directly be drawn down from an account denominated in any currency. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters-relating to a Customer Account or a Nostro Account. or 3-10 alphanumeric account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default = Principal liquidation account.) Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. The system will check for account posting restrictions and require an override if necessary.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ChrgLiqAcct

      • getCleanRisk

        public TField getCleanRisk()
        Returns the CleanRisk

        Field description: Indicates whether the transaction is construed to be clean risk or not. This field can be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-3 alpha type AAA (A-Z, a-z) characters of the form: (Y)es or (N)o (Optional input.) Input must be (Y)es or (N)o. Input prohibited for Deposit contract types. Input prohibited for Sundry Deposit contract types.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CleanRisk

      • getCoCode

        public String getCoCode()
        Returns the CoCode
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The CoCode

      • getComLiqAcct

        public TField getComLiqAcct()
        Returns the ComLiqAcct

        Field description: Represents the account to which the commissions will be debited or credited. The defaulting process looks firstly at the SEC.ACC.MASTER record using the portfolio no, If no default found uses the CUSTOMER.CCY.ACCT record and finally if still no default found takes details from the AGENCY record and NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. These settings can be overriden by using ACCOUNT.PARAMETER to set the account default method. This field indicates the account which will be debited with the commissions applicable to a Loan or Commitment transaction plus the taxes associated with the commissions with COMM.PAYMT.METHOD of 1 or 2. This field indicates the account which will be credited with the commissions applicable to a Loan or Commitment transaction less the taxes associated with the commissions with COMM.PAYMT.METHOD of 3. If the account through which delivery is to be made is not known the User can choose to enter one digit (from 1 to 9) which will identify the text (defined in LMM.TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the customer. This will result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. This field can be changed at any time during the life of the contract; such changes will not be retrospective. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner proceeds for settlement may directly be drawn down from/to an account denominated in any currency. Validation Rules: 1-14 alphanumeric characters relating to a Customer Account, a Nostro Account or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default=INT.LIQ.ACCT.) A NOSTRO account cannot be used when commission is payable (COMM.PAYMT.METHOD = 3) Input allowed for Loan or Commitment transactions only. The system will check for account posting restrictions and require an override if necessary. Input not allowed if commission values not specified. Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ComLiqAcct

      • getComRateVDate

        public TField getComRateVDate()
        Returns the ComRateVDate

        Field description: The effective date of the new commission rate. To be used in conjunction with NEW COM RATE. Validation Rules: Standard date format. (Optional input.) Cannot be a forward date. Must be a valid date. If back-valued, must not be before last 'C' schedule. Mandatory input if a value in NEW COM RATE, otherwise input prohibited. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input allowed for Loans and Commitments only. Input prohibited prior to first authorisation of contract. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited prior or equal to value date of Negotiated deal for Commission.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ComRateVDate

      • getComReserve1

      • getCommCalcMethod

        public TField getCommCalcMethod()
        Returns the CommCalcMethod

        Field description: Loans & Deposits can accept the following types:

        KeyDays/Denominator
        A 360/360
        A1 360/360*
        A2 360/360*
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        F1 360/365*
        F2 360/365*
        S Special
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS INTEREST.BASIS If basis "S" is used and no schedules have been defined then the system will require an entry in TOTAL.COMM.AMOUNT If schedules have been defined the system will require the sum of the commission schedules to be within a tolerance of 5% when compared with the product of principal value * rate * period. In both the above cases the difference will be compensated for within the last accrual period thus agreeing with the user defined commission amount. Depending on the value set in LMM.INSTALL.CONDS in field S.BASIS.RATE.VAL Validation Rules: 1 -2 alphanumeric character of the form: A B C D E F S (Optional input. Default value = CURRENCY table value.) Input allowed for Loan and Commitment contract types only. Commission basis "S" valid for fixed rate contracts only. Commission basis "S" is prohibited for Call/Notice contracts. Principal schedules can be defined for the principal maturity event only when basis "S" has been specified. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. Commission basis "S" is prohibited for Commitment contracts if the value in LCU.CALC.BASE Commission basis "S" is prohibited for discounted contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommCalcMethod

      • getCommDueDate

        public TField getCommDueDate()
        Returns the CommDueDate

        Field description: Indicates next commission due date and associated frequency code for contracts where schedules are not defined through LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and where principal repayment is bullet in nature In case of call/notice contracts, the system will produce a single schedule for the first period. Upon reaching the scheduled event date a subsequent schedule will be generated based on the values in this field. In case of fixed maturity contracts, schedules are generated up to maturity of the contract. Example: a) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = at one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a monthly end date. b) 31 MAR 1986 M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = at three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a quarter end date. c) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 10 M=Monthly, 01 = at monthly intervals 10 = 10 d) M01 e) 31 MAR 1986 W , where W= weekly. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31 f) 31 Mar 1986 BSNSS, where BSNSS = every business day. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31 g) The values defined in the EB.FREQUENCY table will also be accepted in this field. The value so input will be In case of Call/Notice contracts, if there is no input in this field, the total commission amount would not be calculated. Accruals would however take place at the commission % defined till maturity of the contract. Validation Rules: Standard date format. The definition of schedules in LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE is prohibited In the case of fixed maturity contracts, AUTO.SCHEDS field should be set to 'YES' Must be a valid date. An override will be required for Call/Notice contracts if there is no input in this field. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited if commission has not been defined on the contract. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Input prohibited for Deposit contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommDueDate

      • getCommPaymtMethod

        public TField getCommPaymtMethod()
        Returns the CommPaymtMethod

        Field description: Indicates if the commission has to be paid in advance or in arrears, or if commission is payable by the bank in arrears. On an interest bearing contract the commission accrues on the face value of the contract. At maturity the value of the contract will equal the principal value + interest + commission On a discounted contract the commission is taken at the start of the transaction. At maturity the value of the contract will equal the principal value + interest only. On a commission payable contract the commission accrues on the face value of the contract. At maturity, or commission scheduled payment date, the customer of the loan will be credited with the commission amount. The following values have been defined: '1' = Interest bearing contracts For a one period contract, the commission will be collected on the maturity date. For contracts with various commission schedules, the commission will be collected in arrears on the scheduled commission maturity dates. '2' = Discounted basis contracts The discount deducted in advance is reported as unearned commission. The discount is accrued on a straightline basis during the life of the contract. For contracts with various commission schedules the commission will be collected at the inception of each scheduled interest period. In this case, if no payment is received, the user will always liquidate the next discounted interest due against a receivable or transit account. After final maturity, the system will automatically change the 'discounted' payment type to 'interest bearing' payment type. Discounted contracts will be converted to interest bearing if principal is outstanding on the maturity/event date. Any future accruals will be handled on an interest bearing basis however the current portion will remain on a discounted basis. Commission Payable Contracts For a bullet (one period) contract, the commission will be paid on the maturity date. For contracts with various commission schedules, the commission will be paid in arrears on the scheduled commission maturity dates. Validation Rules: 1 numeric character of the form: 1 = Interest bearing. 2 = Discounted. 3 = Commission Payable (Optional input. Default = 1) Input allowed for Loan and Commitment contract types only. Discounted method prohibited for Call and Notice contracts. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. Mandatory input if a value in COMM.RATE. Discounted method prohibited for Commitments. The discounted method is prohibited if Commission Basis "S" is selected.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommPaymtMethod

      • getCommRate

        public List<TField> getCommRate()
        Returns the collection of CommRate

        Field description: Indicates the annual commission rate applicable to the contract. This is the rate used for commission computation purposes on Loan and Commitment contracts. For Commitments contracts any rates input are tied to values input in AMOUNT. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. Multivalue field for Commitments only. Optional input. Default = NO COMM RATE). Input allowed for Loan and Commitment contract types only. Mandatory input if a value in COMM.PAYMT.METHOD. Must be greater than zero. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. Mandatory input if a value in TOTAL.COMM.AMOUNT.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getCommRate

        public TField getCommRate(int idx)
        Returns the CommRate at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Indicates the annual commission rate applicable to the contract. This is the rate used for commission computation purposes on Loan and Commitment contracts. For Commitments contracts any rates input are tied to values input in AMOUNT. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. Multivalue field for Commitments only. Optional input. Default = NO COMM RATE). Input allowed for Loan and Commitment contract types only. Mandatory input if a value in COMM.PAYMT.METHOD. Must be greater than zero. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. Mandatory input if a value in TOTAL.COMM.AMOUNT.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getCommitDrawing

        public TField getCommitDrawing()
        Returns the CommitDrawing

        Field description: Specifies whether for commitment contracts, Loans are allowed to draw from the facility. Commitment contract may be recorded by the system but may never be linked to a Loan. In these cases the amount may be managed manually by performing principal increases and decreases, or defining a schedule for the notional principal amount. When this field is set to NO, principal schedules may be defined for the commitment contract. Validation Rules: Only allowed for commitment contracts (category 21-095 to 21-099). Cannot be set to NO if a Loan is already linked.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommitDrawing

      • getCommitmentNo

        public TField getCommitmentNo()
        Returns the CommitmentNo

        Field description: The reference number of the Commitment contract. Indicates the reference number of the Commitment. It is this field which establishes the linkage of a loan or deposit contract (drawdown) to a Commitment. There are two types of Commitment contracts, a liability type which can have linked deposits as drawings; and an asset type which can have linked loan contracts. Upon a Commitment reaching its maturity date any unused commitment balance will be reset to zero. If COMMIT.DRAWING is set to NO no drawdowns can be linked. Once a drawdown is linked to a Commitment it will not be possible to reverse the Commitment; it will need to be early matured. Early maturity of this Commitment will require an override. If the Commitment is early matured any Loan or Deposit contract tied to such a Commitment will operate independently thereafter. Validation Rules: 12 type AA (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input.) Must be a valid Commitment reference for use by the customer of the contract. Input prohibited for Sundry and Accounts Receivable contracts. Input prohibited for Commitment or Liability Commitment contracts. Allowed for Loan contracts only if the commitment it is paired with is in the category range 21095-21099. Allowed for Deposit contracts only if the commitment it is paired with is in the category range 21101-21105. Once authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommitmentNo

      • getCommtAvailAmt

        public TField getCommtAvailAmt()
        Returns the CommtAvailAmt

        Field description: Indicates the amount available under this Commitment. The value in this field indicates the Available or Unused amount remaining on this Commitment contract. At no time can this be a negative value. If multiple tranches were defined - The first updation would be for value in the corresponding TRANCHE.AMT field for the first D.D.START.DATE. The field would continue to get updated as and when there are loan drawings. When the next D.D.START.DATE is reached, depending on the value in L.C.U.TYPE, either the second TRANCHE.AMT would be written or the residual of the earlier tranche(s) would be aggregated with the new tranche amount and written For LCU.TYPE values R & N, value in this field would get reversed out on the D.D.END.DATE of the last tranche, if REV.CONTINGENT were flagged to DED. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (System generated value). This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommtAvailAmt

      • getCommtReinitiate

        Returns the CommtReinitiate

        Field description: Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CommtReinitiate

      • getCompoundType

        public TField getCompoundType()
        Returns the CompoundType

        Field description: Optional field to specify the number of compounding periods per year. It can hold values DAILY, WEEKn, Mnn or Nnn. Compounding of interest or commission will not happen when this field is set to NULL.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CompoundType

      • getCompoundYieldMethod

        public TField getCompoundYieldMethod()
        Returns the CompoundYieldMethod

        Field description: Field to indicate the Daily compounding method. The field can hold values YIELD or NULL. This field is used to default the daily compounding method in LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS. Validation Rules: Value can be set to YIELD only when the COMPOUND.TYPE is DAILY.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CompoundYieldMethod

      • getContractGrp

        public TField getContractGrp()
        Returns the ContractGrp

        Field description: Allows particular groups of contracts to be identified. For example all fixed term deposits over a certain equivalent value in a particular currency. The conditions which define a particular group are defined using the APPL.GEN.CONDITION Application or LD.GROUP.CONDITION. Each time the contract is changed the conditions are re-evaluated which can result in a new CONTRACT.GRP code. This code can be defined in the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION application to refer to a particular tax code, in conjuction with the relevant customer group conditon. If the CONTRACT.GRP changes then this may well result in new codes being allocated to the relevant TAX.PRINCIPAL.KEY, TAX.INTEREST.KEY and TAX.COMMISSION.KEY fields being updated. Validation Rules: System written field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ContractGrp

      • getContractType

        public TField getContractType()
        Returns the ContractType

        Field description: Defines the type of Loan or Deposit contract with respect to the scheduled payments/repayments. The contract will be either a BULLET or AMORTising contract. For a BULLET contract the only events are initial drawdown and maturity. There are no other scheduled events (apart from payments linked to the drawdown and maturity). A contract of this type will be entered using AUTO.SCHEDS set to YES. An AMORTising contract has other scheduled events aparat form initial drawdown and maturity. Other events will be defined using the LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE application, invoked by DEFINE.SCHEDS set to YES. A contract may be changed from BULLET to AMORTising, or vice-versa by changing the definition of the AUTO.SCHEDS and DEFINE.SCHEDS.fields. Change from AMORT to BULLET requires an override, overrides are given whenever schedules are redefined. This field is set at authorisation depending on the value of AUTO.SCHEDS and DEFINE.SCHEDS. Validation Rules: This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ContractType

      • getConversionType

        public TField getConversionType()
        Returns the ConversionType

        Field description: The conversion type, BUY, SELL or MID that is to be used. Associated with field SETTLEMENT.MARKET. Default conversion type that is to be used if no input is made in EV.APPL.RATE in SETTLEMENT.RATES table for the deal. The settings in this field would govern the exchange rate derived by the system given the settlement market and the currencies involved. The conversion type set here is only reckoned for liquidation during SOD & EOD and not for online liquidation. Examples

        DealUSD
        LiquidationDEM
        DEM exchange 1.72/1.69
        Exchange rate derivedDEM buy rate = 1.72
        DealGBP
        LiquidationDEM
        GBP exchange rate1.45/1.55
        DEM exchange 1.72/1.69
        Exchange rate derivedDEM buy rate * GBP mid rate (1.72 * 1.5) = 2.58
        DealDEM
        LiquidationGBP
        GBP exchange rate1.45/1.55
        DEM exchange 1.72/1.69
        Exchange rate derivedGBP mid rate*DEM sell rate (1.5 * 1.69) = 2.535
        CONVERSION.TYPE : SELL
        DealUSD
        LiquidationDEM
        DEM exchange 1.72/1.69
        Exchange rate derivedDEM sell rate = 1.69
        DealGBP
        LiquidationDEM
        GBP exchange rate1.45/1.55
        DEM exchange 1.72/1.69
        Exchange rate derivedDEM sell rate * GBP mid rate (1.69 * 1.5) = 2.535
        DealDEM
        LiquidationGBP
        GBP exchange rate1.45/1.55
        DEM exchange 1.72/1.69
        Exchange rate derivedGBP mid rate*DEM buy rate (1.5*1.72) = 2.58
        CONVERSION.TYPE : MID
        DealUSD
        LiquidationDEM
        DEM exchange 1.72/1.69
        Exchange rate derivedDEM mid rate = 1.705
        DealGBP
        LiquidationDEM
        GBP exchange rate1.45/1.55
        DEM exchange 1.72/1.69
        Exchange rate derivedDEM mid rate* GBP mid rate (1.705 * 1.5) = 2.5575
        DealDEM
        LiquidationGBP
        GBP exchange rate1.45/1.55
        DEM exchange 1.72/1.69
        Exchange rate derivedGBP mid rate* DEM mid rate (1.705 * 1.5) = 2.5575
        Note : The system would arrive at the cross rate by using the mid rate of the stronger currency at one end and the appropriate rate (BUY/SELL) for the other end. When a LD schedule is processed, there can be cases when only a portion of the dues get liquidated into the account and the balance written to PD ( USE.AVBL.FUNDS flagged to YES in PD.PARAMETER). If there is user defined rate in SETTLEMENT.RATES file, the entire liquidation (Account & PD) would happen at this rate. Note that in such cases Local Currency Equivalent of the PD created would not be arrived using MID rate. Validation Rules: 4 character alpha character. Allowed values are only BUY, SELL or MID Default value is MID

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ConversionType

      • getCountryExposure

        public TField getCountryExposure()
        Returns the CountryExposure

        Field description: The country code representing the country where the exposure is deemed to reside. The values in this field will be used for country of exposure information purposes. Validation Rules: 2 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. Default value = COUNTRY.RISK code.) Must be a valid code on the COUNTRY table. Input allowed for Loan contracts only. This field can be changed at any time during the life of the contract.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CountryExposure

      • getCountryRisk

        public TField getCountryRisk()
        Returns the CountryRisk

        Field description: The country code representing the country where the credit risk is deemed to reside. This field will be used for the generation of country risk information. Validation Rules: 2 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. Default value = country of the borrower.) Must be a valid code on the COUNTRY table. Input allowed for Loan transactions only. This field can be changed at any time during the life of the contract.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CountryRisk

        Parameters:

        List<TField> -

      • getCsnCalcType

        public TField getCsnCalcType()
        Returns the CsnCalcType

        Field description: Where Commission is used on a contract the basis for the calculation can be either the Current Principal amount (at the time of the commission charge) or on the Highest Balance during the commission period. Validation Rules: Default is blank Allowed for Interest bearing, discounted and annuity contracts. Values of HB or blank allowed

        Parameters:

        TField - The CsnCalcType

      • getCurrPdPrAmt

        public TField getCurrPdPrAmt()

        Field description: Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CurrPdPrAmt

      • getCurrency

        public TField getCurrency()
        Returns the Currency

        Field description: Indicates the contract currency. This field indicates the currency of the contract. This need not be in the same currency as the liquidation and drawdown accounts indicated on the contract. Validation Rules: 3 alphabetic currency mnemonic or 1-3 numeric character currency code. (Optional input. Defaults to local currency.) The currency code or mnemonic must exist on the CURRENCY table. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Currency

      • getCurrencyCode

        public List<CurrencyCodeClass> getCurrencyCode()
        Returns the unmodifiable collection of CurrencyCode
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<CurrencyCodeClass> -

      • getCurrencyCode

        public CurrencyCodeClass getCurrencyCode(int idx)
        Returns the CurrencyCode at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to return
        Returns:
        CurrencyCodeClass -

      • getCurrencyMarket

        public TField getCurrencyMarket()
        Returns the CurrencyMarket

        Field description: Identifies the Currency Market relative to this transaction. This field will be applicable to those users where the exchange control authorities have defined different markets for foreign currency dealing. Validation Rules: 1 numeric digit Currency Market code. (Optional input. Default = 1) Must be a valid code on the CURRENCY.MARKET table. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CurrencyMarket

      • getCustRemarks

        public TField getCustRemarks(int idx)
        Returns the CustRemarks at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Narrative to be printed on the customers confirmations and advices. The remarks entered in this field are printed on confirmations/advices to the customer. The remarks are deleted from the contract (written to history) once they have been printed. Any amendments to this field will impact on the subsequent confirmation/ advice. Validation Rules: Free format of up to 4 lines maximum 35 type (alphanumeric) characters per line. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Only 4 lines allowed. Mandatory input if a value in field ALONE.MERGE.IND.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getCustRemarks

        public List<TField> getCustRemarks()
        Returns the collection of CustRemarks

        Field description: Narrative to be printed on the customers confirmations and advices. The remarks entered in this field are printed on confirmations/advices to the customer. The remarks are deleted from the contract (written to history) once they have been printed. Any amendments to this field will impact on the subsequent confirmation/ advice. Validation Rules: Free format of up to 4 lines maximum 35 type (alphanumeric) characters per line. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Only 4 lines allowed. Mandatory input if a value in field ALONE.MERGE.IND.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getCustomerId

        public TField getCustomerId()
        Returns the CustomerId

        Field description: The counterparty to the contract. This is the identification number or mnemonic assigned to the Customer. The System will use this number to: a) Identify the Counterparty of the transaction. b) Obtain the Customer's name and address for inclusion on all contracts and advices produced by this module. If WALK.IN.CUST is completed, this will override the details on the customer record. Validation Rules: 3-10 alphanumeric customer mnemonic or 1-10 numeric character customer number. (Mandatory input.) Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed. Must be equal to Commitment customer for drawdowns under commitments.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CustomerId

      • getCustomerRef

        public TField getCustomerRef()
        Returns the CustomerRef

        Field description: Defines the customer's own reference number. The reference number input in this field will be printed on all advices and confirmations, etc. with the bank's contract number. This field may be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-16 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input.) Must be valid SWIFT characters.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The CustomerRef

      • getDDMultAmt

        public List<TField> getDDMultAmt()
        Returns the collection of DDMultAmt

        Field description: Drawdowns can be expressed in multiples of this amount. The value will be construed to be in the currency of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Must be less than or equal to the commitment amount. Valid for Commitment contracts only.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

Valid for Commitment contracts only.

      • getDaysPreAdvice

        public TField getDaysPreAdvice()
        Returns the DaysPreAdvice

        Field description: Customer notice by the system is required for an event; scheduled payment, interim interest or final maturity reminder etc. Days Pre Advice is the number of days before an event that a confirmations notice will be sent out. If populated this field is the chosen field of priority regardless of what is held in LMM.ADVICES. Validation Rules: Rule 1 A positive whole number. Rule 2

        Parameters:

      • getDealerDesk

        public TField getDealerDesk()

        Field description: Identifies the dealer desk relating to the transaction. Validation Rules: 2 alphanumeric characters in the range A-Z, a-z, plus 0-9 Mandatdory field. Default taken from user profile (Field 41), Input Optional. Must be an existing code on the DEALER.DESK table.
