      • getDefaultedValue

        public TField getDefaultedValue()
        Returns the DefaultedValue

        Field description: This field will indicate whether the INTEREST RATE / KEY & SPREAD LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION & LD.GROUP.CONDITION. If INTEREST RATE / KEY & SPREAD 'YES' If user inputs INTEREST RATE / KEY & SPREAD 'NO' The value in the field is used to determine whether this contract has to be selected during EOD LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION or LD.GROUP.CONDITION If this field holds the value 'YES' LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION LD.GROUP.CONDITION END OF DAY. Validation Rules: System written field. Will hold value YES NO.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DefaultedValue

      • getDefineScheds

        public TField getDefineScheds()
        Returns the DefineScheds

        Field description: If "yes", upon validation the system will automatically take the user to the schedule define screen where interim schedules can be defined manually or semi-automatically. The user will have to specify the scheduled actions which are to occur over the life of the contract. Such actions can include principal, interest, commission, fees, margin revisions, rate revisions or diary actions. The aforementioned actions are not restricted to inception or maturity events. In the case of participating Syndications the values within the schedules represents the users (00) portion only; the syndications portions are computed based on these values and the percentages indicated within the syndication fields of the contract. For Syndications where the user is a non participating agent the values defined within the schedules represent the Syndication as a whole. Upon responding YES to DEFINE SCHEDS and validating the contract the system will take you to the following input screen: :LOANS DEPOSITS TESTING LD.SCHEDULE DEFINE 111 : :222 333 444 555 666 : :777 INT: 888 COM:999 : :: :FORWARD.BACKWARD KEY:A1 BASE.DATE KEY:B1 : :SCH DATE AMOUNT/DIARY ACTION RATE CHRG NO FREQ: :C1 C2 C3 C4 C5 C6 C7: : : : : : : : : :: Where the following 9 items are supplied by the system: 111 = Contract number. 222 = Currency mnemonic. 333 = Amount of contract. (or Principal to be re-defined inclusive of forward dated principal increases) 444 = Start date of contract. 555 = Maturity date of contract. 666 = Payment method and category. 777 = Customer mnemonic. 888 = Interest rate type and interest basis. 999 = Commission rate type and commission calculation method. The following information has to be input by the user: A1 = forward/backward key where: 1 = forward 2 = backward 3 = fwd same month 4 = not automatic(default) When the user wishes the system to generate a series of schedules automatically this code will indicate the response if the derived day is a non-working day. If the derived day is a non working day the system response will be: 1 = forward The system will go forward to the next working day. 2 = backward The system will go backward to the last working day. 3 = fwd same month The system will go forward to the next working day provided it is within the same month. If it is not within the same month the system will go backward. 4 = not automatic The user must specify each and every event date. If non-working days are specified the system will prompt for overrides. B1 = base date key where: 1 = base 2 = previous 3 = not automatic (default) This code indicates to the system how the future event dates are to be computed. 1 = base The system will use the first scheduled date entered to compute the subsequent event date(s). 2 = previous The system will use the last computed schedule date in order to compute the subsequent event date. 3 = not automatic The user will enter each and every event date. This option is only valid if the forward/backward key = 4 not automatic. C1 = schedule type i.e. "P" = principal "I" = interest "C" = commission "R" = revision "M" = margin "F" = fees "D" = diary "S" = settlement (system) "A" = advice (system) Not all codes are allowed ie Commitments cannot have principal repayment or margin amendments. Combinations are allowed where the schedule is valid for the components ie principal and interest. C2 = schedule event date ie . DDMMM DDMMMYY DDMMMYYYY DDMMYY DDMMM DDMM YYYYMMDD DD This is the end date of the first period and the starting date for the next/all subsequent events. C3 = amount of schedule or diary narrative. This field indicates the amount of an action or the appropriate diary narrative. An amount can be up to 14 characters plus a decimal point; diary narrative is 35 characters per line. C4 = the revision rate. This relates to the revision rate for either the interest or margin components. C5 = charge code. A valid charge code as defined on the CHARGES table. This field relates to fees and the fee currency will always be in the currency of the contract. C6 = number of scheduled events to occur. This field indicates the number of subsequent scheduled events that are to occur. C7 = frequency of the form nnnD = daily nnnM = monthly nnnQ = Quarterly nnnS = semi annually nnnA = annually with nnn = 1 to 999 and indicates the period between schedule event i.e. 4 D = every four days. Considerations for Syndications. When the user is "AGENT" and a participant the screen definition will relate to the participating agents share (type 00). The remainder of the syndicate detail will be computed based on the percentages indicated on the contract. When the user is "AGENT" and not a participant the screen definition relates to the syndicate definition as a whole (type 99). Validation Rules: 1-3 alphabetic characters of the form: (Y)es or (N)o (Optional input. Default = No.) FOR ALL SCHEDULE TYPES Schedule definition prohibited for Accounts Receivable, Sundries, Call and Notice Contracts. Schedule definition mandatory for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC Interest Rate type. Schedule definition mandatory for PERIODIC MANUAL Interest Rate type. Schedule definition prohibited if the value in AUTO SCHEDS = (Y)es. If unauthorised schedules exist, then input to DEFINE SCHEDS is prohibited. Changing from DEFINE SCHEDS to AUTO SCHEDS is prohibited for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC and PERIODIC MANUAL Interest Rate types. A valid date is mandatory for each schedule type. If a date is input it must be a valid date format. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date, as defined on the HOLIDAY table, is a non-working day. Input prohibited for dates prior to the value in the Field VALUE.DATE. Input prohibited for dates later than the value in the Field FIN.MAT.DATE. If an amount is input it must be a valid amount format. If a schedule type is input this must be of the form P, I, C, M, D, F, or R, or a valid combination of up to three i.e. PIC. Schedules can only be defined for dates greater than the system dates except for I + C schedules when the system date equals the value date. If re-definition is specified input must be one of the following values P I R C M F D or ALL. If interest basis "S" is used both the "FORWARD/BACKWARD KEY" and the "BASE DATE KEY" must be set to "NOT AUTOMATIC. Define schedules prohibited for overnight Contracts of all Category types. Principal, Interest, Commission and Fee dates must equal value dates in relevant FX fields. For deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field, the field can be flagged to "YES" only if interest is to be capitalised. Define schedules prohibited if FIN.MAT.DATE is less than or equal to process date.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DefineScheds

      • getDeliveryLink

        public TField getDeliveryLink()
        Returns the DeliveryLink

        Field description: Used to override standard delivery conditions for the contract and is checked against a message control table where the actual delivery conditions are stored. See documentation of MESSAGE CONTROL for a more detailed explanation of this field and its function. This field can be changed at any time during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-3 numeric characters. (Optional input. Default value = 1.) Must be a valid code on MESSAGE CONTROL table. On Sundries and Accounts Receivable the delivery link must specify PRINT or TELEX methods only.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DeliveryLink

      • getDeptCode

        public String getDeptCode()
        Returns the DeptCode

        Field description:

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The DeptCode

      • getDrawdownAccount

        public TField getDrawdownAccount()
        Returns the DrawdownAccount

        Field description: The account number of the drawdown account to be used on the Value Date. The defaulting process looks firstly at the SEC.ACC.MASTER record using the portfolio no, If no default found uses the CUSTOMER.CCY.ACCT record and finally if still no default found takes details from the AGENCY record and NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. These settings can be overriden by using ACCOUNT.PARAMETER to set the account default method. The account to be credited or debited on the appropriate value date. Should the account indicated be a Nostro then further input may be required in the appropriate fields listed below: PRIN BEN BANK 1 PRIN BEN BANK 2 PRIN ADDRESS BENEF PRIN ACCT If the account, through which delivery is to be made, is not known the user can choose to enter one digit (from 1 to 9) which will identify a text (defined in LMM.TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the customer. This will also result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. The system will default to the first current account of the customer for the contract currency. The account indicated in this field will be used as the default account in the remaining account fields if no further account numbers are specified. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner funds may be directly drawn down from/to an account denominated in any currency. In case the underlying Contract Customer (eg. Customer.id in MONEYMARKET,Counterparty in FOREX) has a record in CUSTOMER.SSI application, then the account number in this field gets defaulted as per the definition for that Customer from CUSTOMER.SSI.For more information on the usage of this feature please refer to CUSTOMER.SSI application. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters relating to a Customer Account or a Nostro Account or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default = Current account in contract currency.) Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. Must be a valid entry on LMM.TEXT. Not valid for Commitment contracts. An account entered that is not equal to the default account will require an override. The system will check for account posting restrictions and require an override if necessary. This field can be changed at any time, however, if it is changed after the VALUE.DATE it will affect principal increases/decreases only.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DrawdownAccount

      • getDrawdownEntDate

        public TField getDrawdownEntDate()
        Returns the DrawdownEntDate

        Field description: Specifies the Value date to be used for the accounting entries raised at contract initiation. This field is by default equal to the VALUE.DATE, but may be set to be a date after this. The VALUE.DATE is the effective date for interest purposes and should be entered as the start of the interest period. The drawdown entry date may be required to be later than the Value date when bonds are processed, and are entered during the coupon period. The start of the coupon period should be entered as the Value Date, this field should be entered as the Value date required for the purchase. Validation Rules: Cannot be prior to the VALUE.DATE Not allowed for commitment or liability commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DrawdownEntDate

      • getDrawdownIssuePrc

        public TField getDrawdownIssuePrc()
        Returns the DrawdownIssuePrc

        Field description: This field defines the Drawdown issue price of the contract. This amount can be above or below the nominal amount of the contract. This amount is net of any adjustment fees and/or expenses. If an amount of 500 or less is entered, then this is treated as a percentage of the contract nominal amount. This field is updated with the calculated percentage amount (100% always being the nominal amount). Validation Rules: 1-19 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Optional input. Default = Contract nominal amount). If an amount of 500 or less is entered, it is treated as a percentage of the contract nominal amount. This field is a NOCHANGE field after drawdown.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DrawdownIssuePrc

      • getDrawdownNetAmt

        public TField getDrawdownNetAmt()
        Returns the DrawdownNetAmt

        Field description: This no-input field identifies the Drawdown net amount of the contract. It is the amount that the counterparty will pay or receive at Drawdown. It is defaulted to the drawdown issue price minus any adjustment fees/ expenses. This amount can be above or below the nominal amount of the contract. The difference is booked to Profit & Loss (the category code and transaction code for the P&L amount is defined on the LMM.INSTALL.CONDS file). The Delivery message for the contract will be produced using this amount. Validation Rules: 1 to 19 numeric characters (type AMT). This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The DrawdownNetAmt

      • getFederalFunds

        public TField getFederalFunds()
        Returns the FederalFunds

        Field description: If the contract is denominated in US$ then this field will indicate whether settlement is to be in Federal Funds. This field can be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-3 type AAA alpha (A-Z, a-z) characters of the form: or (Y)es (N)o (Optional input. Default = No.) Allowed only for contracts denominated in US$. The currency code for US$ must be held as "USD".

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FederalFunds

      • getFeePayAccount

        public TField getFeePayAccount()
        Returns the FeePayAccount

        Field description: Represents the account to which the fees/charges will be credited. This field indicates the account which will be credited with any charges/ fees payable applicable to a Loan or Deposit contract. Fees and Charges are always expressed in the contract currency. If the account, through which delivery is to be made is not known, the user can choose to enter one digit (from 1-9) which will identify a text (defined in LMM TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the customer. This will also result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. This field can be changed at any time; such changes will not be retrospective. Payable fees are denoted by the PAY.RECEIVE field of the LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS record, containing a value of PAY. A Payable fee entered into the main LD record fields CHRG.CODE, CHRG.AMOUNT will be credited to the account nominated in this field. Fees may be linked to a Principal Repayment ("P" schedule), or an interest payment ("I" schedule) by defining a CHARGE.CODE with the appropriate schedule, when schedules are defined. In this case the fee will be credited to the account linked to the schedule type, i.e. for a "P" schedule the PRIN.LIQ.ACCT will be used, for an "I" schedule the INT.LIQ.ACCT will be used. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner proceeds for settlement may directly be drawn down to an account denominated in any currency. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters-relating to a Customer Account or 3-10 alphanumeric account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default = Principal liquidation account.) Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. The system will check for account posting restrictions and require an override if necessary. The account cannot be a NOSTRO account.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FeePayAccount

      • getFeeReserve1

        Returns the FeeReserve1

        Field description: Standard T24 numeric field. Validation Rules: A maximum of 16 characters may be entered. This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FeeReserve1

      • getFeeReserve4

        public TField getFeeReserve4()
        Returns the FeeReserve4

        Field description: Standard T24 numeric field. Validation Rules: A maximum of 16 characters may be entered. This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FeeReserve4

      • getFinChgCalcType

        public TField getFinChgCalcType()
        Returns the FinChgCalcType

        Field description: Indicates the Financial charge calculation type. Four types are permissible, the schedule amount used for accruals is calculated as follows. 'AN' - Annuity The current annuity repayment principal amount. 'SL' - Straight Line (LD.PRINCIPAL LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) / LIFE Where LIFE is the number of repayments from the current repayment date to maturity. 'RB' - Reducing balance (CURR.PRIN.VALUE LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) * RATE * (DAYS/BASE) CURR.PRIN.VALUE is stored on LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES and is initially LD.PRINCIPAL RATE is defined via LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and is stored on SCHED.RATE on LMM.SCHEDULES DAYS and BASE are set by the Annuity interest basis This calculation is performed while CURR.PRIN.VALUE RESIDUAL.VALUE is greater than zero. 'FS' - Flexible schedules (LD.PRINCIPAL LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) * RATE * (DAYS/BASE) RATE is annual percentage depreciation defined via LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and the sum of the rates must equal 100 DAYS/BASE is derived from the frequency of the Annuity schedule e.g. monthly, quarterly etc, normally expressed in months, i.e. monthly = 1/12. Validation Rules: Optional Input Input is only allowed if ASSET.REFERENCE is input. If input must be either 'AN', 'SL', 'FS' or ''RB'

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FinChgCalcType

      • getFinMatDate

        public TField getFinMatDate()
        Returns the FinMatDate

        Field description: The date when the contract is due to mature. The date when the contract is due to mature, and in the case of Commitment contracts with no value in INT.END.DATE, the date when penalty interest/ commission will start to accrue. The system will ensure that the maturity date is a working day in the country(ies) defined in BUS.DAY.DEFN. This field represents either the final date when the principal amount is due to be repaid or the number of days notice required before any funds may be repaid. Fully back valued contracts can be taken in by inputting a date less than process date. For a fresh contract input, if this date is less than or equal to process date all accounting entries for creation and maturity of the deal would be generated ONLINE. Lookup files and balances files that hold historic details will be updated. In these cases the contract will be assigned a CONSOL.KEY based on the current definition on the CONSOLIDATE.COND on the date of processing. Fully back valued contracts may have only one single interest period and repayment of principal may only be bullet. Back valued fresh contract is permissible only for loan type contracts and not for commitments. No update to LIMIT is made for a fresh contract with a back value date. An existing authorised contract can be matured with a back valued date. In such cases a back date that is greater than the last schedule date may be input. Back dated maturity is not permitted beyond the last interest capitalisation date, last principal movement date or any scheduled event date. Accounting entries are raised ONLINE. If maturity date is flagged to process date all accounting entries are raised ONLINE. STMT.ENTRY and CATEG.ENTRY records are raised ONLINE and CONSOL.ENT.TODAY records are raised to mature the deal during end of day processing. Validation Rules: 1-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters or 1-3 numeric characters. (Mandatory input.) An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. The date must be greater than VALUE.DATE. For Commitment contracts the value in this field must be equal to or greater than INT.END.DATE. An override will be required if the final maturity date on a loan contract is after the value in D.D.END.DATE specified on the relevant Commitment contract. Cannot be changed for contracts with interest basis "S". Change in this field will require the redefinition of schedules. Input of a fixed date is mandatory for discounted or Interest/ Commission Basis "S". The final maturity date of a drawdown under a Commitment must be prior to or equal to the end date of that Commitment. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. Call/Notice prohibited for Syndicated loan contracts. Notice period (not Call) prohibited for Accounts Receivable/Sundry deposit contracts. An override will be required if a Call/Notice contract is changed to a fixed maturity contract and the appropriate number of days notice have not been given. Call/Notice prohibited for Commitment contracts. Drawdowns under Commitments cannot be Call/Notice.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FinMatDate

      • getFlatCommType

        public TField getFlatCommType()
        Returns the FlatCommType

        Field description: The field can be used to indicate if commission is to be calculated as a flat fee for the commission period on the highest balance. The commission calculated would be accrued during the period. The field can either be flagged to "YES" or "NO". Input of "YES" means that commission should be calculated as a flat fee on highest balance for each period. Input of "NO" means commission should be calculated on daily outstanding balance at the rate specified. Validation Rules: Input of "YES" allowed only if CSN.CALC.TYPE is HB. Default is "NO"

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FlatCommType

      • getFvMarginKey

        public TField getFvMarginKey()
        Returns the FvMarginKey

        Field description: The field is the Fair Value margin rate key used to provide the fair margin rate on LD and MM contracts. Entering a value here provides a default for the field of same name on the LD and MM applications. Where the CATEGORY used on the MM & LD contract matches the id the value here will be defaulted. It can be overridden at the contract level. This field is a link to the PERIODIC.INTEREST table and the record to use depends on the currency of the contract so if a value of 01 is entered here then a USD contract will look for a record such as 01USD20010731. Validation Rules: 1-4 numeric ID code although at present use of 2 digits is required to utilise PERIODIC.INTEREST records.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FvMarginKey

      • getFvRateKey

        public TField getFvRateKey()
        Returns the FvRateKey

        Field description: The field is the Fair Value rate key used to provide the fair user rate on LD and MM contracts. Entering a value here provides a default for the field of same name on the LD and MM applications. Where the CATEGORY used on the MM & LD contract matches the id the value here will be defaulted. It can be overridden at the contract level. This field is a link to the PERIODIC.INTEREST table and the record to use depends on the currency of the contract so if a value of 01 is entered here then a USD contract will look for a record such as 01USD20010731. Validation Rules: 1-4 numeric ID code although at present use of 2 digits is required to utilise PERIODIC.INTEREST records.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FvRateKey

      • getFwdBwdKey

        public TField getFwdBwdKey()
        Returns the FwdBwdKey

        Field description: This field indicates the method which will be followed for the generation of interest and commission schedules as defined in INTEREST.DUE.DATE and COMM.DUE.DATE fields and the action which will be taken if the derived date is a non working day. The following provides an explanation of the various input values for this field: If the derived day is a non working day the system response will be: FWD = forward The system will go forward to the next working day. BWD = backward The system will go backward to the last working day. FSM = forward same month The system will go forward to the next working day provided it is within the same month. If it is not within the same month the system will go backward to the last working day. CAL = Calendar The system will use the same date irrespective of whether dates cycled are working days or not. Validation Rules: Rule 1 Rule 2

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FwdBwdKey

      • getFwdProj

        public TField getFwdProj()
        Returns the FwdProj

        Field description: This field will be defaulted from the FWD.PROJ field found in LMM.INSTALL.CONDS. This field can be manipulated for each and every contract to generate 'N' number of FWD entries, LMM.SCHEDULES and PM entries This field can be made NULL and once made NULL all schedules pertaining for the contract will be built. Validation Rules: Optional input. It can be left as NULL. Accept values from 1 to 99 only

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The FwdProj

      • getGraceAmount

        public TField getGraceAmount()
        Returns the GraceAmount

        Field description: The amount of extra interest, calculated for the grace period, to be added to the normal discounted interest amount. Example: GBP 1,000,000.00 at 10pc for 1 year - Interest GBP 100,000.00 Grace period set to 10 days - Interest GBP 2,739.73 Total Discounted Interest GBP 102,739.73 Validation Rules: System calculated amount.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The GraceAmount

      • getGracePeriod

        public TField getGracePeriod()
        Returns the GracePeriod

        Field description: The number of days grace for which interest will be added to the normal discounted interest amount. This field can only be used for fixed term discount loan contracts. Setting a value in this field will affect the amount of discount interest calculated according to the number of days selected. Example: Discount loan contract 14 Feb 1996 to 13 Feb 1997 (365 days) GBP 1,000,000.00 at 10pc for 1 year - Interest GBP 100,000.00 Grace period set to 10 days - Interest GBP 2,739.73 Total Discounted Interest GBP 102,739.73 Interest calculated is equivalent to 375 days. Validation Rules: Value of 1-99 allowed. Interest method must be 2 - Discount. Valid for Loan type contracts only. Fixed term contracts only.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The GracePeriod

      • getHbCurrPeriod

        public TField getHbCurrPeriod()
        Returns the HbCurrPeriod

        Field description: The field stores the highest balance amount for the current period. This is a no-input field and is for information purpose only. This field gets populated only when commission is calculated on Highest balance. Validation Rules: This is a standard T24 amount field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The HbCurrPeriod

      • getIasClassification

        public TField getIasClassification()
        Returns the IasClassification

        Field description: This field holds the classification of contract based on IFRS standard.Validation Rules: Should be a valid record ID in IAS.CLASSIFICATION file.Input allowed only for Loans and DepositsInput not allowed for Call / Notice type of contractsInput not allowed for fully backdated contracts and contracts with maturity date as TODAY.This field cannot be amended after authorization

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IasClassification

      • getIasSubtype

        public TField getIasSubtype()
        Returns the IasSubtype

        Field description: This field holds the Sub type for the corresponding classification defined in IAS.CLASSIFICATION field. Validation Rules: Should be a valid sub type for the corresponding classification defined in IAS.CLASSIFICATION file. The field cannot be amended after authorization.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IasSubtype

      • getInclusiveCsn

        public TField getInclusiveCsn()
        Returns the InclusiveCsn

        Field description: Annuity type contracts have the possibility of including Commission in the Annuity payment. A standard Annuity contract will have regular payments which comprise of an amount of Principal together with an amount of Interest. The payment amount is worked out using a standard formula. An Annuity with Commission comprises of Principal, Interest and Commission. Commission on LD can be either based on the main contract commission fields (where this is used accruals can take place), or as a charge based commission (based on usage of LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS) and is set in the LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE screen. Validation Rules: Default is blank Value of Yes only allowed for Annuity types using commission If this field is invoked, currency of the PRIN.LIQ.ACCT, INT.LIQ.ACCT & COM.LIQ.ACCT should be the same.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The InclusiveCsn

      • getInputter

        public List<String> getInputter()
        Returns the collection of Inputter
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<String> -

      • getInputter

        public String getInputter(int idx)
        Returns the Inputter at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        String -

      • getIntAddress

        public TField getIntAddress(int idx)
        Returns the IntAddress at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the interest amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified or this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and INT.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK1 or INT.BEN.BANK2.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getIntAddress

        public List<TField> getIntAddress()
        Returns the collection of IntAddress

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the interest amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified or this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and INT.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK1 or INT.BEN.BANK2.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getIntBenBank1

        public TField getIntBenBank1()
        Returns the IntBenBank1

        Field description: The customer number of the bank to whom interest payments are to be physically made. If input, this field indicates that physical interest delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent or, alternatively, the correspondent of the customers bank. For transfers involving 4 parties an additional entry will be required in either INT.BEN.BANK.2 or If the second correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in INT.ADDRESS (a freeformat field )and BEN.INT.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid customer on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) INT.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) INT.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) INT.ADDRESS * * * * D) BEN.INT.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are free format fields. Input in this field will be checked against the AGENCY table which holds the Bank's name and address for all outputs produced by the system. 'Autorouting of payments' Standard payment details held on the Agency table for the contract customer will be used in this field when payment is required only if no input is made by the user. It is permitted to enter non-standard instructions whenever necessary. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) Customer mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = blank.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. The account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different customer number to that specified in INT.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK2 or INT.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntBenBank1

      • getIntBenBank2

        public TField getIntBenBank2()
        Returns the IntBenBank2

        Field description: The Customer number of the second bank involved in four-party transfers of the interest component.In the case of 3 party transfers the recipient bank where the customer maintains his account. If input, this field indicates that physical interest delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent. For transfers involving 4 parties an additional entry will be required in either INT.BEN.BANK.1. or If the first correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in INT ADDRESS (a freeformat field) and BEN.INT.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid CUSTOMER on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) INT.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) INT.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) INT.ADDRESS * * * * D) BEN.INT.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are be a freeformat fields. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 type AAA alpha (A-Z, a-z) character Mnemonic for the AGENCY table. (Optional input. Default value = none.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different number to that specified in INT.BEN.BANK.1. The account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. This field may be changed any time prior to maturity. Prohibted for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK.1 or INT.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntBenBank2

      • getIntCollMethod

        public TField getIntCollMethod()
        Returns the IntCollMethod

        Field description: If the value in this field is set to REPAY.AMT, i t would be possible to collect interest on repayment amount instead of amount accrued so far. Such interest could be collected for scheduled repayments or adhoc repayments. Example : A LD contract is input with the following features: Contract Particulars Value Date 1-Jan-03 Maturity Date 1-May-03 Amount 100000 Interest Rate 10% Interest Basis 366/360 P' Schedules 1-Feb-03 25000 1-Mar-03 25000 1-Apr-03 25000 1-May-03 25000 INT.COLL.METHOD REPAY.AMT For the above contract interest would be calculated and processed on P schedule date. System would calculate the interest liquidation amount as follows; a) On 25000 @ 10% for 31 days (215.28) to be processed on Feb 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. b) On 25000 @ 10% for 59 days (409.72) to be processed on Mar 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. c) On 25000 @ 10% for 90 days (625) to be processed on Apr 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. d) On 25000 @ 10% for 120 days (833.33) to be processed on May 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. Accounting Entries for the above contract would be as under; Cr Customer Account 100000 Dr LIVEDB 100000 Jan 01, 03 - Feb 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 861.11 Dr Accruals 861.11 On Feb 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 215.28 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 215.28 Feb 01, 03 - Mar 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 583.33 Dr Accruals 583.33 On Mar 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 409.72 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 409.72 Mar 01, 03 - Apr 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 430.56 Dr Accruals 430.56 On Apr 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 625 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 625 Apr 01, 03 - May 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 208.33 Dr Accruals 208.33 On May 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 833.33 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 833.33 If an ad-hoc repayment for 10000 were made (using AMOUNT.INCREASE field) on Mar 15, 2003, interest of 202.78 (@ 10% on 10000 for 73 days) would also be collected online along with the repayment amount. Interest amount for subsequent P schedule dates would be recalculated on the redefined schedule amounts. In the above example, if dues were not paid on Apr 01, 2003, instead of debiting the customer account PD would be created for 625, for MANUAL or SEMI-AUTOMATIC liquidation mode. For value REPAY.AMT in this field the following validations shall apply: i) I schedules or any other schedule type with a combination of I schedule like PI, IP etc., cannot be defined in LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE. ii) Input would not be permitted in field INT.PAY.FREQUENCY. iii) LD contract cannot be a DEPOSIT, CALL, NOTICE, ANNUITY or COMMITMENT type contract. iv) S basis interest would not be permitted. v) Interest payment method for such contracts cannot be discounted. vi) No input would be permitted in field LAST.DAY.ACCRUAL. vii) If interest tax were applicable, the same would be applied on interest amount that is being collected only. xiii) 'B' and 'N' schedule would not be permitted. ix) Capitalisation of charge would not be permitted. x) Capitalisation of interest would not be permitted for such contracts. xi) xii) Once input and authorised, this would be a no change field. xiii) Backdated rate/spread changes and principal decreases would not be permitted beyond last Principal Schedule date. The default value for this field is NULL.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntCollMethod

      • getIntEndDate

        public TField getIntEndDate()
        Returns the IntEndDate

        Field description: Specifies the date when the system will stop calculating interest and commission accruals on Commitment contracts. This allows the commitment to have a grace period at the end of the commitment where no commitment fees will be accrued or applied. If this date is not input then the system will default the FINAL.MATURITY.DATE here. The field becomes a no-change field once the INT.END.DATE is reached. It can be modified if the value here is greater than the system date. 1-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Validation Rules: Valid for Commitment contracts only. Must be a valid date. Must be after the value in INT.START.DATE. Must be after the value in VALUE.DATE. Must be equal to or prior to the value FIN.MAT.DATE. Valid for Commitment contracts only. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non-working day.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntEndDate

      • getIntLiqAcct

        public TField getIntLiqAcct()
        Returns the IntLiqAcct

        Field description: Contains the account number where entries are made for the reimbursement of the Interest (together with any taxes applicable to that interest) at liquidation. The defaulting process looks firstly at the SEC.ACC.MASTER record using the portfolio no. If no default found uses the CUSTOMER.CCY.ACCT record and finally if still no default found takes details from the AGENCY record and NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. These settings can be overriden by using ACCOUNT.PARAMETER to set the account default method. In a case where interest is subject to taxes, such taxes will always remain associated with their interest amount and will always be liquidated through the same account. Thus it is not possible to liquidate interest and corresponding taxes through two different accounts or in two different currencies. Input in this field will be necessary only when the disposal of the interest is different from the disposal of the principal. If the account through which delivery is to be made is not known the User can choose to enter one digit (from 1 to 9) which will identify the text (defined in LMM.TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the customer. This will result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. This field may be changed at any time during the life of the contract; such changes will not be retrospective. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner proceeds for settlement may directly be drawn down from/to an account denominated in any currency. In case the underlying Contract Customer (eg. Customer.id in MONEYMARKET,Counterparty in FOREX, etc.) has a record in CUSTOMER.SSI application, then the account number in this field gets defaulted as per the definition for that Customer from CUSTOMER.SSI.For more information on the usage of this feature please refer to CUSTOMER.SSI application. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters-relating to a Customer Account or a Nostro Account or 3-10 type A alphanumeric account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = PRIN.LIQ.ACCT) The system will check for account posting restrictions and will require an override if necessary. Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. An account entered that is not equal to the default account will require an override.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntLiqAcct

      • getIntPaymtMethod

        public TField getIntPaymtMethod()
        Returns the IntPaymtMethod

        Field description: Indicates if the interest has to be paid in advance or in arrears. On an interest bearing contract the income or expense accrues on the face value of the contract. At maturity the value of the contract will equal the principal value + interest. On a discounted contract the income or expense is taken at the start of the transaction. At maturity the value of the contract will equal the principal value only. The following values have been defined: '1' = Interest bearing contracts For a one period contract, the interest will be collected/paid on the maturity date. For contracts with various interest schedules, the interest will be collected/paid on the scheduled interest dates. '2' = Discounted basis contracts The discount deducted in advance is reported as unearned/unpaid interest. The discount is accrued on a straightline basis during the life of the contract. For contracts with various interest schedules the interest will be collected/paid at the inception of each scheduled interest period. In this case, if no payment is received, the user will always liquidate the next discounted interest due against a receivable account. After final maturity, the system will automatically change the discounted payment type to interest bearing payment type. Validation Rules: 1 numeric character of the form: 1 = Interest bearing. 2 = Discounted. (Optional input. Default value = 1) For discounted contracts the revision schedules must always coincide with an interest and/or commission schedule. The Interest rate type must be FIXED for discounted contracts. Discounted method prohibited for Call and Notice contracts. Once the contract has been authorised, this field cannot be changed. The discounted method is prohibited for Commitment contracts. Input in this field prohibited for Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. For discounted contracts the liquidation code must be "1" fully automatic. For discounted contracts the rate must be greater than zero. For Deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount Field only Discounted method is prohibited. If the field Yield is flagged to Yes only Discounted method is allowed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntPaymtMethod

      • getIntRateType

        public TField getIntRateType()
        Returns the IntRateType

        Field description: Indicates the type of interest rate to be used for the contract. The following values are defined for the interest rate type field: 1 = Fixed 2 = Periodic Automatic 3 = Floating 4 = Periodic Manual 5 = Periodic Straight Once authorised this field cannot be changed. 1 = Fixed: The rate of interest to be charged over the life of the contract is fixed at a specific percentage and is input as a numeric value. The rate includes the spread. 2 = Periodic Automatic: A rate of interest which will change on predetermined dates and become effective on the appropriate revision date. 3 = Floating: A rate of interest which will change on a non-determined basis with immediate impact. Input is in the form of a valid key from the BASIC.RATE.TEXT with the associated rate defined on BASIC.INTEREST table. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract. 4 = Periodic Manual A rate of interest which will change on predetermined dates and become effective on the appropriate rollover date. The rate is input in the form of a numeric value. Revision schedules are mandatory. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract. 5 = Periodic Straight: A rate of interest which will not change. The rate is input in the form of a numeric value. Revision schedules are prohibited. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract. Validation Rules: 1 numeric character. Only valid input is 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. (Optional input. Default value = 1 fixed.) For 1 = Fixed Rate Type: - Input in the interest rate field is mandatory. - Input in the interest key field is prohibited. - Input in the interest spread field is prohibited. - Interest basis "S" (special) is accepted. - Valid for discounted contracts. - Revision schedules may be defined. - Input prohibited for Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. - Rate amendment is only possible using NEW.INT.RATE. - Mandatory for Commitment contracts. For 2 = Periodic Automatic rate type: - Input in the interest key field is mandatory. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Input of a rate in the interest rate field will be mandatory only at the original drawdown date of the contract and will override the value of the key until the first revision date. - Definition of revision schedules is mandatory. - Prohibited for discounted contracts. - Interest calculation basis "S" (special) prohibited. - Can be changed to PERIODIC MANUAL with effect from the next rollover period, the key being effective till then. - Prohibited for Commitments, Accounts Receivable, Sundry contract types and deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments and Syndicated loans. For 3 = Floating rate type: - Input in the interest key field is mandatory. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Input in the interest rate field is prohibited. - Revision schedule definition is prohibited. - Prohibited for Commitments, Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. - Prohibited for discounted contract types. - Prohibited for interest calculation basis "S" (special). - Change of rates will be done via the BASIC.INTEREST table. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments, deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field. For 4 = Periodic Manual rate type: - Input in the interest rate field is mandatory. - Input in the interest key field is prohibited. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Definition of revision schedules is mandatory. - Prohibited for Commitments, Sundry and Accounts Receivable. - Prohibited for interest calculation basis "S" (special). - Prohibited for discounted contract types. - Change of rates will be done via revision schedules. - Prohibited for call and notice contracts. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments. Prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field. For 5 = Periodic Straight rate type: - The system will require an input for the interest rate field but will not accept input in the interest key field. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Revision schedule definition is prohibited. - Interest calculation basis "S" (special) is prohibited. - Discounted contract types prohibited. - Prohibited for Commitments, Account Receivable and Sundry contract types. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments and Syndicated loans. - Prohibited for Call and Notice contracts. Prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntRateType

      • getIntRateVDate

        public TField getIntRateVDate()
        Returns the IntRateVDate

        Field description: The effective date of change to new interest rate. The date when the new interest rate becomes effective. Validation Rules: Standard date format. (Optional input.) Can be back valued to the last interest schedule only. If SUSPEND.INCOME is flagged to YES in the relevant category PD.PARAMETER, then back valuing cannot be for a date prior to the date on which OVERDUE.STATUS changed to NAB. On discounted contracts,must equal date of next interest start period. On PERIODIC MANUAL contracts, if forward, must be equal to next 'R' schedule. Mandatory input if a value in NEW.INT.RATE, otherwise prohibited. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. Must be a valid date. One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Cannot be greater than the value in FIN.MAT.DATE. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited if value missing in field NEW.INT.RATE. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Input prohibited prior to first authorisation of contract. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited prior or equal to value date of Negotiated deal date of Interest.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntRateVDate

      • getIntRefNumber

        public TField getIntRefNumber()
        Returns the IntRefNumber

        Field description: Interest Reference Number will be used if the User needs to link the interest rate on a deal to a rate quoted by dealers. This field may contain the reference number as quoted by the dealers. This field may be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 5 alphanumeric characters. (Optional input.) Prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntRefNumber

      • getIntRevisionDate

        public TField getIntRevisionDate()
        Returns the IntRevisionDate

        Field description: Indicates next interest revision date and associated frequency code. The interest rate will be revised on the date specified and thereafter on the frequency indicated, unless the contract has matured. Example: a) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = at one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a monthly end date. b) 31 MAR 1986 M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = at three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a quarter end date. Validation Rules: Standard date format. Mandatory for Call/Notice contracts with interest type "2" PERIODIC AUTOMATIC. Prohibited for non Call/Notice contracts. The definition of schedules is prohibited. Must be a valid date. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntRevisionDate

      • getIntStartDate

        public TField getIntStartDate()
        Returns the IntStartDate

        Field description: Specifies the date when the system will start calculating interest and commission accruals on Commitment contracts. This allows the commitment to have a grace period at the start of the commitment where no commitment fees will be accrued or applied. If this date is not input then the system will default the VALUE.DATE here. The field becomes a no-change field once the INT.START.DATE is reached. It can be modified if the value here is greater than the system date. 1-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Validation Rules: Valid for Commitment contracts only. Must be a valid date. Must be prior to the value in INT.END.DATE. Must be prior to the value in FIN.MAT.DATE. Must be equal to or after the VALUE.DATE. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non-working day.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IntStartDate

      • getIntTaxFcy

        Field description: INT.TAX.FCY This field details the amount of tax on interest in foreign currency for foreign currency contracts Validation Rules: NO INPUT

        Parameters:

      • getIntTaxLcy

        Field description: INT.TAX.LCY This field details the local currency equivalent amount of tax on interest Validation Rules: NO INPUT

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getInterestBasis

        public TField getInterestBasis()
        Returns the InterestBasis

        Field description: Loans & Deposits can accept the following types:

        KeyDays/Denominator
        A 360/360
        A1 360/360*
        A2 30/360
        A4 30/360
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        F1 360/365*
        F2 360/365*
        S Special
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS INTEREST.BASIS If basis "S" is used and no schedules have been defined then the system will require an entry in TOT.INTEREST.AMT Depending on the value set in LMM.INSTALL.CONDS in field S.BASIS.RATE.VAL In both the above cases the difference will be compensated for within the last accrual period thus agreeing with the user defined interest amount. Validation Rules: 1-2 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. Default = CURRENCY table value) Interest basis "S" is not allowed for Call/notice contracts. Interest basis "S" valid for fixed rate contracts only. Interest basis "S" is prohibited for Commitment contracts if the value in LCU.CALC.BASE Once authorised this field cannot be changed. Prohibited for Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. Principal schedules can only be defined for the principal maturity event when basis "S" has been defined. For deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field only "A" basis permitted.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The InterestBasis

      • getInterestDueDate

        public TField getInterestDueDate()
        Returns the InterestDueDate

        Field description: Indicates next interest due date and associated frequency code for contracts where schedules are not defined through LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and where principal repayment is bullet in nature. In case of Call/Notice contracts, if the field is left NULL, the committed interest would not be calculated. The accruals would take place at the interest rate input. In case of fixed maturity bullet repayment contracts, the field AUTO.SCHEDS has to be set to 'YES', for this field to be used. The system will produce a single schedule for the first period. Upon reaching the scheduled event date a subsequent schedule will be generated based on the values in this field. In case of fixed maturity contracts, schedules are generated till maturity of the contract. This field will be defaulted with the value in INTEREST.FREQ field in LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION, if the value input in CATEGORY field has a record in the LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION table. However, the user may manually modify this default at the deal level. Example: a) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = at one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a monthly end date. b) 31 MAR 1986 M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = at three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a quarter end date. c) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 10 M=Monthly, 01 = at monthly intervals 10 = 10 d) M01 e) 31 MAR 1986 W , where W= weekly. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31 f) 31 Mar 1986 BSNSS, where BSNSS = every business day. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31 g) The values defined in the EB.FREQUENCY table will also be accepted in this field. The value so input will be Validation Rules: Standard date format. The definition of schedules in LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE is prohibited. Must be a valid date. An override will be required if the field is left NULL for a Call/Notice contract with interest. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. The frequency for Call deposits cannot be less than the delivery number of days, if INT LIQ ACCT is a NOSTRO.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The InterestDueDate

      • getInterestKey

        public TField getInterestKey()
        Returns the InterestKey

        Field description: Contains the reference number of the appropriate interest rate which will be used for interest computation purposes. The key indicates the rate to be used for interest computation purposes on Loans and Deposit contracts. The key can take the form of an entry on the BASIC RATE TEXT (and consequently BASIC INTEREST) and PERIODIC INTEREST tables. A rate change on the interest rate table will automatically update at the End Of Day run all contracts linked to the BASIC INTEREST and PERIODIC INTEREST tables. Validation Rules: 1-4 numeric characters. (Optional input.) Mandatory input if the interest rate type is FLOATING or PERIODIC AUTOMATIC. Prohibited for FIXED, PERIODIC MANUAL and PERIODIC STRAIGHT. Prohibited for discounted contracts. Prohibited for Accounts Receivables and Sundry contracts. Prohibited for Commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The InterestKey

      • getInterestRate

        public TField getInterestRate(int idx)
        Returns the InterestRate at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Indicates the annual interest/commitment fee rate applicable on the contract. This is the rate used for interest computation purposes on Loans and Deposits contracts and for commitment fee computation purposes in the case of Commitment contracts. Negative rates can be input in some cases. To enable this, the value in field NEGATIVE.RATE should be YES. The helptext for NEGATIVE.RATE will clarify the type of contracts for which negative rates can be used. Validation Rules: 1- 10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Input prohibited for floating rate contracts. Must be greater than zero for discounted contracts. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Input mandatory for the first period on PERIODIC rate contracts. Input mandatory for fixed interest contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Input prohibited for Sundry and Accounts Receivable contract types.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getInterestRate

        public List<TField> getInterestRate()
        Returns the collection of InterestRate

        Field description: Indicates the annual interest/commitment fee rate applicable on the contract. This is the rate used for interest computation purposes on Loans and Deposits contracts and for commitment fee computation purposes in the case of Commitment contracts. Negative rates can be input in some cases. To enable this, the value in field NEGATIVE.RATE should be YES. The helptext for NEGATIVE.RATE will clarify the type of contracts for which negative rates can be used. Validation Rules: 1- 10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Input prohibited for floating rate contracts. Must be greater than zero for discounted contracts. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Input mandatory for the first period on PERIODIC rate contracts. Input mandatory for fixed interest contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Input prohibited for Sundry and Accounts Receivable contract types.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getInterestSpread

        public TField getInterestSpread()
        Returns the InterestSpread

        Field description: Indicates the spread or margin on the contract. Indicates the spread (also known as the margin) which will be applied to the percentage interest rate derived from the BASIC INTEREST or PERIODIC INTEREST tables or in the case of PERIODIC MANUAL/PERIODIC STRAIGHT from the INTEREST RATE field. Validation Rules: 1-9 numeric characters plus a decimal point (- = a negative spread) of the form +/- 999999.999 Optional input. Default value = Null.) Prohibited for FIXED interest rate type contracts. Prohibited for discounted interest payment method. Prohibited for interest basis "S". A spread which will result in a negative interest rate is prohibited. Cannot be greater than 100%. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited for Sundry contracts and Accounts Receivable. Once contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The InterestSpread

      • getIssueAccrual

        public TField getIssueAccrual()
        Returns the IssueAccrual

        Field description: Specifies if any discount or premium arising from the ISSUE.PRICE specified is to be accrued to Profit and Loss over the life of the contract, and whether the amount should be accrued on a LINEAR or ACTUARIAL basis. The discount or premium arising from the issue price can be accrued throughout the life of the contract. It may be accrued on a LINEAR basis or an ACTUARIAL basis. The accrual method can be changed throughout the life of the contract if required. If the LINEAR method is used the ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT is amortised on a straight line basis between the VALUE.DATE and the FIN.MAT.DATE. The amortised amount on a given date is calculated using the formula: (See Figure 1 below) If the ACTUARIAL method is used the ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT is amortised on an actuarial basis between the VALUE.DATE and the FIN.MAT.DATE. The amortised amount on a given date is calculated using the formula: (See Figure 2 below) An Internal Rate of Return (IRR) is calculated for the deal using the formula: (See Figure 3 below) Be careful with IRR rates since, for example, a 10 year loan at 7% compounded Annually would need an IRR of over 9.9% without any compounding this is then used to calculate the amortisation amount: Validation Rules: Only NO, LINEAR, ACTUARIAL allowed. Must be NO for Call/Notice contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IssueAccrual

      • getIssuePlAmount

        public TField getIssuePlAmount()
        Returns the IssuePlAmount

        Field description: This is a NOINPUT field which identifies the Profit & Loss amount which has arisen through specifying a Drawdown Issue Price which is different than the contract nominal amount. This field is defaulted to the Drawdown Issue Price (DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC) minus the contract nominal amount (AMOUNT). e.g. Loan amount 10 M Drawdown Issue Price 11 M Issue P&L Amount 1 M Validation Rules: 1-19 Numeric characters (Standard amount field). (NOINPUT field. Default = See details).

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IssuePlAmount

      • getIssuePrice

        public TField getIssuePrice()
        Returns the IssuePrice

        Field description: The price a bond is issued at, as a percentage of the nominal value. When purchasing bonds an issue price is quoted as a percentage of the nominal amount, this may be more or less than 100%. The price entered here will be used to calculate the amount which the customer will actually pay/ receive at contract initiation, stored in the field DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC. The difference between the Nominal and the Drawdown issue price is stored as the ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT. Validation Rules: Must be numeric in the range 0-999.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The IssuePrice

      • getJointHolder

        public JointHolderClass getJointHolder(int idx)
        Returns the JointHolder at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to return
        Returns:

      • getJointHolder

        public List<JointHolderClass> getJointHolder()
        Returns the unmodifiable collection of JointHolder
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<JointHolderClass> -

      • getLCUCalcBase

        public TField getLCUCalcBase()
        Returns the LCUCalcBase

        Field description: Indicates whether the commitment fee is calculated on the Original / Unused value of the Commitment /Tranche amount. O = Commitment fee would be calculated between VALUE.DATE and FIN.MAT.DATE for the value in AMOUNT field. U = Commitment fee would be calculated on the unused total commitment amount. This includes the unused amount in current as well as future tranches, for a deal defined in tranches. Period for which fee would be charged is between VALUE.DATE & FIN.MAT.DATE. TO = Commitment fee would be calculated for the period covering the D.D.START.DATE & D.D.END.DATE for the respective TRANCHE.AMT TU = Commitment fee would be based on the 'available' unused funds. This means that the unused amount of the tranches that fall in the current commitment fee period is considered for calculation. This field cannot be changed after authorisation. Validation Rules: 2 type AAA (alpha A-Z, a-z) character of the form: U = Unused amount, O = Original amount, TO = Tranche Original, & TU = Tranche Unused (Optional input. Default = O ) Input allowed for Commitment contracts only. Fees under the Unused basis can never be taken in advance. For LCU.CALC.TYPE values RC or NC, values in this field cannot be TO or O

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LCUCalcBase

      • getLCUConversion

        public TField getLCUConversion()
        Returns the LCUConversion

        Field description: Conversion rate to be used for translation of Loans to commitment currency equivalents. This field will be used to provide equivalents for commitment availability/exposure purposes for Loans denominated in currencies different from the currency of the commitment. Any subsequent revaluation will be reflected in AVAIL.AMT of the Limit. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point of the form: 999999.9999 (Optional input. Default = mid rate from CURRENCY table.) Input allowed if the drawdown is in a currency other than the commitment currency, otherwise prohibited. An override will be required if the value in this field is outside the tolerance indicated on the CURRENCY table. Input allowed if a valid commitment number is inserted in COMMITMENT NO otherwise prohibited. Input allowed for Loan contracts only. This field cannot be changed once authorised.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LCUConversion

      • getLCUType

        public TField getLCUType()
        Returns the LCUType

        Field description: Indicates whether the facility is revolving or non revolving and also whether the facility is cumulative or not. If commitments were defined in tranches, facility is provided to define whether the unused balance of an earlier tranche may be carried forward to the next tranche or not. If such carry forward is permitted, then the commitment is deemed to be of cumulative type. N = NON REVOLVING This indicates that Loan will be deducted from the Commitment Available Amount but repayments will not reinstate the Available Amount. This also indicates that the facility is non cumulative.. R = REVOLVING This indicates that the Loan will be deducted from the Commitment Available Amount and any repayments will reinstate the Available Amount. This also indicates that the facility is non cumulative. NC = Commitment facility is non revolving and cumulative. RC = Commitment facility is revolving and cumulative. Validation Rules: 1 alphabetic character of the form: N = Non Revolving R = Revolving (Optional input. Default = N.) Valid for Commitment contracts only. After authorisation, this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LCUType

      • getLastDayAccrual

        public TField getLastDayAccrual()
        Returns the LastDayAccrual

        Field description: The accepted values in the field LAST.DAY.ACCRUAL are BEGIN, MAT, ALL & NO. If the field is flagged BEGIN, interest calculations would include one additional days interest in the first If the field is flagged MAT, interest calculations would include one additional days interest in the last If the field is flagged ALL, interest calculations would include one additional days interest in each of the I(Interest) For value NO existing functionality would continue. Can be defaulted from the LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION record with modification permitted at the record level. The number of days for which interest will be calculated Value date : Maturity date : 31 May 01. I schedules every month end. NO 31 Jan 01 28 Feb 01 31 Mar 01 30 Apr 01 31 May 01 Total no of days Validation Rules: Only allowed values are BEGIN, MAT, ALL & NO This field will be a NO CHANGE field, once authorized.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LastDayAccrual

      • getLdReserved

        public TField getLdReserved()
        Returns the LdReserved
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LdReserved

      • getLimitReference

        public TField getLimitReference()
        Returns the LimitReference

        Field description: Specifies the Credit Line number under which the transaction was granted. If no input is made in this field the Limits system will provide a default value according to the LIMIT.REFERENCE record which has its Field Application Ident. set to LD. If no match is found in selective Reference the default value will be the Reference with its Field Reference blank. For Deposit & Sundry contracts, a reference can be specified if required. These limits are updated purely for information only. If no specific deposit type has been defined on Limit Parameter, the DEFAULT.DEPOSIT limit reference will be used. The credit line number generated will be NNNN-01 where NNNN is the ID of the Limit Reference record described above. Validation Rules: 3-7 numeric characters. (Conditional input. Default if applicable = LIMIT.REFERENCE table entry.) Must be a valid reference on the LIMIT.REFERENCE table. The contract drawdown date must be prior to the limit expiry date. An override will be required if the contract drawdown date is prior to the limit start date, which is itself after the system date. Input prohibited for Commitments with STA = Y(es). Drawdowns under Commitments with STA = N(o) must have matching LIMIT.REFERENCE as the Commitment. Commitments with STA = N(o) must have LIMIT.REFERENCE according to LCU type, i.e. LCU type N(on-Revolving) - REDUCING LIMIT REFERENCE. LCU type R(evolving) NON-REDUCING LIMIT REFERENCE. Where input permitted, LIMIT.REFERENCE must match requirements specified in LIMIT.PARAMETER for that contract. An override will be required if the line expires prior to the contract final maturity date.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LimitReference

      • getLinkReference

        Returns the LinkReference

        Field description: Standard T24 alphanumeric field. Validation Rules: A maximum of 12 characters may be entered.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LinkReference

      • getLiquidationCode

        public TField getLiquidationCode()
        Returns the LiquidationCode

        Field description: This field is no longer used. If your wish to liquidate the contract other than automatically then please refer to the Helptext for field LIQUIDATION.MODE. Validation Rules: 1 numeric character. (Optional input. Default value = "1" Automatic.) Liquidation code "1" is the only value allowed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LiquidationCode

      • getLiquidationMode

        public TField getLiquidationMode()
        Returns the LiquidationMode

        Field description: This field identifies the manner in which overdue payments are handled. The default for all contracts is AUTOMATIC. There are three options available: AUTOMATIC SEMI-AUTOMATIC MANUAL AUTOMATIC will liquidate across the settlement accounts on the contract. MANUAL will create a PD contract instead. SEMI-AUTOMATIC will only raise a PD contract if insufficient funds exist on the settlement account. For further details see the helptext in PD.PARAMETER where these settings are controlled from. Validation Rules: If the PD product is not defined for the current company then the only allowed setting is AUTOMATIC.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LiquidationMode

        Returns the LiveInterest
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The LiveInterest

      • getMarginRevDate

        public TField getMarginRevDate()
        Returns the MarginRevDate

        Field description: Indicates next margin revision date and associated frequency code. The margin rate will be revised on the date specified and thereafter on the frequency indicated. Example: a) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = at one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a monthly end date. b) 31 MAR 1986 M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = at three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a quarter end date. Validation Rules: Standard date format. Mandatory for Call/Notice contracts except for type "FIXED". Prohibited for non Call/Notice contracts. Must be a valid date. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for Commitment contracts, Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The MarginRevDate

      • getMarketKey

        public TField getMarketKey()
        Returns the MarketKey

        Field description: Market rate to calculate the NPV based on future cashflow information. Validation Rules: The field can either be a Fixed rate or PERIODIC.INTEREST key with prefix P Input is mandatory if IAS.CLASSIFICATION field is entered.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The MarketKey

      • getMarketMargin

        public TField getMarketMargin()
