        Field description: Margin to calculate the NPV based on future cashflow information Validation Rules: The field can either be positive or negative. Input is optional

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The MarketMargin

      • getMatAmount

        public TField getMatAmount()
        Returns the MatAmount

        Field description: While inputting a Certificate of Deposit (CD) contract, the maturity amount of the Deposit should be entered here. Based on the maturity amount, the tenor, interest capitalisation (if applicable) and the rate of interest, the initial amount is calculated by the system and populated in the Amount field. Once a value is entered in this field, the amount is calculated using the below mentioned formula: Amount = Mat.Amount / (1+(r*k/(360*100)))^n Where r = rate of interest (%) n = number of Periods of capitalisation of interest (In the absence of any I schedule, the contract is treated as a single period contract) k = number of days in a period (only A basis permitted) Examples Contract 1 Maturity Amount = USD 1 Million Rate of Interest (r) = 10% p.a Value Date = Jan 01, 2001 Maturity Date = April 01, 2001 k = 90 days (A basis) n = 1 (no I schedules) Amount = USD 975609.76 Contract 2 Maturity Amount = USD 1 Million Rate of Interest (r) = 10% p.a Value Date = Jan 01, 2001 Maturity Date = April 01, 2001 Interest Capitalisation = Monthly on Feb 01, March 01 & April 01 k = 30 days (A basis) n = 3 (no I schedules) Amount = USD 975410.95 Note that in Contract 2 since interest is capitalised on a monthly basis the number of days in a period and the number of periods is different from those in Contract 1. Validation Rules: Input allowed only for deposit type contracts Standard T24 Amount Field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The MatAmount

      • getMatureAtSod

        public TField getMatureAtSod()
        Returns the MatureAtSod

        Field description: Defaulted from Flag LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION table. If set to YES, maturity entries would be raised during Start of Day process. This rule is applicable for all types of contracts with or without schedules. All scheduled events like principal, interest, commission etc., would be processed during start of day. Required STMT.ENTRY(s) and CATEG.ENTRY(s) would be generated during start of day. CONSOL.ENT.TODAY records would be raised during SOD for all deal level updations like repayment of principal, capitalisation of interest or liquidation of contract. If not set to YES, maturity entries would be generated during End of Day process. Validation Rules: Optional Input field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The MatureAtSod

      • getMaturedOnline

        Returns the MaturedOnline

        Field description: Indicates if the contract has matured online or not Validation rules NOINPUT field.Will be set to YES if matured online

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The MaturedOnline

        Field description: This field is used within the Management Information module to define the Department which funded this Contract. It is used in the generation of cost of funds entries when either the MIS.INTEREST.KEY or MIS.INTEREST.RATE field is used. Validation Rules: Must be a key to a valid record on the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER file. Mandatory. If not defined, value would be defaulted from the value of the field DEFLT.FUND.DEPT associated with the appropriate COMPANY field in MI.PARAMETER.

      • getMisInterestKey

        public TField getMisInterestKey()
        Returns the MisInterestKey

        Field description: Contains the reference number indicating the Management Information System (MIS) cost-of-funds rate. One single change in the MIS INTEREST RATE table will automatically update during end of day processing all the applicable M.I.S. Interest Rates on all contracts which contain the code. Validation Rules: 1-3 numeric characters. (Optional input.) Input prohibited for discounted transaction types. Input in this field will only be allowed if MIS.INTEREST.RATE is blank. The code will be checked against the BASIC.RATE.TEXT table. Input prohibited for Commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The MisInterestKey

      • getMisInterestRate

        public TField getMisInterestRate()
        Returns the MisInterestRate

        Field description: Represents the financing rate for the funds. It will be used to determine the Management Information System (M.I.S) Account Profitability Analysis. When a rate is entered, the system will use this rate for Management Information System (M.I.S) Account Profitability Analysis. The rate will be entered as a FIXED Interest Rate Type. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input.) Input will only be accepted if MIS.INTEREST.KEY is blank. Input prohibited for Commitment contract types. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The MisInterestRate

      • getNegativeRate

        public TField getNegativeRate()
        Returns the NegativeRate

        Field description: The values in this field can be YES, NO or Null. If set to YES, this would enable negative interest rates to be input in the following fields : (i) INTEREST.RATE (ii) MIS.INTEREST.RATE (iii) NEW.INTEREST.RATE (when subsequent rate amendments are to be made in a contract) (iv)Definition of R schedules with negative rates. (iv)In case of contracts where INT.RATE.TYPE is either FLOATING or PERIODIC.AUTOMATIC, a negative rate can be stipulated in the INTEREST.SPREAD field such that the sum of In the case the field is set to NO or Null, the above functionalities will not be available. However during the tenure of the contract, if due to changes in the BASIC.INTEREST/ PERIODIC.INTEREST key, the interest rate on the contract becomes negative, such rate would be truncated to 0%. Once input and authorized, this field becomes non-inputtable. Default value is NO. Validation Rules: This field will not accept the value YES in the following cases

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The NegativeRate

      • getNetIntTaxFcy

        public TField getNetIntTaxFcy(int idx)
        Returns the NetIntTaxFcy at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: NET.INT.TAX.FCY This field details the TOTAL amount of tax on interest in deal curency Validation Rules: NO INPUT

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getNetIntTaxFcy

      • getNewComRate

        public TField getNewComRate(int idx)
        Returns the NewComRate at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Indicates the new commission rate for the contract. Indicates the new commission rate for the contract, or in the case of Commitment contracts the rate (or rate tier) applicable to commitment commission accruals. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus decimal point. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Input allowed for Loans and Commitments only. When commission payment method is discounted, rate must be greater than zero. Input prohibited unless a value is present in field COMM.RATE. Must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Multivalue field for Commitments only. Input prohibited prior to first authorisation of contract. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getNewComRate

        public List<TField> getNewComRate()
        Returns the collection of NewComRate

        Field description: Indicates the new commission rate for the contract. Indicates the new commission rate for the contract, or in the case of Commitment contracts the rate (or rate tier) applicable to commitment commission accruals. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus decimal point. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Input allowed for Loans and Commitments only. When commission payment method is discounted, rate must be greater than zero. Input prohibited unless a value is present in field COMM.RATE. Must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Multivalue field for Commitments only. Input prohibited prior to first authorisation of contract. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getNewIntRate

        public List<TField> getNewIntRate()
        Returns the collection of NewIntRate

        Field description: New interest rate to be applied. Represents the new interest rate on a contract, or in the case of Commitment contracts the rate (or rate tier) applicable to commitment fee accruals. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Input prohibited for FLOATING rate contracts. Input prohibited for interest basis "S". One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Input prohibited prior to first authroised contract. Input prohibited for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Zero rate allowed for Commitments only. Input must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Multiple rates on commitment contracts required for each amount input. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getNewIntRate

        public TField getNewIntRate(int idx)
        Returns the NewIntRate at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: New interest rate to be applied. Represents the new interest rate on a contract, or in the case of Commitment contracts the rate (or rate tier) applicable to commitment fee accruals. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Input prohibited for FLOATING rate contracts. Input prohibited for interest basis "S". One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Input prohibited prior to first authroised contract. Input prohibited for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Zero rate allowed for Commitments only. Input must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Multiple rates on commitment contracts required for each amount input. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getNewSpread

        public TField getNewSpread()
        Returns the NewSpread

        Field description: The new interest spread for contract. Validation Rules: 1-9 numeric characters plus a decimal point (- = a negative spread) of the form +/- 99.99. (Optional input.) Prohibited for FIXED interest contracts. Mandatory if a value in SPREAD V DATE, otherwise prohbited. One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Cannot be greater than 100%. Input permitted on authorised contracts only. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Cannot result in negative interest rate. Prohibited for commitments. Input prohibited for discounted interest payment method. Prohibited for Interest basis "S". Input prohibited for forward dated contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The NewSpread

      • getOverride

        public List<TField> getOverride()
        Returns the collection of Override

        Field description: Contains all the override messages which the user has confirmed during input. At validation,the system may generate a series of screen override messages to indicate some anomaly within the transaction (e.g. maturity date is not a working day for this currency). User may change the data or override the message. If the contract is subsequently displayed or printed, all override messages are shown. Validation Rules: (System generated. Multivalue field.) This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

At validation,the system may generate a series of screen override messages to indicate some anomaly within the transaction (e.g. maturity date is not a working day for this currency). User may change the data or override the message. If the contract is subsequently displayed or printed, all override messages are shown. Validation Rules: (System generated. Multivalue field.) This is a NOINPUT field.

        TField -

      • getParticipantNo

        public List<TField> getParticipantNo()
        Returns the collection of ParticipantNo

        Field description: Indicates the identity of the relevant participant. An expansion in this field results in the expansion of all syndicate related fields. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric customer number or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) customer mnemonic. (Mandatory input. Multivalue field.) Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Permitted for Syndicated loan and Syndicated Commitment contracts only. If the value in SYNDICATE.AGT is other than "AGENT" then this information will be held on a memorandum basis only. The borrower cannot be a participant.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getParticipantNo

        public TField getParticipantNo(int idx)
        Returns the ParticipantNo at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Indicates the identity of the relevant participant. An expansion in this field results in the expansion of all syndicate related fields. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric customer number or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) customer mnemonic. (Mandatory input. Multivalue field.) Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Permitted for Syndicated loan and Syndicated Commitment contracts only. If the value in SYNDICATE.AGT is other than "AGENT" then this information will be held on a memorandum basis only. The borrower cannot be a participant.

        TField -

      • getPayingAgent

        public TField getPayingAgent()
        Returns the PayingAgent

        Field description: Specifies the customer or bank who is acting as the paying agent for the contract. A Paying Agent is responsible for the payment and receipt of funds generated by the contract. If a Paying Agent is specified, this customer will be used to provide the defaults for settlement accounts and instructions for the deal, in the fields: DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT PRIN.LIQ.ACCT INT.LIQ.ACCT CHRG.LIQ.ACCT COM.LIQ.ACCT PRIN.BEN.BANK1 PRIN.BEN.BANK2 BENEF.PRIN.ACCT INT.LIQ.ACCT INT.BEN.BANK1 INT.BEN.BANK2 BEN.INT.ACCT The Paying Agent, if specified, will be used as the beneficiary of any Swift payment message. The value may be changed at any time during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: Must be a valid entry in the CUSTOMER file. An override will be required if the customer entered is not a bank, as defined in ACCOUNT.CLASS.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PayingAgent

      • getPenaltyKey

        public TField getPenaltyKey()
        Returns the PenaltyKey

        Field description: This field is not used at present.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PenaltyKey

      • getPenaltyRate

        public TField getPenaltyRate()
        Returns the PenaltyRate

        Field description: This field is used to arrive at the penalty spread that will be calculated when the LD contract becomes PD and crosses the period specified in PE.SWITCH.PERIOD in the relevant PD.PARAMETER record. When such period has been exceeded, the difference between the value in this field and the interest rate on the underlying contract will form the penalty spread in the PD record. This rate will be applied on the outstanding amount in the LD contract (referred to as OP in PD.AMOUNT.TYPE). For example: LD Contract amount 1,000,000 First principal payment 100,000 Contract rate 10% Penalty rate 15% PE.SWITCH.PERIOD in PD.PARAMETER 2 days As a result of the above settings, 2 days after the first principal payment becomes PD (i.e effective the third day), the penalty spread will be applied at 5% (15%-10%) on the outstanding LD principal of 900,000. Once a PD contract is created with the first PD.BALANCE, all subsequent PD balances will source the (latest) penalty rate from the PD contract itself (irrespective of PD.PARAMETER setting). Validation Rules: Input in this field is allowed only if LIQUIDATION.MODE is set to MANUAL or SEMI-AUTOMATIC. Input is allowed in this field only if CONTRACT.METHOD and PENALTY.KEY in the relevant PD.PARAMETER is set to NULL (in other words, input in the PENALTY.RATE field in the relevant PD.PARAMETER record is mandatory). In such a case, the value in the PENALTY.RATE in the contract will take precedence over the value in the PD.PARAMETER record. Subsequent to the input in this field and authorization of the LD contract, if the PENALTY.RATE in PD.PARAMETER is deleted and replaced with a CONTRACT.METHOD setting, then, when the LD contract becomes overdue, the rate in PENALTY.RATE in the LD contract is ignored and the penalty spread (if any) is calculated according to the CONTRACT.METHOD in PD.PARAMETER

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PenaltyRate

      • getPenaltySpread

        public TField getPenaltySpread()
        Returns the PenaltySpread

        Field description: This field is not used at present.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PenaltySpread

        Parameters:

        TField - The PortfolioNo

      • getPositionType

        public TField getPositionType()
        Returns the PositionType

        Field description: Identifies the Foreign Exchange position type for this transaction. Use of this field will enable the User to update any designated position with Loans and Deposits transactions which involve a currency conversion. This field is to be further defined, locally. Validation Rules: 1-2 alpha characters. Optional input. Default to TR (trading). The User must define at least one Foreign Exchange position type for Trading position (TR). Any input in this field will be checked against the FX POS TYPE table.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PositionType

      • getPrinAddress

        public TField getPrinAddress(int idx)
        Returns the PrinAddress at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the Principal Amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified, or it will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) For Loans, DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits, PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Once a Loan contract has been authorised any amendment will impact future events only. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited when input in both PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 and PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or PRIN.BEN.BANK.2.

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getPrinAddress

        public List<TField> getPrinAddress()
        Returns the collection of PrinAddress

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the Principal Amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified, or it will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) For Loans, DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits, PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Once a Loan contract has been authorised any amendment will impact future events only. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited when input in both PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 and PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or PRIN.BEN.BANK.2.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getPrinBenBank1

        public TField getPrinBenBank1()
        Returns the PrinBenBank1

        Field description: The customer number of the bank to whom principal payments are to be physically made. If input, this field indicates that physical principal delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent or, alternatively, the correspondent of the customers bank. If transfers involving 4 parties are required an additional entry will be required in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. or If the second correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in PRIN.ADDRESS (a freeformat field) and BENEF.PRIN.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid customer on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) PRIN.ADDRESS * * * * D) BENEF.PRIN.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are freeformat fields. Once a Loan contract has been authorised any amendment will impact future events only. Input in this field will be checked against the AGENCY table which holds the Bank's name and address for all outputs produced by the system. 'Autorouting of payments' Standard payment details held on the Agency table for the contract customer will be used in this field when payment is required only if no input is made by the user. It is permitted to enter non-standard instructions whenever necessary. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 alphanumeric Customer Mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = blank.) For Loans the account specified in DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits the account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different customer number to that specified in PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 or PRIN.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PrinBenBank1

      • getPrinBenBank2

        public TField getPrinBenBank2()
        Returns the PrinBenBank2

        Field description: The Customer number of the second bank involved in four-party transfers of the principal component. In the case of 3 party transfers the recipient bank where the customer maintains his account. If input, this field indicates that physical principal delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent. If transfers involving 4 parties are required an additional entry will be required in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or If the first correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in PRIN.ADDRESS (a freeformat field) and BENEF.PRIN.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid CUSTOMER on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) PRIN.ADDRESS * * * D) BENEF.PRIN.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are freeformat fields. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) Customer mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = none.) Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different number to that specified in PRIN.BEN.BANK.1. For Loans, the account specified in DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits, the account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Once the contract has been authorised, and the contract is a Loan any amendments will impact future events only. For Deposit contracts this field may be changed any time up to maturity. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or PRIN.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PrinBenBank2

      • getPrinIncLimamt

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        TField -

        Parameters:

        List<TField> -

      • getPrinLiqAcct

        public TField getPrinLiqAcct()
        Returns the PrinLiqAcct

        Field description: Indicates the account number where entries are made for the reimbursement of the principal at liquidation. If the account through which reimbursement is to be made is not known the User can choose to enter one digit (from 1 to 9) which will identify the text (defined in LMM.TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the Customer. This will result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. The defaulting process looks firstly at the SEC.ACC.MASTER record using the portfolio no. If no default found uses the CUSTOMER.CCY.ACCT record and finally if still no default found takes details from the AGENCY record and NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. These settings can be overriden by using ACCOUNT.PARAMETER to set the account default method. If a Nostro account is specified then the appropriate liquidation instructions will be required in PRIN.BEN.BANK.1, PRIN.BEN.BANK.2, PRIN.ADDRESS and BENEF.PRIN.ACCT. This field can be changed at any time during the life of the contract; such changes will not be retrospective. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner proceeds for settlement may directly be drawn down from/to an account denominated in any currency. In case the underlying Contract Customer (eg. Customer.id in MONEYMARKET,Counterparty in FOREX, etc.) has a record in CUSTOMER.SSI application, then the account number in this field gets defaulted as per the definition for that Customer from CUSTOMER.SSI.For more information on the usage of this feature please refer to CUSTOMER.SSI application. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters-relating to a Customer Account, a Nostro Account. or 3-10 alphanumeric account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = Drawdown account.) Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. An account entered that is not equal to the default account will require an override. The system will check for posting restrictions and require an override if necessary. If a Nostro account is specified, it must be a valid entry on NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Prohibited for Commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PrinLiqAcct

      • getPrincFxRate

        public TField getPrincFxRate()
        Returns the PrincFxRate

        Field description: This field is not used at present.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The PrincFxRate

      • getProvision

        public TField getProvision()
        Returns the Provision

        Field description: Indicates the Provision percentage that has been applied for this contract. If the contract is eligible for Provisioning, system updates this field during COB according to the rules defined in ASSET.CLASS.PARAMETER. Allows Manual input as well (by changing PROVISION.METHOD field to MANUAL) to override the System classification. Accounting entries would be raised online in accordance with the new Provision percentage.. When PD exists for the contract, this field should match the Provision percentage in the corresponding PD contract. Validation Rules: Input allowed only when PROVISION.METHOD is MANUAL. Holds Null when there is no asset classification. Maximum of 3 Numeric characters. Allows '0'(Zero) as a Value.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Provision

      • getProvisionAmount

        public TField getProvisionAmount()
        Returns the ProvisionAmount

        Field description: Indicates the total amount provisioned for this contract. Validation Rules: No-Input field Standard Amount field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ProvisionAmount

      • getProvisionMethod

        public TField getProvisionMethod()
        Returns the ProvisionMethod

        Field description: Indicates whether asset classification should be computed Automatically or maintained manually. When this field is populated with NULL (for new contracts) or AUTO, system computes the asset classification during the next Provision review Frequency( defined in ASSET.CLASS.PARAMETER) and updates the ASSET.CLASS, PROVISION and PROVISION.AMOUNT with the new details. When this field is populated as MANUAL, it is assumed that the user Manages the asset classification manually and the contract would be skipped for any computation of Provision until the field is switched back to AUTO. Validation Rules: Accepts either MANUAL or AUTO.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ProvisionMethod

      • getRecordStatus

        public String getRecordStatus()
        Returns the RecordStatus

        Field description: Indicates the record status of the contract. The record status is as follows:- INAU contract input not authorised. CNAU contract copied not authorised. RNAU contract reversed not authorised. IHLD contract input to hold. CHLD contract copied to hold. MAT contract matured. REVE contract reversed. INAO contract partially authorised, needs person(s) with special override classification to complete authorisation. Validation Rules: 4 alphabetic characters of the form: INAU INAO CNAU RNAU IHLD CHLD MAT REVE (System generated.) Input prohibited.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        String - The RecordStatus

      • getRedRecourse

        public TField getRedRecourse()
        Returns the RedRecourse

        Field description: The input in this field is required to specify whether a rediscount transaction is being done on a with recourse or without recourse basis. If set to YES, the loan Accounting Entries (i) In case the field is set to NO, the following will be the accounting entries on the value date of the rediscount transaction For the discount transaction

        Dr Principal Liquidation Account Bill Amount
        Cr Loan Asset Account (CONSOL.ENT.TODAY entry) Bill Amount
        Cr P/L Balance interest amount to be amortised
        Dr Interest Received in Advance (CONSOL.ENT.TODAY entry) Balance interest amount to be amortised
        For the rediscount transaction
        Dr Drawdown Account For value in field DRAWDOWN ISSUE PR
        Dr Charge Liquidation Account For Rediscount Profit : value populated in field CHRG.AMOUNT
        Dr P/L For value in field ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT
        Cr P/L For Rediscount Profit : value populated in field CHRG.AMOUNT
        Cr Principal Liquidation Account For Bill Amount (Face Value)
        (ii) In case the field is set to "YES", on rediscount, a deposit transaction is created (with zero interest rate). The following will be the accounting entries raised on rediscounting
        Dr Drawdown Account For value in field DRAWDOWN ISSUE PR
        Dr Charge Liquidation Account For Rediscount Profit : value populated in field CHRG.AMOUNT
        Dr P/L For value in field ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT
        Cr P/L For Rediscount Profit : value populated in field CHRG.AMOUNT
        Cr Deposit Liability For Bill Amount (Face Value)
        Validations Will accept values of YES or NO only Can be used only for bill rediscounting transactions. If set to NO, care must be taken to see that the RETURN.INT field in the original discount transaction is set to NO.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The RedRecourse

      • getReducedRate

        public TField getReducedRate()
        Returns the ReducedRate

        Field description: Used for reporting purposes only. Flags those loans assigned a 'Reduced Rate'. This code will be used for reporting purposes and to flag those loans which have a special reduced rate granted by the account officer to the customer. The loans identified as reduced-rate loans should be only those renegotiated loans that are on an accrual basis. This field can be changed at any time during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1 alpha character of the following form: (N)ormal rate (R)educed rate (Optional input. Default "N" = Normal.) Valid for Loan contracts only.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ReducedRate

      • getReimbReserved

        public List<ReimbReservedClass> getReimbReserved()
        Returns the unmodifiable collection of ReimbReserved
        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<ReimbReservedClass> -

      • getReimbReserved

        public ReimbReservedClass getReimbReserved(int idx)
        Returns the ReimbReserved at the specified position in this collection.
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the element to return
        Returns:
        ReimbReservedClass -

      • getReimburseAccrual

        public TField getReimburseAccrual()
        Returns the ReimburseAccrual

        Field description: Specifies if the premium or discount arising from the Reimbursement Price is to be accrued throughouth the life of the contract or is to be posted on the maturity date only. The premium or discount amount (REIMBURSE.PL.AMT) arising from the reimbursement price can be accrued on the following basis: NO - Not accrued LINEAR - Calculated as Discount Amount * Days since start/days in period ACTUARIA - Calculated based on the actuarial value of the discount amount. LINEAR The accrual method can be changed throughout the life of the contract if required on a straight line basis between the VALUE.DATE and the FIN.MAT.DATE. The amortised amount on a given date is calculated using the formula: (See Figure 1 below) ACTUARIAL ACCRUAL If the ACTUARIAL method is used the REIMB.PL.AMOUNT is amortised on an actuarial basis between the VALUE.DATE and the FIN.MAT.DATE. The amortised amount on a given date is calculated using the formula: An Internal Rate of Return (IRR) is calculated for the deal using the formula (See Figure 2 below) Be careful with IRR rates since, for example, a 10 year loan at 7% compounded Annually would need an IRR of over 9.9% without any compounding this is then used to calculate the amortisation amount: (See Figure 3 below) Validation Rules: Only NO, LINEAR, ACTUARIAL allowed. Must be NO for Call/Notice contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ReimburseAccrual

      • getReimburseAmount

        public TField getReimburseAmount()
        Returns the ReimburseAmount

        Field description: This field defines the Reimbursement amount of the contract. This amount can be above or below the nominal amount of the contract. If an amount of 500 or less is entered, then this is treated as a percentage of the contract nominal amount. This field is updated with the calculated percentage amount (100% always being the nominal amount). The reimbursement amount is the amount to be debited/credited on a loan/ deposit contract at the contract maturity. The reimbursement price is normally quoted as a percentage of the nominal, and is usually fixed at input. Whenever a repayment or principal increase/decrease takes place, this field is recalculated as a percentage of the remaining nominal issuing the REIMBURSE.PRICE. The difference between the REIMBURSE.PRICE and the contract nominal is posted to profit and loss. Validation Rules: 1-19 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Optional input. Default = Contract nominal amount). If an amount of 500 or less is entered, it is treated as a percentage of the contract nominal amount. If an amount followed by a % sign is entered, the amount is calculated as a percentage of the outstanding nominal. This field is a NOCHANGE field after drawdown.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ReimburseAmount

      • getReimbursePlAmt

        public TField getReimbursePlAmt()
        Returns the ReimbursePlAmt

        Field description: This is a NOINPUT field which identifies the Profit & Loss amount which has arisen through specifying a Reimbursement Price which is different than the contract nominal amount. This field is defaulted to the Reimbursement Amount (REIMBURSE.AMOUNT) minus the contract nominal amount (AMOUNT). e.g. Deposit amount 10 M Reimburse Amount 11 M Reimb P&L Amount 1 M Validation Rules: 1-19 numeric characters (Standard amount field). (NOINPUT field. Default = See details).

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ReimbursePlAmt

      • getReimbursePrice

        public TField getReimbursePrice()
        Returns the ReimbursePrice

        Field description: The price a bond is reimbursed at, as a percentage of the nominal value. When purchasing bonds a reimbursement price is quoted as a percentage of the nominal amount, this may be more or less than 100%. The price entered here will be used to calculate the amount which the customer will actually pay/receive at contract maturity, stored in the field REIMBURSE.AMOUNT. The difference between the Nominal and the reimbursement amount is stored as the REIMBURSE.PL.AMT Validation Rules: Must be numeric in the range 0 - 999.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ReimbursePrice

      • getRepayCap

        public TField getRepayCap()
        Returns the RepayCap

        Field description: Indicates whether the capitalised interest is to be inlcuded for repayments The capitalised interest can be repaid on or before maturity date Value YES indicates that the user will have to include the capitalised interest as part of the repayment schedules Value NULL indicates that the user will have to define P schedules only for the original principal Validation Rules: Field Value : Can be YES or null. Default value is null Prohibited for Commitment contracts, Sundries and Accounts Receivable Prohibited if Interest Basis is Special Prohibited for bullet type contracts Not applicable for discounted contracts Not applicable for annuity contracts Not applicable when INTEREST.DUE.DATE is given

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The RepayCap

      • getReserves

        public TField getReserves()
        Returns the Reserves

        Field description: Indicates the value of reserves held against this contract. The value indicated reflects the reserve provision made against this contract. This field can be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Standard Amount field). (Optional input. Default value = null.) Allowed for Loan transactions only. Reserves must be less than or equal to the value specified in AMOUNT.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Reserves

      • getResidualValue

        public TField getResidualValue()
        Returns the ResidualValue

        Field description: Specifies the residual value of a leasing contract. Input disallowed if ANNUITY.PAY.METHOD is not specified. The residual value will be used in the repayment calculation and will be repaid on maturity date. Validation Rules: Optional input field. Must be GT 0 if a loan otherwise, must be LT 0.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ResidualValue

      • getReturnCom

        public TField getReturnCom()
        Returns the ReturnCom

        Field description: In discounted loan contracts the commission amount is collected up-front. This field indicates whether commission amount on a discounted loan contract needs to be refunded to the customer consequent to any change in the terms of contract like early closure of loan, reduction in rate of commission etc. Input of "YES" means that the extra commission amount would be refunded to the customer. Input of "NO" means that the extra commission amount would be booked as profit. However taxes, if collected, will not be refunded to the customer. Validation Rules: Input must be "YES" or "NO" The field, if left blank will be populated with a value of RETURN.COM field from LMM.INSTALL.CONDS file. Functionality applicable only for discounted loan contracts

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ReturnCom

      • getReturnInt

        public TField getReturnInt()
        Returns the ReturnInt

        Field description: In discounted loan contracts the interest amount is collected up-front. This field indicates whether interest amount on a discounted loan contract needs to be refunded to the customer consequent to any change in the terms of contract like early closure of loan, reduction in rate of interest etc. Input of "YES" means that the extra interest amount would be refunded to the customer. Input of "NO" means that the extra interest amount would be booked as profit. However taxes, if collected, will not be refunded to the customer. Input must be "YES" or "NO" The field, if left blank will be populated with a value of RETURN.INT field from LMM.INSTALL.CONDS file. Functionality applicable only for discounted loan contracts

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ReturnInt

      • getRevContingent

        public TField getRevContingent()
        Returns the RevContingent

        Field description: Options DED & NULL are provided. If DED (Drawdown End date) were chosen, contingent entries would be reversed out for undrawn residual at the end of EACH tranche draw down end dates. For NULL, reversal of contingent entry for residual undrawn is on final maturity date REV. CONTINGENT can be flagged as DED only for L.C.U.TYPE 'N' or 'R'. If commitment were defined in tranches at the end of each DD.END.DATE the reversal would be handled for any residue. For a commitment with a single tranche it would be on the DD.END.DATE in place of the FIN.MAT.DATE. At the time of each drawdown, reversal of contingent for the amount drawn would continue in the existing manner for both values DED and NULL. Validation Rules: Only allowed values are DED & NULL. Optional input. Default value is NULL. DED not permitted for Cumulative Type of Commitment (RC or NC).

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The RevContingent

      • getRoundingRule

        public TField getRoundingRule()
        Returns the RoundingRule

        Field description: The ROUNDING.RULE at contract level allows the User to define the rule which is used for rounding fee, interest and charge amounts calculations apart from rounding rules specified at currency level.This can be defaulted from the LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION for the category. However if no rounding rule is specified by the user or defaulted, then the rounding rule given at EB.ACCRUAL.PARAM if exists, is used, else the rules at currency level takes precedence. Validation rules Should be valid record in EB.ROUNDING.RULE

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The RoundingRule

      • getSecuredYN

        public TField getSecuredYN()
        Returns the SecuredYN

        Field description: Indicates whether the contract is secured or not. This field can be changed at any time during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-3 typa AAA (alpha A-Z, a-z) characters of the form: or (Y)es (N)o (Optional input. Default value = No.) Valid for Commitment and Loan contracts only.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The SecuredYN

      • getSendConfirmation

        Field description: Determines whether payments are sent or suppressed for this deal. Validation Rules: 1-3 type AAA (alpha A-Z, a-z) characters of the form: (Y)es or No (Optional input)

        Parameters:

        TField - The SendPayment

      • getSettlementMarket

        public TField getSettlementMarket()
        Returns the SettlementMarket

        Field description: While settling the dues in a LD where liquidation is made in a currency other then the deal currency, the user may input the exchange rate for each scheduled day for each currency (in which dues are repaid) in SETTLEMENT.RATES table. If the bank desires to use a single rate for all liquidations in a specific currency(s), a new currency market may be created in order to define the liquidation rate for each currency. First a new market has to be created in CURRENCY.MARKET. The default exchange rate that is to be used for settlement is input in the respective currency tables under the specific market chosen. User may input the BUY & SELL rates for all currencies in which settlement may take place on that day. Based on the value in SETTLEMENT.MARKET and CONVERSION.TYPE (which may be BUY/SELL/MID) in the deal, the appropriate rate is used for conversion purposes during EOD. If the user has input a rate in EV.APPL.RATE in SETTLEMENT.RATES table for a particular deal, then this rate is considered for conversion. Should there be no input in EV.APPL.RATE for the deal for the scheduled date, the rate in the CURRENCY table for the CURRENCY.MARKET and CONVERSION.TYPE defined in the deal is used for conversion. Eg. The bank desires to have a single conversion rate for all GBP loan dues that are settled in USD. In this case single input of exchange rate in the currency table for the relevant market and conversion type would suffice. If the rate that is to be applied to a particular deal is different, respective rate may be defined in EV.APPL.RATE. Validation Rules: 2 numeric characters. Code must be in the range 1-99. Must be a valid value on the CURENCY.MARKET table.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The SettlementMarket

      • getSpecialCommBasis

        public TField getSpecialCommBasis()
        Returns the SpecialCommBasis

        Field description: Holds the Commission basis used for deriving system calculated commission amount when COMM.CALC.METHOD is 'S'. Validation Rules: Can hold only values 'A_B_C_D_E_F_H_A1_A2_F1_F2' Once contract is authorised, the field cannot be amended - NOCHANGE field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The SpecialCommBasis

      • getSpecialIntBasis

        public TField getSpecialIntBasis()
        Returns the SpecialIntBasis

        Field description: Holds the Interest basis used for deriving system calculated interest amount when INTEREST.BASIS is 'S'. Validation Rules: Can hold only values 'A_B_C_D_E_F_H_A1_A2_F1_F2' Once contract is authorised, the field cannot be amended - NOCHANGE field

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The SpecialIntBasis

      • getSpreadVDate

        public TField getSpreadVDate()
        Returns the SpreadVDate

        Field description: The effective date of change to new spread rate. The date when the new spread becomes effective. Validation Rules: Standard date format. (Optional input.) Can be back valued to the last interest schedule only. If SUSPEND.INCOME is flagged to YES in the relevant category PD.PARAMETER, then back valuing cannot be for a date prior to the date on which OVERDUE.STATUS changed to NAB. Mandatory if a value in NEW SPREAD, otherwise prohibited. Must be a valid date. One forward dated action allowed at any one time. Cannot be greater than or equal to the value in FIN.MAT.DATE. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. Prohibited for Commitments. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Input prohibited prior to first authoristion of contract. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited prior or equal to value date of Negotiated deal for Interest.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The SpreadVDate

      • getStaYN

        public TField getStaYN()
        Returns the StaYN

        Field description: Indicates whether the limit is impacted upon at commitment inception date, (N); or at drawdown date,(Y). If the response is (N)o the commited amount is deducted from the limit availability at commitment inception date. If (Y)es is indicated the limit deduction will be made at drawdown date. Both instances are subject to availability. Validation Rules: 1 type AAA (alpha A-Z, a-z) character of the form: (Y)es or (N)o (Optional input. Default = (N)o.) Valid for Commitment contracts only. This field cannot be changed after authorisation.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The StaYN

      • getStatus

        public TField getStatus()
        Returns the Status

        Field description: This field indicates the status of the contract. One status change per day is allowed. The status can only be changed manually if STATUS CONTROL is set to (M)anual. The status indicator beyond CUR can only be changed by the user if the liquidation code is set to 3 FULLY MANUAL. Status changes must always follow one of the sequences listed below:- MANUAL AUTOMATIC FOR LOANS CHANGE CHANGE Interim Dates CUR PDO CUR YES YES CUR PDO NABWOF YES NO CUR PDO NABLIQ YES YES CUR NAB WOF YES NO CUR NAB LIQ YES NO Maturity Dates CUR LIQ YES YES CUR PDO NABLIQ NO YES CUR NAB LIQ YES NO CUR PDO NABWOF YES NO CUR NAB WOF YES NO CUR NAB LIQ YES NO CUR PDO LIQ YES YES An additional status change is indicated below, this relates to the generation of a tax obligation for which the Bank may be liable. WHT The status changes for PDO + NAB are governed by eight fields on LMM INSTALL CONDS. Six of these fields are applicable at interim dates, two relate to events occuring at maturity date. Interim events. DAYS PRIOR PDO P DAYS PRIOR NAB P DAYS PRIOR PDO I DAYS PRIOR NAB I DAYS PRIOR PDO C DAYS PRIOR NAB C Maturity events. DAYS PRIOR PDO MAT DAYS PRIOR NAB MAT The status change to WOF is handled exclusively by the user; the system will never change the contract to this status. The status of Call Notice contracts will not be automatically changed to PDO or NAB by the system as no principal amounts will be overdue unless the user inserts a date in FIN MAT DATE (Field 7) to mature the contract. Other overdue elements for Call Notice loans will be reported separately. EVENTS OCCURING AT THE CONTRACT MATURITY DATE AT MATURITY DATE Date = field MATURITY DATE (contract main file). ALL LOANS STATUS CHANGE FROM CUR STATUS CHANGE TO LIQ This change will occur when there are no overdue components nor outstanding prepayments input via LD.RECEIPT.ENTRY. PAST DUE OBLIGATION. "PDO" If overdue components exist on the contract then this status change will occur once the number of days, following maturity, indicated in field DAYS PRIOR PDO MAT on LMM INSTALL CONDS have lapsed. If the contract maturity date is 1/7/86 and the value in field DAYS PRIOR PDO MAT is 3, the EOD on the 4/7/86 will result in a status change to PDO and penalty accruals being computed for the period 1/7/86 to 4/7/86 inclusive. ALL LOANS LIQUIDATION CODE LOCKED 3 STATUS CHANGE FROM CUR STATUS CHANGE TO PDO PAYMENT TYPE INT BEARING. NORMAL ACCRUAL NO PENALTY ACCRUAL YES Penalty interest &/or commission will accrue on the value indicated in field OUTS OD PRINC contained on LMM ACCOUNT BALANCES. These will be either on a Memo or Financial basis according to the values in PEN 1 ACC F MEM and PEN C ACC F MEM. NON ACCRUAL BASIS. "NAB" If overdue components are still outstanding on the contract then this status change will occur once the number of days, following maturity, indicated in field DAYS PRIOR NAB MAT on LMM INSTALL CONDS have lapsed. If the contract maturity date is 1/7/86 and the value in field DAYS PRIOR NAB MAT is 4, the EOD on the 5/7/86 will result in a status change to NAB and all outstanding interest and/or commission and/or fees accruals for the current interest/commission period being processed according to the value in field NAB.W.OFF.CAP on LMM INSTALL CONDS. ALL LOANS LIQUIDATION CODE LOCKED 3 STATUS CHANGE FROM PDO STATUS CHANGE TO NAB PAYMENT TYPE INT BEARING. NORMAL ACCRUAL WRITTEN OFF or CAPITALISED PENALTY ACCRUAL WRITTEN OFF or CAPITALISED The system will transfer all outstanding/overdue principal values contained in the fields OUTS CURR PRINC OUTS OD PRINC to the field OUTS PRINC NAB contained on LMM ACCOUNT BALANCES. Additionally the system will reverse the values for the following Profit & Loss components. OUTS ACCRUED INT OUTS OVER DUE INT OS INT ACC ON OD P OUTS ACCRUED COM OUTS OVER DUE COM OS COM ACC ON OD P If the value in field NAB W OFF CAP on LMM INSTALL CONDS is C then the corresponding entry to the above reversals will be to the following field on LMM ACCOUNT BALANCES. OUTS PRINC NAB However, drawdowns under Commitments cannot be capitalised and will therefore be processed as if field NAB W OFF CAP on LMM INSTAL CONDS had been set to 'W'. Loans not linked to a Commitment will be capitalised. If the value in field NAB W OFF CAP on LMM INSTALL CONDS is W then the corresponding entry to the above reversals will be to the category indicated on the following field on LMM INSTALL CONDS PL O SET IR SUS PL O SET CR SUS For contracts with an NAB status all future scheduled events will be cancelled. Residual financial components will be construed to be overdue. For contracts with an NAB status the status can only become WOF or LIQ. Non Accrual Basis 'NAB' Accruals For contracts with 'NAB' status, interest &/or commission accruals will continue to be processed with values contained in the following fields on LMM ACCOUNT BALANCES. OUTS INT ON NAB OUTS COMM ON NAB The corresponding entries will be passed to the category indicated in the following fields on LMM INSTALL CONDS. PL O SET IR SUS PL O SET CR SUS WRITE OFF. "WOF" This status relates to a write off of principal only. The system will never change the status of a contract to WOF, this must always be effected manually by the user. ALL LOANS LIQUIDATION CODE LOCKED 3 STATUS CONTROL MANUAL STATUS CHANGE FROM NAB STATUS CHANGE TO WOF PAYMENT TYPE INT BEARING. NORMAL ACCRUAL NOT APPLIC. PENALTY ACCRUAL NOT APPLIC. The value in the field OUTS PRINC NAB, OUTS INT ON NAB and OUTS COMM ON NAB on LMM ACCOUNT BALANCES will be written off to the category indicated in field PL DEBIT WRITE OFF on LMM INSTALL CONDS. This is a final status, contracts will be written to history during the next End Of Day processing run. LIQUIDATION. "LIQ" LIQ status can only be set once all amounts have been either cleared using Payment Receipt function or after contract has been returned to "CUR" status and all events have processed successfully. EVENTS OCCURING AT INTERIM EVENTS PAST DUE OBLIGATION. "PDO" DATE = DAYS PRIOR PDO P (INSTALL CONDITIONS) DATE = DAYS PRIOR PDO I (INSTALL CONDITIONS) DATE = DAYS PRIOR PDO C (INSTALL CONDITIONS) The contract status will change once the appropriate number of days indicated on LMM INSTALL CONDS has lapsed. ALL LOANS STATUS CHANGE FROM CUR STATUS CHANGE TO PDO PAYMENT TYPE INT BEARING. NORMAL ACCRUAL YES PENALTY ACCRUAL YES/COMPONENT PRINCIPAL PAST DUE OBLIGATION. Penalty interest &/or commission will be accrued on the overdue component of the contract with effect from the due date. Interest &/or commission will accrue in the normal fashion on the current element of the contract. INTEREST PAST DUE OBLIGATION. An overdue interest component is never subject to penalty accruals. The value represents the default on an interest payment date and is for reporting/enquiry purposes only. COMMISSION/FEES PAST DUE OBLIGATION. An overdue commission component is never subject to penalty accruals. The value represents the default on a commission payment date and is for reporting/enquiry purposes only. It is possible for contracts with a PDO status to revert back to CUR status. However CUR status can only be reinstated after all overdue elements have been cleared using LD.RECEIPT ENTRY. Call Notice loan contracts status will remain CUR and overdue elements of interest, commission or fees reported separately. NON ACCRUAL BASIS. "NAB" DATE = DAYS PRIOR NAB P (INSTALL CONDITIONS) DATE = DAYS PRIOR NAB I (INSTALL CONDITIONS) DATE = DAYS PRIOR NAB C (INSTALL CONDITIONS) The contract status will change once the appropriate number of days indicated on LMM INSTALL CONDS has lapsed. The contract will now be subject to processing in the manner indicated under "NAB contracts at the maturity date". WRITE OFF. "WOF" The contract will now be subject to processing in the manner indicated under "WOF contracts at the maturity date". Validation Rules: 3 type AAA (alpha A-Z, a-z) characters of the following form: FWD = Forward value CUR = Current PDO = Past due obligation NAB = Non accrual basis UCL = Unclaimed WHT = Tax receipt pending WOF = Written off REV = Reversed LIQ = Liquidated Amendments will apply to Loan and Commitment contract types only. Amendments to "CUR" + "PDO" contracts allowed only when contracts in manual status or when "NAB". "NAB" status is invalid for interest basis "S" and discounted contracts, prior to the final maturity date. "PDO","NAB","WOF" or "LIQ" is invalid for any contract which has prepayments pending. Only one status change per day is permitted, additionally the only other changes which can occur during that day are to fields STATUS CONTROL and LIQUIDATION CODE. Change to CUR prohibited if any component is overdue. Change to PDO or NAB prohibited if there are no overdue components. Change to PDO prohibited if there is a principal increase outstanding. Manual status changes are prohibited unless the value in field STATUS CHANGE = (M)anual. Manual status changes are prohibited unless the value in field LIQUIDATION CODE = 3. "WOF" status is only permitted for a contract bearing the status "NAB". "NAB" and "WOF" status prohibited for Commitments.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The Status

      • getStatusControl

        public TField getStatusControl()
        Returns the StatusControl

        Field description: This field can be used to manually control the status of the contract. Manual status control indicates that status changes are under the complete control of the user. Extreme caution should be exercised to ensure that the contract integrity is preserved. The system will not change the status according to the criteria indicated in either LMM INSTALLATION CONDITIONS or hard coded in a program; this is the total responsibility of the user. Automatic status control indicates that status changes are automatically actioned by the system according to the criteria indicated in either LMM INSTALL CONDITIONS or hard coded in a program. Interest basis (S)pecial transactions lose their special characteristics upon reaching the contract maturity date. The effect is as follows: A) Interest Basis "S" contracts will revert to the currency default days basis and use the contract rate for accrual purposes. It will not be possible to manually change the status of a contract while it is "CUR" without first setting it to manual. Validation Rules: 1 type AAA (alpha A-Z ,a-z) character of the form: A = Automatic status control M = Manual status control (Optional input. Default value = "A".) Manual status control permitted for Loan and Commitment contracts only. Manual status control permitted when "CUR", "PDO", "NAB", "WOF" or "LIQ" only. The status can only be manually amended after the contract has been authorised. Manual status control is prohibited for Call and Notice contracts.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The StatusControl

      • getStmtNo

        public List<TField> getStmtNo()
        Returns the collection of StmtNo

        Field description: Number to identify either a Statement Entry or a Category Entry in respect of the contract. When a new contract is input,there will be an entry on the Drawdown Account and field entries will be generated e.g. Value .1 STMT NO. 664445752.06 Value .2 STMT NO. 1 Value .3 STMT NO. 1 where value .1 indicates a reference number unique to the transaction, and value .2 indicates the number of events which have occurred in relation to this transaction, Value .3 indicates a Category Entry reference no.These suffices can be appended to the unique reference no. for the purpose of 'SEEing' information on the terminal screen. Validation Rules: 11 Numeric characters of the form: nnnnnnnnn.nn System generated Multivalue field This field is NOINPUT

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getStmtNo

        public TField getStmtNo(int idx)
        Returns the StmtNo at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Number to identify either a Statement Entry or a Category Entry in respect of the contract. When a new contract is input,there will be an entry on the Drawdown Account and field entries will be generated e.g. Value .1 STMT NO. 664445752.06 Value .2 STMT NO. 1 Value .3 STMT NO. 1 where value .1 indicates a reference number unique to the transaction, and value .2 indicates the number of events which have occurred in relation to this transaction, Value .3 indicates a Category Entry reference no.These suffices can be appended to the unique reference no. for the purpose of 'SEEing' information on the terminal screen. Validation Rules: 11 Numeric characters of the form: nnnnnnnnn.nn System generated Multivalue field This field is NOINPUT

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getTaxCommissionKey

        public TField getTaxCommissionKey()
        Returns the TaxCommissionKey

        Field description: Represents a reference on the TAX table which will indicate the rate to be used for computation of commission taxation. Commission taxation in all instances is charged to the customer on the relevant commission payment dates. No accrual will be performed. Commission on Loans will be grossed up to include the tax component. This field can be defaulted if the TAX.COMMISSION.TYPE field is input. See the helptext for CONTRACT.GRP and TAX.COMISSION.TYPE for further information. Validation Rules: 2 numeric characters. (Optional input. Default = no tax.) Input is not accepted for Sundries or Accounts Receivable. Prohibited if a value in W H TAX ALT and/or W H TAX RATE KEY. Must be a valid reference on the TAX table. Prohibited for Deposit contracts. Prohibited for contracts which are not commission bearing. Once authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TaxCommissionKey

      • getTaxCommissnType

        public TField getTaxCommissnType()
        Returns the TaxCommissnType

        Field description: Using this field together with the CONTRACT.GRP field it is possible to determine a particular commission tax code from conditions based on ; General tax type as defined in the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION application Type of customer as defined in the CUSTOMER.CHARGES application Type of contract as defined in the CONTRACT.GRP field. The value in this field must equate to a record in the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION application which contains tax codes related to customer tax group and contract group. Whenever commission tax is recalculated the correct tax code will be determined and the TAX.COMMISSION.KEY and TOT.COM.TAX fields updated accordingly. If the calculated tax amount changes between sending a payment and the end of the relvant tax period then an exception will be raised during the end of day indicating the different amounts. It will be stored in EXCEPTION.LOG.HIST. If this field is not used then the relevant tax code can be entered via the TAX.COMISSION.KEY field. Validation Rules: Optional input, must be present as a record on TAX.TYPE.CONDITION. The actual TAX.TYPE.CONDITION key value will be prefixed by the "*" character (asterisk).

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TaxCommissnType

      • getTaxIntKey

        public List<TField> getTaxIntKey()
        Returns the collection of TaxIntKey

        Field description: Pseudo field for TAX.INTEREST.KEY

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        List<TField> -

      • getTaxIntKey

        public TField getTaxIntKey(int idx)
        Returns the TaxIntKey at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Pseudo field for TAX.INTEREST.KEY

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

        Returns the TaxIntType at the specified position in this collection.

        Field description: Pseudo field for TAX.INTEREST.TYPE

        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the element to return
        Returns:
        TField -

      • getTaxPrincipalKey

        public TField getTaxPrincipalKey()
        Returns the TaxPrincipalKey

        Field description: Represents a reference on the TAX table which will indicate the rate to be used for computation of principal taxation. The relevant tax key can be defaulted if the TAX.PRINCIPAL.TYPE field is used. See the help text for CONTRACT.GRP and TAX.PRINCIPAL.TYPE for further information. Principal tax in all instances is charged to the customer on the contract drawdown date .No accruals will be performed. Validation Rules: 2 numeric characters. (Optional input. Default = no tax.) Input is not accepted for Sundries or Accounts Receivable. Prohibited if a value in W H TAX ALT and/or W H TAX RATE KEY. Must be a valid reference on the TAX table. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited for Syndicated Commitment contracts. Once authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TaxPrincipalKey

      • getTaxPrincipalType

        public TField getTaxPrincipalType()
        Returns the TaxPrincipalType

        Field description: Using this field together with the CONTRACT.GRP field it is possible to determine a particular principal tax code from conditions based on: General tax type as defined in the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION application Type of customer as defined in the CUSTOMER.CHARGES application Type of contract as defined in the CONTRACT.GRP field. The value in this field must equate to a record in the TAX.TYPE.CONDITION application which contains tax codes related to customer tax group and contract group. Whenever principal tax is recalculated the correct tax code will be determined and the TAX.PRINCIPAL.KEY and TOT.PRINC.TAX fields updated accordingly. If this field is not used then the relevant tax code can be entered via the TAX.PRINCIPAL.KEY field. Validation Rules: Optional input, must be present as a record on TAX.TYPE.CONDITION. The actual TAX.TYPE.CONDITION key value will be prefixed by the "*" character (asterisk).

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TaxPrincipalType

      • getThirdLimRef

        public TField getThirdLimRef()
        Returns the ThirdLimRef

        Field description: Validation Rules: should be valid LIMIT.REFERENCE

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ThirdLimRef

      • getThirdPartyId

        public TField getThirdPartyId()
        Returns the ThirdPartyId

        Field description: Apart from tracking limits on the primary customer for a loan, it may also be required to keep track of a third party limit. Such a situation could arise where the primary customer is advanced a loan on the strength of an instrument issued by a third party, like a bill or cheque. Validation Rules: Can be used only for loan contracts Should be a valid CUSTOMER.ID

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ThirdPartyId

      • getThirdPartyRef

        public TField getThirdPartyRef()
        Returns the ThirdPartyRef

        Field description: Represents an external reference number applicable to a third party. This field can be used to input any external reference number of a third party. This field may be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-16 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input.) Must be valid SWIFT characters.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The ThirdPartyRef

      • getTotCancelIntAmt

        public TField getTotCancelIntAmt()
        Returns the TotCancelIntAmt

        Field description: Contains the calculated interest to be cancelled based on the amount cancelled between the effective date, defined in field AMT.V.DATE, and the cancellation date, defined in the field CANCELLATION.DATE. This field is the sum of the amounts defined in field CANCELLED.INT. Validation Rules: Up to 19 type AMT numeric characters. This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TotCancelIntAmt

      • getTotComTax

        public TField getTotComTax()
        Returns the TotComTax

        Field description: The total amount of tax payable on the commission due on the contract for the current period. If a commission tax rate or key is specified on the contract this field will represent the total amount commission of tax which has been computed by the system. When commission is liquidated the tax due is added/deducted automatically and the net amount paid to the counterparty. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (System generated.) This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TotComTax

      • getTotIntTax

        public TField getTotIntTax()
        Returns the TotIntTax

        Field description: The total amount of tax payable on the interest due on this contract. If an interest tax rate or key is specified on this contract this field will represent the total amount of interest tax which has been computed by the system. When interest is liquidated the tax due is added/deducted automatically and the net amount paid to the counterparty. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (System generated.) This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TotIntTax

      • getTotInterestAmt

        public TField getTotInterestAmt()
        Returns the TotInterestAmt

        Field description: The total computed interest for the life or current/first period of the contract. Specifies the automatically calculated interest amount due for the current interest period for all interest types except for basis "S". The following considerations should be borne in mind: a) This field requires input when the interest basis is "S" and when interest schedules have not been defined. b) When the interest basis is "S" and interest schedules have been defined then this field will be updated by the system with a value representing the interest amount defined for the current/first interest period. c) When the user has defined interest schedules this field will only show the interest due for the first/current interest period. d) If the interest rate type is "floating" or there is an interest rate review scheduled in the middle of the current period, then an estimated amount will be calculated for the remaining contract life. e) For interest basis "S" the system will accrue into P+L based on the rate provided the difference will be compensated for within the final period thus agreeing with the user defined interest amount. f) For Commitment contracts the value in this field will be computed taking into account the value in LCU CALC BASE and BAND LEVEL IND. g) For CALL/NOTICE contracts, when the INTEREST.DUE.DATE (Field 148) is left blank this field will be written with the value '0' (zero). Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input.) Input prohibited for all contracts, except when interest basis "S" is used and interest schedules have not been defined whereupon input is mandatory. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. For interest basis "S" the value input or the sum of the interest schedules must be within a tolerance of 5% when compared with the product of contract value * rate * period. See note above. For interest basis "S" if the variance exceeds 1% an override will be required. See note above. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TotInterestAmt

      • getTotPrincTax

        public TField getTotPrincTax()
        Returns the TotPrincTax

        Field description: The total amount of tax payable on the principal due on the contract. If a principal tax rate or key is specified on the contract this field will represent the total amount of principal tax which has been computed by the system. When principal is liquidated the tax due is added/deducted automatically and the net amount paid to the counterparty. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (System generated.) This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TotPrincTax

      • getTotalCapCharge

        public TField getTotalCapCharge()
        Returns the TotalCapCharge

        Field description: Contains the sum of the capitalised charges with respect to the type of contract. Where the charges decrease the principal this figure will be negative, for an increase to the principal this will be positive. This field is cleared after authorisation of changes

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TotalCapCharge

      • getTotalCommAmount

        public TField getTotalCommAmount()
        Returns the TotalCommAmount

        Field description: Specifies the commission amount due on this contract. Specifies the automatically calculated commission amount due for the current commission period for all commission basis except for basis "S". The following considerations should be borne in mind: a) This field requires input when the commission basis is "S" and when commission schedules have not been defined. b) When the commission basis is "S" and commission schedules have been defined then this field will contain a value representing the commission amount defined for the first/current commission period. c) When the user has defined commission schedules this field will show the commission accrued in the first/current commission period only. d) If the commission rate type is "floating" or there is a commission rate review scheduled in the middle of the current period, then an estimated amount will be calculated for the remaining contract life. e) For commission basis "S" the system will accrue into P+L based on the rate * principal value * days; the difference will be compensated for within the final period. f) For Commitment contracts the value in this field will be computed taking into account the value in LCU CALC BASE. g) For CALL/NOTICE contracts when COMM.DUE.DATE (field 149) is left blank, this field will be populated with the value '0' (zero). Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input.) Allowed for Loan and Commitment contract types only. Input is prohibited for all contract types except when commission basis "S" is used and commission schedules have not been defined whereupon input is mandatory. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. For commission basis "S" the value input or the sum of the commission schedules must be within a tolerance of 5% when compared with the product of contract value * rate * period. See note above. For commission basis "S" if the variance exceeds 1% an override will be required. See note above. Input in this field is prohibited when schedules are defined.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TotalCommAmount

      • getTotalWHT

        public TField getTotalWHT()
        Returns the TotalWHT

        Field description: This field is not used at present.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TotalWHT

      • getTradeDate

        public TField getTradeDate()
        Returns the TradeDate

        Field description: Specifies the date an issue was traded. This field, if specified will be used to provide the default base for the VALUE.DATE. The VALUE.DATE will be defaulted by adding the days delivery for the CURRENCY to the TRADE.DATE, using the holiday definitions of LD.BUS.DAY.CENTRES. Validation Rules: Optional Field, no change allowed Cannot be greater than today.

        Parameters:
        Returns:
        TField - The TradeDate

      • getUseDefPiRate

        public TField getUseDefPiRate()

        Field description: When this field is set to yes, then a deal with periodic interest can bevalidated without setting a starting interest rate. The starting rate will be automatically set from the schedule after it is defined using the first interest rate reset value. Validation Rules: Yes or No Defaults to No

        Parameters:

      • getVDateForPFx
