      • setCustRemarks

        public void setCustRemarks(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified CustRemarks to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Narrative to be printed on the customers confirmations and advices. The remarks entered in this field are printed on confirmations/advices to the customer. The remarks are deleted from the contract (written to history) once they have been printed. Any amendments to this field will impact on the subsequent confirmation/ advice. Validation Rules: Free format of up to 4 lines maximum 35 type (alphanumeric) characters per line. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Only 4 lines allowed. Mandatory input if a value in field ALONE.MERGE.IND.

        Parameters:
        param - the CustRemarks to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCustRemarks

        public void setCustRemarks(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified CustRemarks to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Narrative to be printed on the customers confirmations and advices. The remarks entered in this field are printed on confirmations/advices to the customer. The remarks are deleted from the contract (written to history) once they have been printed. Any amendments to this field will impact on the subsequent confirmation/ advice. Validation Rules: Free format of up to 4 lines maximum 35 type (alphanumeric) characters per line. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Only 4 lines allowed. Mandatory input if a value in field ALONE.MERGE.IND.

        Parameters:
        param - the CustRemarks to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCustomerId

        public void setCustomerId(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CustomerId
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The counterparty to the contract. This is the identification number or mnemonic assigned to the Customer. The System will use this number to: a) Identify the Counterparty of the transaction. b) Obtain the Customer's name and address for inclusion on all contracts and advices produced by this module. If WALK.IN.CUST is completed, this will override the details on the customer record. Validation Rules: 3-10 alphanumeric customer mnemonic or 1-10 numeric character customer number. (Mandatory input.) Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed. Must be equal to Commitment customer for drawdowns under commitments.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCustomerId

        public void setCustomerId(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CustomerId
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The counterparty to the contract. This is the identification number or mnemonic assigned to the Customer. The System will use this number to: a) Identify the Counterparty of the transaction. b) Obtain the Customer's name and address for inclusion on all contracts and advices produced by this module. If WALK.IN.CUST is completed, this will override the details on the customer record. Validation Rules: 3-10 alphanumeric customer mnemonic or 1-10 numeric character customer number. (Mandatory input.) Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed. Must be equal to Commitment customer for drawdowns under commitments.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCustomerRef

        public void setCustomerRef(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for CustomerRef
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Defines the customer's own reference number. The reference number input in this field will be printed on all advices and confirmations, etc. with the bank's contract number. This field may be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-16 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input.) Must be valid SWIFT characters.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setCustomerRef

        public void setCustomerRef(TField value)
        Set the specified value for CustomerRef
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Defines the customer's own reference number. The reference number input in this field will be printed on all advices and confirmations, etc. with the bank's contract number. This field may be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-16 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input.) Must be valid SWIFT characters.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDDMultAmt

        public void setDDMultAmt(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified DDMultAmt to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Drawdowns can be expressed in multiples of this amount. The value will be construed to be in the currency of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Must be less than or equal to the commitment amount. Valid for Commitment contracts only.

        Parameters:
        param - the DDMultAmt to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDDMultAmt

        public void setDDMultAmt(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified DDMultAmt to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Drawdowns can be expressed in multiples of this amount. The value will be construed to be in the currency of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Must be less than or equal to the commitment amount. Valid for Commitment contracts only.

        Parameters:
        param - the DDMultAmt to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDaysPreAdvice

        public void setDaysPreAdvice(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DaysPreAdvice
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Customer notice by the system is required for an event; scheduled payment, interim interest or final maturity reminder etc. Days Pre Advice is the number of days before an event that a confirmations notice will be sent out. If populated this field is the chosen field of priority regardless of what is held in LMM.ADVICES. Validation Rules: Rule 1 A positive whole number. Rule 2

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDaysPreAdvice

        public void setDaysPreAdvice(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DaysPreAdvice
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Customer notice by the system is required for an event; scheduled payment, interim interest or final maturity reminder etc. Days Pre Advice is the number of days before an event that a confirmations notice will be sent out. If populated this field is the chosen field of priority regardless of what is held in LMM.ADVICES. Validation Rules: Rule 1 A positive whole number. Rule 2

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDdFeeCode

        public void setDdFeeCode(DdFeeCodeClass param, int idx)
        Set the specified DdFeeCode to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.
        Parameters:
        param - the DdFeeCode to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealerDesk

        public void setDealerDesk(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DealerDesk
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the dealer desk relating to the transaction. Validation Rules: 2 alphanumeric characters in the range A-Z, a-z, plus 0-9 Mandatdory field. Default taken from user profile (Field 41), Input Optional. Must be an existing code on the DEALER.DESK table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDealerDesk

        public void setDealerDesk(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DealerDesk
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the dealer desk relating to the transaction. Validation Rules: 2 alphanumeric characters in the range A-Z, a-z, plus 0-9 Mandatdory field. Default taken from user profile (Field 41), Input Optional. Must be an existing code on the DEALER.DESK table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDefaultedValue

        public void setDefaultedValue(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DefaultedValue
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field will indicate whether the INTEREST RATE / KEY & SPREAD LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION & LD.GROUP.CONDITION. If INTEREST RATE / KEY & SPREAD 'YES' If user inputs INTEREST RATE / KEY & SPREAD 'NO' The value in the field is used to determine whether this contract has to be selected during EOD LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION or LD.GROUP.CONDITION If this field holds the value 'YES' LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION LD.GROUP.CONDITION END OF DAY. Validation Rules: System written field. Will hold value YES NO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDefaultedValue

        public void setDefaultedValue(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DefaultedValue
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field will indicate whether the INTEREST RATE / KEY & SPREAD LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION & LD.GROUP.CONDITION. If INTEREST RATE / KEY & SPREAD 'YES' If user inputs INTEREST RATE / KEY & SPREAD 'NO' The value in the field is used to determine whether this contract has to be selected during EOD LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION or LD.GROUP.CONDITION If this field holds the value 'YES' LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION LD.GROUP.CONDITION END OF DAY. Validation Rules: System written field. Will hold value YES NO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDefineScheds

        public void setDefineScheds(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DefineScheds
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: If "yes", upon validation the system will automatically take the user to the schedule define screen where interim schedules can be defined manually or semi-automatically. The user will have to specify the scheduled actions which are to occur over the life of the contract. Such actions can include principal, interest, commission, fees, margin revisions, rate revisions or diary actions. The aforementioned actions are not restricted to inception or maturity events. In the case of participating Syndications the values within the schedules represents the users (00) portion only; the syndications portions are computed based on these values and the percentages indicated within the syndication fields of the contract. For Syndications where the user is a non participating agent the values defined within the schedules represent the Syndication as a whole. Upon responding YES to DEFINE SCHEDS and validating the contract the system will take you to the following input screen: :LOANS DEPOSITS TESTING LD.SCHEDULE DEFINE 111 : :222 333 444 555 666 : :777 INT: 888 COM:999 : :: :FORWARD.BACKWARD KEY:A1 BASE.DATE KEY:B1 : :SCH DATE AMOUNT/DIARY ACTION RATE CHRG NO FREQ: :C1 C2 C3 C4 C5 C6 C7: : : : : : : : : :: Where the following 9 items are supplied by the system: 111 = Contract number. 222 = Currency mnemonic. 333 = Amount of contract. (or Principal to be re-defined inclusive of forward dated principal increases) 444 = Start date of contract. 555 = Maturity date of contract. 666 = Payment method and category. 777 = Customer mnemonic. 888 = Interest rate type and interest basis. 999 = Commission rate type and commission calculation method. The following information has to be input by the user: A1 = forward/backward key where: 1 = forward 2 = backward 3 = fwd same month 4 = not automatic(default) When the user wishes the system to generate a series of schedules automatically this code will indicate the response if the derived day is a non-working day. If the derived day is a non working day the system response will be: 1 = forward The system will go forward to the next working day. 2 = backward The system will go backward to the last working day. 3 = fwd same month The system will go forward to the next working day provided it is within the same month. If it is not within the same month the system will go backward. 4 = not automatic The user must specify each and every event date. If non-working days are specified the system will prompt for overrides. B1 = base date key where: 1 = base 2 = previous 3 = not automatic (default) This code indicates to the system how the future event dates are to be computed. 1 = base The system will use the first scheduled date entered to compute the subsequent event date(s). 2 = previous The system will use the last computed schedule date in order to compute the subsequent event date. 3 = not automatic The user will enter each and every event date. This option is only valid if the forward/backward key = 4 not automatic. C1 = schedule type i.e. "P" = principal "I" = interest "C" = commission "R" = revision "M" = margin "F" = fees "D" = diary "S" = settlement (system) "A" = advice (system) Not all codes are allowed ie Commitments cannot have principal repayment or margin amendments. Combinations are allowed where the schedule is valid for the components ie principal and interest. C2 = schedule event date ie . DDMMM DDMMMYY DDMMMYYYY DDMMYY DDMMM DDMM YYYYMMDD DD This is the end date of the first period and the starting date for the next/all subsequent events. C3 = amount of schedule or diary narrative. This field indicates the amount of an action or the appropriate diary narrative. An amount can be up to 14 characters plus a decimal point; diary narrative is 35 characters per line. C4 = the revision rate. This relates to the revision rate for either the interest or margin components. C5 = charge code. A valid charge code as defined on the CHARGES table. This field relates to fees and the fee currency will always be in the currency of the contract. C6 = number of scheduled events to occur. This field indicates the number of subsequent scheduled events that are to occur. C7 = frequency of the form nnnD = daily nnnM = monthly nnnQ = Quarterly nnnS = semi annually nnnA = annually with nnn = 1 to 999 and indicates the period between schedule event i.e. 4 D = every four days. Considerations for Syndications. When the user is "AGENT" and a participant the screen definition will relate to the participating agents share (type 00). The remainder of the syndicate detail will be computed based on the percentages indicated on the contract. When the user is "AGENT" and not a participant the screen definition relates to the syndicate definition as a whole (type 99). Validation Rules: 1-3 alphabetic characters of the form: (Y)es or (N)o (Optional input. Default = No.) FOR ALL SCHEDULE TYPES Schedule definition prohibited for Accounts Receivable, Sundries, Call and Notice Contracts. Schedule definition mandatory for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC Interest Rate type. Schedule definition mandatory for PERIODIC MANUAL Interest Rate type. Schedule definition prohibited if the value in AUTO SCHEDS = (Y)es. If unauthorised schedules exist, then input to DEFINE SCHEDS is prohibited. Changing from DEFINE SCHEDS to AUTO SCHEDS is prohibited for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC and PERIODIC MANUAL Interest Rate types. A valid date is mandatory for each schedule type. If a date is input it must be a valid date format. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date, as defined on the HOLIDAY table, is a non-working day. Input prohibited for dates prior to the value in the Field VALUE.DATE. Input prohibited for dates later than the value in the Field FIN.MAT.DATE. If an amount is input it must be a valid amount format. If a schedule type is input this must be of the form P, I, C, M, D, F, or R, or a valid combination of up to three i.e. PIC. Schedules can only be defined for dates greater than the system dates except for I + C schedules when the system date equals the value date. If re-definition is specified input must be one of the following values P I R C M F D or ALL. If interest basis "S" is used both the "FORWARD/BACKWARD KEY" and the "BASE DATE KEY" must be set to "NOT AUTOMATIC. Define schedules prohibited for overnight Contracts of all Category types. Principal, Interest, Commission and Fee dates must equal value dates in relevant FX fields. For deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field, the field can be flagged to "YES" only if interest is to be capitalised. Define schedules prohibited if FIN.MAT.DATE is less than or equal to process date.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDefineScheds

        public void setDefineScheds(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DefineScheds
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: If "yes", upon validation the system will automatically take the user to the schedule define screen where interim schedules can be defined manually or semi-automatically. The user will have to specify the scheduled actions which are to occur over the life of the contract. Such actions can include principal, interest, commission, fees, margin revisions, rate revisions or diary actions. The aforementioned actions are not restricted to inception or maturity events. In the case of participating Syndications the values within the schedules represents the users (00) portion only; the syndications portions are computed based on these values and the percentages indicated within the syndication fields of the contract. For Syndications where the user is a non participating agent the values defined within the schedules represent the Syndication as a whole. Upon responding YES to DEFINE SCHEDS and validating the contract the system will take you to the following input screen: :LOANS DEPOSITS TESTING LD.SCHEDULE DEFINE 111 : :222 333 444 555 666 : :777 INT: 888 COM:999 : :: :FORWARD.BACKWARD KEY:A1 BASE.DATE KEY:B1 : :SCH DATE AMOUNT/DIARY ACTION RATE CHRG NO FREQ: :C1 C2 C3 C4 C5 C6 C7: : : : : : : : : :: Where the following 9 items are supplied by the system: 111 = Contract number. 222 = Currency mnemonic. 333 = Amount of contract. (or Principal to be re-defined inclusive of forward dated principal increases) 444 = Start date of contract. 555 = Maturity date of contract. 666 = Payment method and category. 777 = Customer mnemonic. 888 = Interest rate type and interest basis. 999 = Commission rate type and commission calculation method. The following information has to be input by the user: A1 = forward/backward key where: 1 = forward 2 = backward 3 = fwd same month 4 = not automatic(default) When the user wishes the system to generate a series of schedules automatically this code will indicate the response if the derived day is a non-working day. If the derived day is a non working day the system response will be: 1 = forward The system will go forward to the next working day. 2 = backward The system will go backward to the last working day. 3 = fwd same month The system will go forward to the next working day provided it is within the same month. If it is not within the same month the system will go backward. 4 = not automatic The user must specify each and every event date. If non-working days are specified the system will prompt for overrides. B1 = base date key where: 1 = base 2 = previous 3 = not automatic (default) This code indicates to the system how the future event dates are to be computed. 1 = base The system will use the first scheduled date entered to compute the subsequent event date(s). 2 = previous The system will use the last computed schedule date in order to compute the subsequent event date. 3 = not automatic The user will enter each and every event date. This option is only valid if the forward/backward key = 4 not automatic. C1 = schedule type i.e. "P" = principal "I" = interest "C" = commission "R" = revision "M" = margin "F" = fees "D" = diary "S" = settlement (system) "A" = advice (system) Not all codes are allowed ie Commitments cannot have principal repayment or margin amendments. Combinations are allowed where the schedule is valid for the components ie principal and interest. C2 = schedule event date ie . DDMMM DDMMMYY DDMMMYYYY DDMMYY DDMMM DDMM YYYYMMDD DD This is the end date of the first period and the starting date for the next/all subsequent events. C3 = amount of schedule or diary narrative. This field indicates the amount of an action or the appropriate diary narrative. An amount can be up to 14 characters plus a decimal point; diary narrative is 35 characters per line. C4 = the revision rate. This relates to the revision rate for either the interest or margin components. C5 = charge code. A valid charge code as defined on the CHARGES table. This field relates to fees and the fee currency will always be in the currency of the contract. C6 = number of scheduled events to occur. This field indicates the number of subsequent scheduled events that are to occur. C7 = frequency of the form nnnD = daily nnnM = monthly nnnQ = Quarterly nnnS = semi annually nnnA = annually with nnn = 1 to 999 and indicates the period between schedule event i.e. 4 D = every four days. Considerations for Syndications. When the user is "AGENT" and a participant the screen definition will relate to the participating agents share (type 00). The remainder of the syndicate detail will be computed based on the percentages indicated on the contract. When the user is "AGENT" and not a participant the screen definition relates to the syndicate definition as a whole (type 99). Validation Rules: 1-3 alphabetic characters of the form: (Y)es or (N)o (Optional input. Default = No.) FOR ALL SCHEDULE TYPES Schedule definition prohibited for Accounts Receivable, Sundries, Call and Notice Contracts. Schedule definition mandatory for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC Interest Rate type. Schedule definition mandatory for PERIODIC MANUAL Interest Rate type. Schedule definition prohibited if the value in AUTO SCHEDS = (Y)es. If unauthorised schedules exist, then input to DEFINE SCHEDS is prohibited. Changing from DEFINE SCHEDS to AUTO SCHEDS is prohibited for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC and PERIODIC MANUAL Interest Rate types. A valid date is mandatory for each schedule type. If a date is input it must be a valid date format. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date, as defined on the HOLIDAY table, is a non-working day. Input prohibited for dates prior to the value in the Field VALUE.DATE. Input prohibited for dates later than the value in the Field FIN.MAT.DATE. If an amount is input it must be a valid amount format. If a schedule type is input this must be of the form P, I, C, M, D, F, or R, or a valid combination of up to three i.e. PIC. Schedules can only be defined for dates greater than the system dates except for I + C schedules when the system date equals the value date. If re-definition is specified input must be one of the following values P I R C M F D or ALL. If interest basis "S" is used both the "FORWARD/BACKWARD KEY" and the "BASE DATE KEY" must be set to "NOT AUTOMATIC. Define schedules prohibited for overnight Contracts of all Category types. Principal, Interest, Commission and Fee dates must equal value dates in relevant FX fields. For deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field, the field can be flagged to "YES" only if interest is to be capitalised. Define schedules prohibited if FIN.MAT.DATE is less than or equal to process date.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDeliveryLink

        public void setDeliveryLink(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DeliveryLink
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used to override standard delivery conditions for the contract and is checked against a message control table where the actual delivery conditions are stored. See documentation of MESSAGE CONTROL for a more detailed explanation of this field and its function. This field can be changed at any time during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-3 numeric characters. (Optional input. Default value = 1.) Must be a valid code on MESSAGE CONTROL table. On Sundries and Accounts Receivable the delivery link must specify PRINT or TELEX methods only.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDeliveryLink

        public void setDeliveryLink(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DeliveryLink
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Used to override standard delivery conditions for the contract and is checked against a message control table where the actual delivery conditions are stored. See documentation of MESSAGE CONTROL for a more detailed explanation of this field and its function. This field can be changed at any time during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-3 numeric characters. (Optional input. Default value = 1.) Must be a valid code on MESSAGE CONTROL table. On Sundries and Accounts Receivable the delivery link must specify PRINT or TELEX methods only.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawdownAccount

        public void setDrawdownAccount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DrawdownAccount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The account number of the drawdown account to be used on the Value Date. The defaulting process looks firstly at the SEC.ACC.MASTER record using the portfolio no, If no default found uses the CUSTOMER.CCY.ACCT record and finally if still no default found takes details from the AGENCY record and NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. These settings can be overriden by using ACCOUNT.PARAMETER to set the account default method. The account to be credited or debited on the appropriate value date. Should the account indicated be a Nostro then further input may be required in the appropriate fields listed below: PRIN BEN BANK 1 PRIN BEN BANK 2 PRIN ADDRESS BENEF PRIN ACCT If the account, through which delivery is to be made, is not known the user can choose to enter one digit (from 1 to 9) which will identify a text (defined in LMM.TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the customer. This will also result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. The system will default to the first current account of the customer for the contract currency. The account indicated in this field will be used as the default account in the remaining account fields if no further account numbers are specified. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner funds may be directly drawn down from/to an account denominated in any currency. In case the underlying Contract Customer (eg. Customer.id in MONEYMARKET,Counterparty in FOREX) has a record in CUSTOMER.SSI application, then the account number in this field gets defaulted as per the definition for that Customer from CUSTOMER.SSI.For more information on the usage of this feature please refer to CUSTOMER.SSI application. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters relating to a Customer Account or a Nostro Account or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default = Current account in contract currency.) Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. Must be a valid entry on LMM.TEXT. Not valid for Commitment contracts. An account entered that is not equal to the default account will require an override. The system will check for account posting restrictions and require an override if necessary. This field can be changed at any time, however, if it is changed after the VALUE.DATE it will affect principal increases/decreases only.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawdownAccount

        public void setDrawdownAccount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DrawdownAccount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The account number of the drawdown account to be used on the Value Date. The defaulting process looks firstly at the SEC.ACC.MASTER record using the portfolio no, If no default found uses the CUSTOMER.CCY.ACCT record and finally if still no default found takes details from the AGENCY record and NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. These settings can be overriden by using ACCOUNT.PARAMETER to set the account default method. The account to be credited or debited on the appropriate value date. Should the account indicated be a Nostro then further input may be required in the appropriate fields listed below: PRIN BEN BANK 1 PRIN BEN BANK 2 PRIN ADDRESS BENEF PRIN ACCT If the account, through which delivery is to be made, is not known the user can choose to enter one digit (from 1 to 9) which will identify a text (defined in LMM.TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the customer. This will also result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. The system will default to the first current account of the customer for the contract currency. The account indicated in this field will be used as the default account in the remaining account fields if no further account numbers are specified. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner funds may be directly drawn down from/to an account denominated in any currency. In case the underlying Contract Customer (eg. Customer.id in MONEYMARKET,Counterparty in FOREX) has a record in CUSTOMER.SSI application, then the account number in this field gets defaulted as per the definition for that Customer from CUSTOMER.SSI.For more information on the usage of this feature please refer to CUSTOMER.SSI application. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters relating to a Customer Account or a Nostro Account or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default = Current account in contract currency.) Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. Must be a valid entry on LMM.TEXT. Not valid for Commitment contracts. An account entered that is not equal to the default account will require an override. The system will check for account posting restrictions and require an override if necessary. This field can be changed at any time, however, if it is changed after the VALUE.DATE it will affect principal increases/decreases only.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawdownEntDate

        public void setDrawdownEntDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DrawdownEntDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the Value date to be used for the accounting entries raised at contract initiation. This field is by default equal to the VALUE.DATE, but may be set to be a date after this. The VALUE.DATE is the effective date for interest purposes and should be entered as the start of the interest period. The drawdown entry date may be required to be later than the Value date when bonds are processed, and are entered during the coupon period. The start of the coupon period should be entered as the Value Date, this field should be entered as the Value date required for the purchase. Validation Rules: Cannot be prior to the VALUE.DATE Not allowed for commitment or liability commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawdownEntDate

        public void setDrawdownEntDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DrawdownEntDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the Value date to be used for the accounting entries raised at contract initiation. This field is by default equal to the VALUE.DATE, but may be set to be a date after this. The VALUE.DATE is the effective date for interest purposes and should be entered as the start of the interest period. The drawdown entry date may be required to be later than the Value date when bonds are processed, and are entered during the coupon period. The start of the coupon period should be entered as the Value Date, this field should be entered as the Value date required for the purchase. Validation Rules: Cannot be prior to the VALUE.DATE Not allowed for commitment or liability commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawdownIssuePrc

        public void setDrawdownIssuePrc(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DrawdownIssuePrc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field defines the Drawdown issue price of the contract. This amount can be above or below the nominal amount of the contract. This amount is net of any adjustment fees and/or expenses. If an amount of 500 or less is entered, then this is treated as a percentage of the contract nominal amount. This field is updated with the calculated percentage amount (100% always being the nominal amount). Validation Rules: 1-19 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Optional input. Default = Contract nominal amount). If an amount of 500 or less is entered, it is treated as a percentage of the contract nominal amount. This field is a NOCHANGE field after drawdown.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawdownIssuePrc

        public void setDrawdownIssuePrc(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DrawdownIssuePrc
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field defines the Drawdown issue price of the contract. This amount can be above or below the nominal amount of the contract. This amount is net of any adjustment fees and/or expenses. If an amount of 500 or less is entered, then this is treated as a percentage of the contract nominal amount. This field is updated with the calculated percentage amount (100% always being the nominal amount). Validation Rules: 1-19 numeric characters plus a decimal point and commas. (Optional input. Default = Contract nominal amount). If an amount of 500 or less is entered, it is treated as a percentage of the contract nominal amount. This field is a NOCHANGE field after drawdown.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawdownNetAmt

        public void setDrawdownNetAmt(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for DrawdownNetAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This no-input field identifies the Drawdown net amount of the contract. It is the amount that the counterparty will pay or receive at Drawdown. It is defaulted to the drawdown issue price minus any adjustment fees/ expenses. This amount can be above or below the nominal amount of the contract. The difference is booked to Profit & Loss (the category code and transaction code for the P&L amount is defined on the LMM.INSTALL.CONDS file). The Delivery message for the contract will be produced using this amount. Validation Rules: 1 to 19 numeric characters (type AMT). This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setDrawdownNetAmt

        public void setDrawdownNetAmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for DrawdownNetAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This no-input field identifies the Drawdown net amount of the contract. It is the amount that the counterparty will pay or receive at Drawdown. It is defaulted to the drawdown issue price minus any adjustment fees/ expenses. This amount can be above or below the nominal amount of the contract. The difference is booked to Profit & Loss (the category code and transaction code for the P&L amount is defined on the LMM.INSTALL.CONDS file). The Delivery message for the contract will be produced using this amount. Validation Rules: 1 to 19 numeric characters (type AMT). This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFederalFunds

        public void setFederalFunds(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FederalFunds
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: If the contract is denominated in US$ then this field will indicate whether settlement is to be in Federal Funds. This field can be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-3 type AAA alpha (A-Z, a-z) characters of the form: or (Y)es (N)o (Optional input. Default = No.) Allowed only for contracts denominated in US$. The currency code for US$ must be held as "USD".

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFederalFunds

        public void setFederalFunds(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FederalFunds
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: If the contract is denominated in US$ then this field will indicate whether settlement is to be in Federal Funds. This field can be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-3 type AAA alpha (A-Z, a-z) characters of the form: or (Y)es (N)o (Optional input. Default = No.) Allowed only for contracts denominated in US$. The currency code for US$ must be held as "USD".

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFeePayAccount

        public void setFeePayAccount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FeePayAccount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Represents the account to which the fees/charges will be credited. This field indicates the account which will be credited with any charges/ fees payable applicable to a Loan or Deposit contract. Fees and Charges are always expressed in the contract currency. If the account, through which delivery is to be made is not known, the user can choose to enter one digit (from 1-9) which will identify a text (defined in LMM TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the customer. This will also result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. This field can be changed at any time; such changes will not be retrospective. Payable fees are denoted by the PAY.RECEIVE field of the LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS record, containing a value of PAY. A Payable fee entered into the main LD record fields CHRG.CODE, CHRG.AMOUNT will be credited to the account nominated in this field. Fees may be linked to a Principal Repayment ("P" schedule), or an interest payment ("I" schedule) by defining a CHARGE.CODE with the appropriate schedule, when schedules are defined. In this case the fee will be credited to the account linked to the schedule type, i.e. for a "P" schedule the PRIN.LIQ.ACCT will be used, for an "I" schedule the INT.LIQ.ACCT will be used. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner proceeds for settlement may directly be drawn down to an account denominated in any currency. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters-relating to a Customer Account or 3-10 alphanumeric account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default = Principal liquidation account.) Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. The system will check for account posting restrictions and require an override if necessary. The account cannot be a NOSTRO account.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFeePayAccount

        public void setFeePayAccount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FeePayAccount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Represents the account to which the fees/charges will be credited. This field indicates the account which will be credited with any charges/ fees payable applicable to a Loan or Deposit contract. Fees and Charges are always expressed in the contract currency. If the account, through which delivery is to be made is not known, the user can choose to enter one digit (from 1-9) which will identify a text (defined in LMM TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the customer. This will also result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. This field can be changed at any time; such changes will not be retrospective. Payable fees are denoted by the PAY.RECEIVE field of the LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS record, containing a value of PAY. A Payable fee entered into the main LD record fields CHRG.CODE, CHRG.AMOUNT will be credited to the account nominated in this field. Fees may be linked to a Principal Repayment ("P" schedule), or an interest payment ("I" schedule) by defining a CHARGE.CODE with the appropriate schedule, when schedules are defined. In this case the fee will be credited to the account linked to the schedule type, i.e. for a "P" schedule the PRIN.LIQ.ACCT will be used, for an "I" schedule the INT.LIQ.ACCT will be used. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner proceeds for settlement may directly be drawn down to an account denominated in any currency. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters-relating to a Customer Account or 3-10 alphanumeric account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default = Principal liquidation account.) Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. The system will check for account posting restrictions and require an override if necessary. The account cannot be a NOSTRO account.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFeeReserve1

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Standard T24 numeric field. Validation Rules: A maximum of 16 characters may be entered. This is a NOINPUT field.

      • setFinChgCalcType

        public void setFinChgCalcType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FinChgCalcType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the Financial charge calculation type. Four types are permissible, the schedule amount used for accruals is calculated as follows. 'AN' - Annuity The current annuity repayment principal amount. 'SL' - Straight Line (LD.PRINCIPAL LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) / LIFE Where LIFE is the number of repayments from the current repayment date to maturity. 'RB' - Reducing balance (CURR.PRIN.VALUE LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) * RATE * (DAYS/BASE) CURR.PRIN.VALUE is stored on LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES and is initially LD.PRINCIPAL RATE is defined via LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and is stored on SCHED.RATE on LMM.SCHEDULES DAYS and BASE are set by the Annuity interest basis This calculation is performed while CURR.PRIN.VALUE RESIDUAL.VALUE is greater than zero. 'FS' - Flexible schedules (LD.PRINCIPAL LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) * RATE * (DAYS/BASE) RATE is annual percentage depreciation defined via LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and the sum of the rates must equal 100 DAYS/BASE is derived from the frequency of the Annuity schedule e.g. monthly, quarterly etc, normally expressed in months, i.e. monthly = 1/12. Validation Rules: Optional Input Input is only allowed if ASSET.REFERENCE is input. If input must be either 'AN', 'SL', 'FS' or ''RB'

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFinChgCalcType

        public void setFinChgCalcType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FinChgCalcType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the Financial charge calculation type. Four types are permissible, the schedule amount used for accruals is calculated as follows. 'AN' - Annuity The current annuity repayment principal amount. 'SL' - Straight Line (LD.PRINCIPAL LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) / LIFE Where LIFE is the number of repayments from the current repayment date to maturity. 'RB' - Reducing balance (CURR.PRIN.VALUE LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) * RATE * (DAYS/BASE) CURR.PRIN.VALUE is stored on LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES and is initially LD.PRINCIPAL RATE is defined via LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and is stored on SCHED.RATE on LMM.SCHEDULES DAYS and BASE are set by the Annuity interest basis This calculation is performed while CURR.PRIN.VALUE RESIDUAL.VALUE is greater than zero. 'FS' - Flexible schedules (LD.PRINCIPAL LD.RESIDUAL.VALUE) * RATE * (DAYS/BASE) RATE is annual percentage depreciation defined via LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and the sum of the rates must equal 100 DAYS/BASE is derived from the frequency of the Annuity schedule e.g. monthly, quarterly etc, normally expressed in months, i.e. monthly = 1/12. Validation Rules: Optional Input Input is only allowed if ASSET.REFERENCE is input. If input must be either 'AN', 'SL', 'FS' or ''RB'

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFinMatDate

        public void setFinMatDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FinMatDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The date when the contract is due to mature. The date when the contract is due to mature, and in the case of Commitment contracts with no value in INT.END.DATE, the date when penalty interest/ commission will start to accrue. The system will ensure that the maturity date is a working day in the country(ies) defined in BUS.DAY.DEFN. This field represents either the final date when the principal amount is due to be repaid or the number of days notice required before any funds may be repaid. Fully back valued contracts can be taken in by inputting a date less than process date. For a fresh contract input, if this date is less than or equal to process date all accounting entries for creation and maturity of the deal would be generated ONLINE. Lookup files and balances files that hold historic details will be updated. In these cases the contract will be assigned a CONSOL.KEY based on the current definition on the CONSOLIDATE.COND on the date of processing. Fully back valued contracts may have only one single interest period and repayment of principal may only be bullet. Back valued fresh contract is permissible only for loan type contracts and not for commitments. No update to LIMIT is made for a fresh contract with a back value date. An existing authorised contract can be matured with a back valued date. In such cases a back date that is greater than the last schedule date may be input. Back dated maturity is not permitted beyond the last interest capitalisation date, last principal movement date or any scheduled event date. Accounting entries are raised ONLINE. If maturity date is flagged to process date all accounting entries are raised ONLINE. STMT.ENTRY and CATEG.ENTRY records are raised ONLINE and CONSOL.ENT.TODAY records are raised to mature the deal during end of day processing. Validation Rules: 1-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters or 1-3 numeric characters. (Mandatory input.) An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. The date must be greater than VALUE.DATE. For Commitment contracts the value in this field must be equal to or greater than INT.END.DATE. An override will be required if the final maturity date on a loan contract is after the value in D.D.END.DATE specified on the relevant Commitment contract. Cannot be changed for contracts with interest basis "S". Change in this field will require the redefinition of schedules. Input of a fixed date is mandatory for discounted or Interest/ Commission Basis "S". The final maturity date of a drawdown under a Commitment must be prior to or equal to the end date of that Commitment. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. Call/Notice prohibited for Syndicated loan contracts. Notice period (not Call) prohibited for Accounts Receivable/Sundry deposit contracts. An override will be required if a Call/Notice contract is changed to a fixed maturity contract and the appropriate number of days notice have not been given. Call/Notice prohibited for Commitment contracts. Drawdowns under Commitments cannot be Call/Notice.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFinMatDate

        public void setFinMatDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FinMatDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The date when the contract is due to mature. The date when the contract is due to mature, and in the case of Commitment contracts with no value in INT.END.DATE, the date when penalty interest/ commission will start to accrue. The system will ensure that the maturity date is a working day in the country(ies) defined in BUS.DAY.DEFN. This field represents either the final date when the principal amount is due to be repaid or the number of days notice required before any funds may be repaid. Fully back valued contracts can be taken in by inputting a date less than process date. For a fresh contract input, if this date is less than or equal to process date all accounting entries for creation and maturity of the deal would be generated ONLINE. Lookup files and balances files that hold historic details will be updated. In these cases the contract will be assigned a CONSOL.KEY based on the current definition on the CONSOLIDATE.COND on the date of processing. Fully back valued contracts may have only one single interest period and repayment of principal may only be bullet. Back valued fresh contract is permissible only for loan type contracts and not for commitments. No update to LIMIT is made for a fresh contract with a back value date. An existing authorised contract can be matured with a back valued date. In such cases a back date that is greater than the last schedule date may be input. Back dated maturity is not permitted beyond the last interest capitalisation date, last principal movement date or any scheduled event date. Accounting entries are raised ONLINE. If maturity date is flagged to process date all accounting entries are raised ONLINE. STMT.ENTRY and CATEG.ENTRY records are raised ONLINE and CONSOL.ENT.TODAY records are raised to mature the deal during end of day processing. Validation Rules: 1-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters or 1-3 numeric characters. (Mandatory input.) An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. The date must be greater than VALUE.DATE. For Commitment contracts the value in this field must be equal to or greater than INT.END.DATE. An override will be required if the final maturity date on a loan contract is after the value in D.D.END.DATE specified on the relevant Commitment contract. Cannot be changed for contracts with interest basis "S". Change in this field will require the redefinition of schedules. Input of a fixed date is mandatory for discounted or Interest/ Commission Basis "S". The final maturity date of a drawdown under a Commitment must be prior to or equal to the end date of that Commitment. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. Call/Notice prohibited for Syndicated loan contracts. Notice period (not Call) prohibited for Accounts Receivable/Sundry deposit contracts. An override will be required if a Call/Notice contract is changed to a fixed maturity contract and the appropriate number of days notice have not been given. Call/Notice prohibited for Commitment contracts. Drawdowns under Commitments cannot be Call/Notice.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFlatCommType

        public void setFlatCommType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FlatCommType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The field can be used to indicate if commission is to be calculated as a flat fee for the commission period on the highest balance. The commission calculated would be accrued during the period. The field can either be flagged to "YES" or "NO". Input of "YES" means that commission should be calculated as a flat fee on highest balance for each period. Input of "NO" means commission should be calculated on daily outstanding balance at the rate specified. Validation Rules: Input of "YES" allowed only if CSN.CALC.TYPE is HB. Default is "NO"

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFlatCommType

        public void setFlatCommType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FlatCommType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The field can be used to indicate if commission is to be calculated as a flat fee for the commission period on the highest balance. The commission calculated would be accrued during the period. The field can either be flagged to "YES" or "NO". Input of "YES" means that commission should be calculated as a flat fee on highest balance for each period. Input of "NO" means commission should be calculated on daily outstanding balance at the rate specified. Validation Rules: Input of "YES" allowed only if CSN.CALC.TYPE is HB. Default is "NO"

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFvMarginKey

        public void setFvMarginKey(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FvMarginKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The field is the Fair Value margin rate key used to provide the fair margin rate on LD and MM contracts. Entering a value here provides a default for the field of same name on the LD and MM applications. Where the CATEGORY used on the MM & LD contract matches the id the value here will be defaulted. It can be overridden at the contract level. This field is a link to the PERIODIC.INTEREST table and the record to use depends on the currency of the contract so if a value of 01 is entered here then a USD contract will look for a record such as 01USD20010731. Validation Rules: 1-4 numeric ID code although at present use of 2 digits is required to utilise PERIODIC.INTEREST records.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFvMarginKey

        public void setFvMarginKey(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FvMarginKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The field is the Fair Value margin rate key used to provide the fair margin rate on LD and MM contracts. Entering a value here provides a default for the field of same name on the LD and MM applications. Where the CATEGORY used on the MM & LD contract matches the id the value here will be defaulted. It can be overridden at the contract level. This field is a link to the PERIODIC.INTEREST table and the record to use depends on the currency of the contract so if a value of 01 is entered here then a USD contract will look for a record such as 01USD20010731. Validation Rules: 1-4 numeric ID code although at present use of 2 digits is required to utilise PERIODIC.INTEREST records.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Set the specified value for FvRateKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The field is the Fair Value rate key used to provide the fair user rate on LD and MM contracts. Entering a value here provides a default for the field of same name on the LD and MM applications. Where the CATEGORY used on the MM & LD contract matches the id the value here will be defaulted. It can be overridden at the contract level.       • setFvRateKey

        public void setFvRateKey(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FvRateKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The field is the Fair Value rate key used to provide the fair user rate on LD and MM contracts. Entering a value here provides a default for the field of same name on the LD and MM applications. Where the CATEGORY used on the MM & LD contract matches the id the value here will be defaulted. It can be overridden at the contract level.         Parameters:
        value - The value to set

        nothing

      • setFwdBwdKey

        public void setFwdBwdKey(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FwdBwdKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field indicates the method which will be followed for the generation of interest and commission schedules as defined in INTEREST.DUE.DATE and COMM.DUE.DATE fields and the action which will be taken if the derived date is a non working day. The following provides an explanation of the various input values for this field: If the derived day is a non working day the system response will be: FWD = forward The system will go forward to the next working day. BWD = backward The system will go backward to the last working day. FSM = forward same month The system will go forward to the next working day provided it is within the same month. If it is not within the same month the system will go backward to the last working day. CAL = Calendar The system will use the same date irrespective of whether dates cycled are working days or not. Validation Rules: Rule 1 Rule 2

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFwdBwdKey

        public void setFwdBwdKey(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FwdBwdKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field indicates the method which will be followed for the generation of interest and commission schedules as defined in INTEREST.DUE.DATE and COMM.DUE.DATE fields and the action which will be taken if the derived date is a non working day. The following provides an explanation of the various input values for this field: If the derived day is a non working day the system response will be: FWD = forward The system will go forward to the next working day. BWD = backward The system will go backward to the last working day. FSM = forward same month The system will go forward to the next working day provided it is within the same month. If it is not within the same month the system will go backward to the last working day. CAL = Calendar The system will use the same date irrespective of whether dates cycled are working days or not. Validation Rules: Rule 1 Rule 2

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFwdProj

        public void setFwdProj(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for FwdProj
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field will be defaulted from the FWD.PROJ field found in LMM.INSTALL.CONDS. This field can be manipulated for each and every contract to generate 'N' number of FWD entries, LMM.SCHEDULES and PM entries This field can be made NULL and once made NULL all schedules pertaining for the contract will be built. Validation Rules: Optional input. It can be left as NULL. Accept values from 1 to 99 only

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setFwdProj

        public void setFwdProj(TField value)
        Set the specified value for FwdProj
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field will be defaulted from the FWD.PROJ field found in LMM.INSTALL.CONDS. This field can be manipulated for each and every contract to generate 'N' number of FWD entries, LMM.SCHEDULES and PM entries This field can be made NULL and once made NULL all schedules pertaining for the contract will be built. Validation Rules: Optional input. It can be left as NULL. Accept values from 1 to 99 only

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setGraceAmount

        public void setGraceAmount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for GraceAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The amount of extra interest, calculated for the grace period, to be added to the normal discounted interest amount. Example: GBP 1,000,000.00 at 10pc for 1 year - Interest GBP 100,000.00 Grace period set to 10 days - Interest GBP 2,739.73 Total Discounted Interest GBP 102,739.73 Validation Rules: System calculated amount.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setGraceAmount

        public void setGraceAmount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for GraceAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The amount of extra interest, calculated for the grace period, to be added to the normal discounted interest amount. Example: GBP 1,000,000.00 at 10pc for 1 year - Interest GBP 100,000.00 Grace period set to 10 days - Interest GBP 2,739.73 Total Discounted Interest GBP 102,739.73 Validation Rules: System calculated amount.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setGracePeriod

        public void setGracePeriod(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for GracePeriod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The number of days grace for which interest will be added to the normal discounted interest amount. This field can only be used for fixed term discount loan contracts. Setting a value in this field will affect the amount of discount interest calculated according to the number of days selected. Example: Discount loan contract 14 Feb 1996 to 13 Feb 1997 (365 days) GBP 1,000,000.00 at 10pc for 1 year - Interest GBP 100,000.00 Grace period set to 10 days - Interest GBP 2,739.73 Total Discounted Interest GBP 102,739.73 Interest calculated is equivalent to 375 days. Validation Rules: Value of 1-99 allowed. Interest method must be 2 - Discount. Valid for Loan type contracts only. Fixed term contracts only.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setGracePeriod

        public void setGracePeriod(TField value)
        Set the specified value for GracePeriod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The number of days grace for which interest will be added to the normal discounted interest amount. This field can only be used for fixed term discount loan contracts. Setting a value in this field will affect the amount of discount interest calculated according to the number of days selected. Example: Discount loan contract 14 Feb 1996 to 13 Feb 1997 (365 days) GBP 1,000,000.00 at 10pc for 1 year - Interest GBP 100,000.00 Grace period set to 10 days - Interest GBP 2,739.73 Total Discounted Interest GBP 102,739.73 Interest calculated is equivalent to 375 days. Validation Rules: Value of 1-99 allowed. Interest method must be 2 - Discount. Valid for Loan type contracts only. Fixed term contracts only.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setHbCurrPeriod

        public void setHbCurrPeriod(TField value)
        Set the specified value for HbCurrPeriod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The field stores the highest balance amount for the current period. This is a no-input field and is for information purpose only. This field gets populated only when commission is calculated on Highest balance. Validation Rules: This is a standard T24 amount field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setHbCurrPeriod

        public void setHbCurrPeriod(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for HbCurrPeriod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The field stores the highest balance amount for the current period. This is a no-input field and is for information purpose only. This field gets populated only when commission is calculated on Highest balance. Validation Rules: This is a standard T24 amount field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIasClassification

        public void setIasClassification(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IasClassification
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field holds the classification of contract based on IFRS standard.Validation Rules: Should be a valid record ID in IAS.CLASSIFICATION file.Input allowed only for Loans and DepositsInput not allowed for Call / Notice type of contractsInput not allowed for fully backdated contracts and contracts with maturity date as TODAY.This field cannot be amended after authorization

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing
