      • setIasSubtype

        public void setIasSubtype(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IasSubtype
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field holds the Sub type for the corresponding classification defined in IAS.CLASSIFICATION field. Validation Rules: Should be a valid sub type for the corresponding classification defined in IAS.CLASSIFICATION file. The field cannot be amended after authorization.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIasSubtype

        public void setIasSubtype(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IasSubtype
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field holds the Sub type for the corresponding classification defined in IAS.CLASSIFICATION field. Validation Rules: Should be a valid sub type for the corresponding classification defined in IAS.CLASSIFICATION file. The field cannot be amended after authorization.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setInclusiveCsn

        public void setInclusiveCsn(TField value)
        Set the specified value for InclusiveCsn
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Annuity type contracts have the possibility of including Commission in the Annuity payment. A standard Annuity contract will have regular payments which comprise of an amount of Principal together with an amount of Interest. The payment amount is worked out using a standard formula. An Annuity with Commission comprises of Principal, Interest and Commission. Commission on LD can be either based on the main contract commission fields (where this is used accruals can take place), or as a charge based commission (based on usage of LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS) and is set in the LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE screen. Validation Rules: Default is blank Value of Yes only allowed for Annuity types using commission If this field is invoked, currency of the PRIN.LIQ.ACCT, INT.LIQ.ACCT & COM.LIQ.ACCT should be the same.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setInclusiveCsn

        public void setInclusiveCsn(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for InclusiveCsn
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Annuity type contracts have the possibility of including Commission in the Annuity payment. A standard Annuity contract will have regular payments which comprise of an amount of Principal together with an amount of Interest. The payment amount is worked out using a standard formula. An Annuity with Commission comprises of Principal, Interest and Commission. Commission on LD can be either based on the main contract commission fields (where this is used accruals can take place), or as a charge based commission (based on usage of LMM.CHARGE.CONDITIONS) and is set in the LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE screen. Validation Rules: Default is blank Value of Yes only allowed for Annuity types using commission If this field is invoked, currency of the PRIN.LIQ.ACCT, INT.LIQ.ACCT & COM.LIQ.ACCT should be the same.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntAddress

        public void setIntAddress(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified IntAddress to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the interest amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified or this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and INT.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK1 or INT.BEN.BANK2.

        Parameters:
        param - the IntAddress to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntAddress

        public void setIntAddress(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified IntAddress to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the interest amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified or this field will take the place of INT.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and INT.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK1 or INT.BEN.BANK2.

        Parameters:
        param - the IntAddress to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntBenBank1

        public void setIntBenBank1(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntBenBank1
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The customer number of the bank to whom interest payments are to be physically made. If input, this field indicates that physical interest delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent or, alternatively, the correspondent of the customers bank. For transfers involving 4 parties an additional entry will be required in either INT.BEN.BANK.2 or If the second correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in INT.ADDRESS (a freeformat field )and BEN.INT.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid customer on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) INT.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) INT.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) INT.ADDRESS * * * * D) BEN.INT.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are free format fields. Input in this field will be checked against the AGENCY table which holds the Bank's name and address for all outputs produced by the system. 'Autorouting of payments' Standard payment details held on the Agency table for the contract customer will be used in this field when payment is required only if no input is made by the user. It is permitted to enter non-standard instructions whenever necessary. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) Customer mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = blank.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. The account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different customer number to that specified in INT.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK2 or INT.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntBenBank1

        public void setIntBenBank1(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntBenBank1
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The customer number of the bank to whom interest payments are to be physically made. If input, this field indicates that physical interest delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent or, alternatively, the correspondent of the customers bank. For transfers involving 4 parties an additional entry will be required in either INT.BEN.BANK.2 or If the second correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in INT.ADDRESS (a freeformat field )and BEN.INT.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid customer on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) INT.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) INT.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) INT.ADDRESS * * * * D) BEN.INT.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are free format fields. Input in this field will be checked against the AGENCY table which holds the Bank's name and address for all outputs produced by the system. 'Autorouting of payments' Standard payment details held on the Agency table for the contract customer will be used in this field when payment is required only if no input is made by the user. It is permitted to enter non-standard instructions whenever necessary. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) Customer mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = blank.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. The account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different customer number to that specified in INT.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK2 or INT.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntBenBank2

        public void setIntBenBank2(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntBenBank2
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The Customer number of the second bank involved in four-party transfers of the interest component.In the case of 3 party transfers the recipient bank where the customer maintains his account. If input, this field indicates that physical interest delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent. For transfers involving 4 parties an additional entry will be required in either INT.BEN.BANK.1. or If the first correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in INT ADDRESS (a freeformat field) and BEN.INT.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid CUSTOMER on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) INT.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) INT.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) INT.ADDRESS * * * * D) BEN.INT.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are be a freeformat fields. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 type AAA alpha (A-Z, a-z) character Mnemonic for the AGENCY table. (Optional input. Default value = none.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different number to that specified in INT.BEN.BANK.1. The account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. This field may be changed any time prior to maturity. Prohibted for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK.1 or INT.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntBenBank2

        public void setIntBenBank2(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntBenBank2
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The Customer number of the second bank involved in four-party transfers of the interest component.In the case of 3 party transfers the recipient bank where the customer maintains his account. If input, this field indicates that physical interest delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent. For transfers involving 4 parties an additional entry will be required in either INT.BEN.BANK.1. or If the first correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in INT ADDRESS (a freeformat field) and BEN.INT.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid CUSTOMER on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) INT.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) INT.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) INT.ADDRESS * * * * D) BEN.INT.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are be a freeformat fields. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 type AAA alpha (A-Z, a-z) character Mnemonic for the AGENCY table. (Optional input. Default value = none.) Valid for Deposit contracts only. Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different number to that specified in INT.BEN.BANK.1. The account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. This field may be changed any time prior to maturity. Prohibted for non-bank customers if input appears in either INT.BEN.BANK.1 or INT.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntCollMethod

        public void setIntCollMethod(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntCollMethod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: If the value in this field is set to REPAY.AMT, i t would be possible to collect interest on repayment amount instead of amount accrued so far. Such interest could be collected for scheduled repayments or adhoc repayments. Example : A LD contract is input with the following features: Contract Particulars Value Date 1-Jan-03 Maturity Date 1-May-03 Amount 100000 Interest Rate 10% Interest Basis 366/360 P' Schedules 1-Feb-03 25000 1-Mar-03 25000 1-Apr-03 25000 1-May-03 25000 INT.COLL.METHOD REPAY.AMT For the above contract interest would be calculated and processed on P schedule date. System would calculate the interest liquidation amount as follows; a) On 25000 @ 10% for 31 days (215.28) to be processed on Feb 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. b) On 25000 @ 10% for 59 days (409.72) to be processed on Mar 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. c) On 25000 @ 10% for 90 days (625) to be processed on Apr 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. d) On 25000 @ 10% for 120 days (833.33) to be processed on May 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. Accounting Entries for the above contract would be as under; Cr Customer Account 100000 Dr LIVEDB 100000 Jan 01, 03 - Feb 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 861.11 Dr Accruals 861.11 On Feb 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 215.28 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 215.28 Feb 01, 03 - Mar 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 583.33 Dr Accruals 583.33 On Mar 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 409.72 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 409.72 Mar 01, 03 - Apr 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 430.56 Dr Accruals 430.56 On Apr 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 625 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 625 Apr 01, 03 - May 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 208.33 Dr Accruals 208.33 On May 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 833.33 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 833.33 If an ad-hoc repayment for 10000 were made (using AMOUNT.INCREASE field) on Mar 15, 2003, interest of 202.78 (@ 10% on 10000 for 73 days) would also be collected online along with the repayment amount. Interest amount for subsequent P schedule dates would be recalculated on the redefined schedule amounts. In the above example, if dues were not paid on Apr 01, 2003, instead of debiting the customer account PD would be created for 625, for MANUAL or SEMI-AUTOMATIC liquidation mode. For value REPAY.AMT in this field the following validations shall apply: i) I schedules or any other schedule type with a combination of I schedule like PI, IP etc., cannot be defined in LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE. ii) Input would not be permitted in field INT.PAY.FREQUENCY. iii) LD contract cannot be a DEPOSIT, CALL, NOTICE, ANNUITY or COMMITMENT type contract. iv) S basis interest would not be permitted. v) Interest payment method for such contracts cannot be discounted. vi) No input would be permitted in field LAST.DAY.ACCRUAL. vii) If interest tax were applicable, the same would be applied on interest amount that is being collected only. xiii) 'B' and 'N' schedule would not be permitted. ix) Capitalisation of charge would not be permitted. x) Capitalisation of interest would not be permitted for such contracts. xi) xii) Once input and authorised, this would be a no change field. xiii) Backdated rate/spread changes and principal decreases would not be permitted beyond last Principal Schedule date. The default value for this field is NULL.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntCollMethod

        public void setIntCollMethod(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntCollMethod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: If the value in this field is set to REPAY.AMT, i t would be possible to collect interest on repayment amount instead of amount accrued so far. Such interest could be collected for scheduled repayments or adhoc repayments. Example : A LD contract is input with the following features: Contract Particulars Value Date 1-Jan-03 Maturity Date 1-May-03 Amount 100000 Interest Rate 10% Interest Basis 366/360 P' Schedules 1-Feb-03 25000 1-Mar-03 25000 1-Apr-03 25000 1-May-03 25000 INT.COLL.METHOD REPAY.AMT For the above contract interest would be calculated and processed on P schedule date. System would calculate the interest liquidation amount as follows; a) On 25000 @ 10% for 31 days (215.28) to be processed on Feb 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. b) On 25000 @ 10% for 59 days (409.72) to be processed on Mar 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. c) On 25000 @ 10% for 90 days (625) to be processed on Apr 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. d) On 25000 @ 10% for 120 days (833.33) to be processed on May 01, 2003 along with principal repayment. Accounting Entries for the above contract would be as under; Cr Customer Account 100000 Dr LIVEDB 100000 Jan 01, 03 - Feb 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 861.11 Dr Accruals 861.11 On Feb 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 215.28 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 215.28 Feb 01, 03 - Mar 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 583.33 Dr Accruals 583.33 On Mar 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 409.72 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 409.72 Mar 01, 03 - Apr 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 430.56 Dr Accruals 430.56 On Apr 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 625 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 625 Apr 01, 03 - May 01, 03 Cr P/L (Interest Income) 208.33 Dr Accruals 208.33 On May 01, 03 Dr Customer Account (Principal) 25000 Dr Customer Account (Interest) 833.33 Cr LIVEDB 25000 Cr Accruals 833.33 If an ad-hoc repayment for 10000 were made (using AMOUNT.INCREASE field) on Mar 15, 2003, interest of 202.78 (@ 10% on 10000 for 73 days) would also be collected online along with the repayment amount. Interest amount for subsequent P schedule dates would be recalculated on the redefined schedule amounts. In the above example, if dues were not paid on Apr 01, 2003, instead of debiting the customer account PD would be created for 625, for MANUAL or SEMI-AUTOMATIC liquidation mode. For value REPAY.AMT in this field the following validations shall apply: i) I schedules or any other schedule type with a combination of I schedule like PI, IP etc., cannot be defined in LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE. ii) Input would not be permitted in field INT.PAY.FREQUENCY. iii) LD contract cannot be a DEPOSIT, CALL, NOTICE, ANNUITY or COMMITMENT type contract. iv) S basis interest would not be permitted. v) Interest payment method for such contracts cannot be discounted. vi) No input would be permitted in field LAST.DAY.ACCRUAL. vii) If interest tax were applicable, the same would be applied on interest amount that is being collected only. xiii) 'B' and 'N' schedule would not be permitted. ix) Capitalisation of charge would not be permitted. x) Capitalisation of interest would not be permitted for such contracts. xi) xii) Once input and authorised, this would be a no change field. xiii) Backdated rate/spread changes and principal decreases would not be permitted beyond last Principal Schedule date. The default value for this field is NULL.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntEndDate

        public void setIntEndDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntEndDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the date when the system will stop calculating interest and commission accruals on Commitment contracts. This allows the commitment to have a grace period at the end of the commitment where no commitment fees will be accrued or applied. If this date is not input then the system will default the FINAL.MATURITY.DATE here. The field becomes a no-change field once the INT.END.DATE is reached. It can be modified if the value here is greater than the system date. 1-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Validation Rules: Valid for Commitment contracts only. Must be a valid date. Must be after the value in INT.START.DATE. Must be after the value in VALUE.DATE. Must be equal to or prior to the value FIN.MAT.DATE. Valid for Commitment contracts only. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non-working day.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntEndDate

        public void setIntEndDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntEndDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the date when the system will stop calculating interest and commission accruals on Commitment contracts. This allows the commitment to have a grace period at the end of the commitment where no commitment fees will be accrued or applied. If this date is not input then the system will default the FINAL.MATURITY.DATE here. The field becomes a no-change field once the INT.END.DATE is reached. It can be modified if the value here is greater than the system date. 1-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Validation Rules: Valid for Commitment contracts only. Must be a valid date. Must be after the value in INT.START.DATE. Must be after the value in VALUE.DATE. Must be equal to or prior to the value FIN.MAT.DATE. Valid for Commitment contracts only. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non-working day.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntLiqAcct

        public void setIntLiqAcct(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntLiqAcct
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the account number where entries are made for the reimbursement of the Interest (together with any taxes applicable to that interest) at liquidation. The defaulting process looks firstly at the SEC.ACC.MASTER record using the portfolio no. If no default found uses the CUSTOMER.CCY.ACCT record and finally if still no default found takes details from the AGENCY record and NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. These settings can be overriden by using ACCOUNT.PARAMETER to set the account default method. In a case where interest is subject to taxes, such taxes will always remain associated with their interest amount and will always be liquidated through the same account. Thus it is not possible to liquidate interest and corresponding taxes through two different accounts or in two different currencies. Input in this field will be necessary only when the disposal of the interest is different from the disposal of the principal. If the account through which delivery is to be made is not known the User can choose to enter one digit (from 1 to 9) which will identify the text (defined in LMM.TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the customer. This will result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. This field may be changed at any time during the life of the contract; such changes will not be retrospective. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner proceeds for settlement may directly be drawn down from/to an account denominated in any currency. In case the underlying Contract Customer (eg. Customer.id in MONEYMARKET,Counterparty in FOREX, etc.) has a record in CUSTOMER.SSI application, then the account number in this field gets defaulted as per the definition for that Customer from CUSTOMER.SSI.For more information on the usage of this feature please refer to CUSTOMER.SSI application. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters-relating to a Customer Account or a Nostro Account or 3-10 type A alphanumeric account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = PRIN.LIQ.ACCT) The system will check for account posting restrictions and will require an override if necessary. Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. An account entered that is not equal to the default account will require an override.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntLiqAcct

        public void setIntLiqAcct(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntLiqAcct
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the account number where entries are made for the reimbursement of the Interest (together with any taxes applicable to that interest) at liquidation. The defaulting process looks firstly at the SEC.ACC.MASTER record using the portfolio no. If no default found uses the CUSTOMER.CCY.ACCT record and finally if still no default found takes details from the AGENCY record and NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. These settings can be overriden by using ACCOUNT.PARAMETER to set the account default method. In a case where interest is subject to taxes, such taxes will always remain associated with their interest amount and will always be liquidated through the same account. Thus it is not possible to liquidate interest and corresponding taxes through two different accounts or in two different currencies. Input in this field will be necessary only when the disposal of the interest is different from the disposal of the principal. If the account through which delivery is to be made is not known the User can choose to enter one digit (from 1 to 9) which will identify the text (defined in LMM.TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the customer. This will result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. This field may be changed at any time during the life of the contract; such changes will not be retrospective. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner proceeds for settlement may directly be drawn down from/to an account denominated in any currency. In case the underlying Contract Customer (eg. Customer.id in MONEYMARKET,Counterparty in FOREX, etc.) has a record in CUSTOMER.SSI application, then the account number in this field gets defaulted as per the definition for that Customer from CUSTOMER.SSI.For more information on the usage of this feature please refer to CUSTOMER.SSI application. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters-relating to a Customer Account or a Nostro Account or 3-10 type A alphanumeric account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = PRIN.LIQ.ACCT) The system will check for account posting restrictions and will require an override if necessary. Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. An account entered that is not equal to the default account will require an override.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntPaymtMethod

        public void setIntPaymtMethod(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntPaymtMethod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates if the interest has to be paid in advance or in arrears. On an interest bearing contract the income or expense accrues on the face value of the contract. At maturity the value of the contract will equal the principal value + interest. On a discounted contract the income or expense is taken at the start of the transaction. At maturity the value of the contract will equal the principal value only. The following values have been defined: '1' = Interest bearing contracts For a one period contract, the interest will be collected/paid on the maturity date. For contracts with various interest schedules, the interest will be collected/paid on the scheduled interest dates. '2' = Discounted basis contracts The discount deducted in advance is reported as unearned/unpaid interest. The discount is accrued on a straightline basis during the life of the contract. For contracts with various interest schedules the interest will be collected/paid at the inception of each scheduled interest period. In this case, if no payment is received, the user will always liquidate the next discounted interest due against a receivable account. After final maturity, the system will automatically change the discounted payment type to interest bearing payment type. Validation Rules: 1 numeric character of the form: 1 = Interest bearing. 2 = Discounted. (Optional input. Default value = 1) For discounted contracts the revision schedules must always coincide with an interest and/or commission schedule. The Interest rate type must be FIXED for discounted contracts. Discounted method prohibited for Call and Notice contracts. Once the contract has been authorised, this field cannot be changed. The discounted method is prohibited for Commitment contracts. Input in this field prohibited for Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. For discounted contracts the liquidation code must be "1" fully automatic. For discounted contracts the rate must be greater than zero. For Deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount Field only Discounted method is prohibited. If the field Yield is flagged to Yes only Discounted method is allowed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntPaymtMethod

        public void setIntPaymtMethod(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntPaymtMethod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates if the interest has to be paid in advance or in arrears. On an interest bearing contract the income or expense accrues on the face value of the contract. At maturity the value of the contract will equal the principal value + interest. On a discounted contract the income or expense is taken at the start of the transaction. At maturity the value of the contract will equal the principal value only. The following values have been defined: '1' = Interest bearing contracts For a one period contract, the interest will be collected/paid on the maturity date. For contracts with various interest schedules, the interest will be collected/paid on the scheduled interest dates. '2' = Discounted basis contracts The discount deducted in advance is reported as unearned/unpaid interest. The discount is accrued on a straightline basis during the life of the contract. For contracts with various interest schedules the interest will be collected/paid at the inception of each scheduled interest period. In this case, if no payment is received, the user will always liquidate the next discounted interest due against a receivable account. After final maturity, the system will automatically change the discounted payment type to interest bearing payment type. Validation Rules: 1 numeric character of the form: 1 = Interest bearing. 2 = Discounted. (Optional input. Default value = 1) For discounted contracts the revision schedules must always coincide with an interest and/or commission schedule. The Interest rate type must be FIXED for discounted contracts. Discounted method prohibited for Call and Notice contracts. Once the contract has been authorised, this field cannot be changed. The discounted method is prohibited for Commitment contracts. Input in this field prohibited for Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. For discounted contracts the liquidation code must be "1" fully automatic. For discounted contracts the rate must be greater than zero. For Deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount Field only Discounted method is prohibited. If the field Yield is flagged to Yes only Discounted method is allowed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntRateType

        public void setIntRateType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntRateType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the type of interest rate to be used for the contract. The following values are defined for the interest rate type field: 1 = Fixed 2 = Periodic Automatic 3 = Floating 4 = Periodic Manual 5 = Periodic Straight Once authorised this field cannot be changed. 1 = Fixed: The rate of interest to be charged over the life of the contract is fixed at a specific percentage and is input as a numeric value. The rate includes the spread. 2 = Periodic Automatic: A rate of interest which will change on predetermined dates and become effective on the appropriate revision date. 3 = Floating: A rate of interest which will change on a non-determined basis with immediate impact. Input is in the form of a valid key from the BASIC.RATE.TEXT with the associated rate defined on BASIC.INTEREST table. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract. 4 = Periodic Manual A rate of interest which will change on predetermined dates and become effective on the appropriate rollover date. The rate is input in the form of a numeric value. Revision schedules are mandatory. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract. 5 = Periodic Straight: A rate of interest which will not change. The rate is input in the form of a numeric value. Revision schedules are prohibited. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract. Validation Rules: 1 numeric character. Only valid input is 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. (Optional input. Default value = 1 fixed.) For 1 = Fixed Rate Type: - Input in the interest rate field is mandatory. - Input in the interest key field is prohibited. - Input in the interest spread field is prohibited. - Interest basis "S" (special) is accepted. - Valid for discounted contracts. - Revision schedules may be defined. - Input prohibited for Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. - Rate amendment is only possible using NEW.INT.RATE. - Mandatory for Commitment contracts. For 2 = Periodic Automatic rate type: - Input in the interest key field is mandatory. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Input of a rate in the interest rate field will be mandatory only at the original drawdown date of the contract and will override the value of the key until the first revision date. - Definition of revision schedules is mandatory. - Prohibited for discounted contracts. - Interest calculation basis "S" (special) prohibited. - Can be changed to PERIODIC MANUAL with effect from the next rollover period, the key being effective till then. - Prohibited for Commitments, Accounts Receivable, Sundry contract types and deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments and Syndicated loans. For 3 = Floating rate type: - Input in the interest key field is mandatory. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Input in the interest rate field is prohibited. - Revision schedule definition is prohibited. - Prohibited for Commitments, Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. - Prohibited for discounted contract types. - Prohibited for interest calculation basis "S" (special). - Change of rates will be done via the BASIC.INTEREST table. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments, deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field. For 4 = Periodic Manual rate type: - Input in the interest rate field is mandatory. - Input in the interest key field is prohibited. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Definition of revision schedules is mandatory. - Prohibited for Commitments, Sundry and Accounts Receivable. - Prohibited for interest calculation basis "S" (special). - Prohibited for discounted contract types. - Change of rates will be done via revision schedules. - Prohibited for call and notice contracts. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments. Prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field. For 5 = Periodic Straight rate type: - The system will require an input for the interest rate field but will not accept input in the interest key field. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Revision schedule definition is prohibited. - Interest calculation basis "S" (special) is prohibited. - Discounted contract types prohibited. - Prohibited for Commitments, Account Receivable and Sundry contract types. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments and Syndicated loans. - Prohibited for Call and Notice contracts. Prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntRateType

        public void setIntRateType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntRateType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the type of interest rate to be used for the contract. The following values are defined for the interest rate type field: 1 = Fixed 2 = Periodic Automatic 3 = Floating 4 = Periodic Manual 5 = Periodic Straight Once authorised this field cannot be changed. 1 = Fixed: The rate of interest to be charged over the life of the contract is fixed at a specific percentage and is input as a numeric value. The rate includes the spread. 2 = Periodic Automatic: A rate of interest which will change on predetermined dates and become effective on the appropriate revision date. 3 = Floating: A rate of interest which will change on a non-determined basis with immediate impact. Input is in the form of a valid key from the BASIC.RATE.TEXT with the associated rate defined on BASIC.INTEREST table. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract. 4 = Periodic Manual A rate of interest which will change on predetermined dates and become effective on the appropriate rollover date. The rate is input in the form of a numeric value. Revision schedules are mandatory. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract. 5 = Periodic Straight: A rate of interest which will not change. The rate is input in the form of a numeric value. Revision schedules are prohibited. A positive or negative spread rate can be input on the contract. Validation Rules: 1 numeric character. Only valid input is 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. (Optional input. Default value = 1 fixed.) For 1 = Fixed Rate Type: - Input in the interest rate field is mandatory. - Input in the interest key field is prohibited. - Input in the interest spread field is prohibited. - Interest basis "S" (special) is accepted. - Valid for discounted contracts. - Revision schedules may be defined. - Input prohibited for Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. - Rate amendment is only possible using NEW.INT.RATE. - Mandatory for Commitment contracts. For 2 = Periodic Automatic rate type: - Input in the interest key field is mandatory. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Input of a rate in the interest rate field will be mandatory only at the original drawdown date of the contract and will override the value of the key until the first revision date. - Definition of revision schedules is mandatory. - Prohibited for discounted contracts. - Interest calculation basis "S" (special) prohibited. - Can be changed to PERIODIC MANUAL with effect from the next rollover period, the key being effective till then. - Prohibited for Commitments, Accounts Receivable, Sundry contract types and deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments and Syndicated loans. For 3 = Floating rate type: - Input in the interest key field is mandatory. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Input in the interest rate field is prohibited. - Revision schedule definition is prohibited. - Prohibited for Commitments, Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. - Prohibited for discounted contract types. - Prohibited for interest calculation basis "S" (special). - Change of rates will be done via the BASIC.INTEREST table. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments, deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field. For 4 = Periodic Manual rate type: - Input in the interest rate field is mandatory. - Input in the interest key field is prohibited. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Definition of revision schedules is mandatory. - Prohibited for Commitments, Sundry and Accounts Receivable. - Prohibited for interest calculation basis "S" (special). - Prohibited for discounted contract types. - Change of rates will be done via revision schedules. - Prohibited for call and notice contracts. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments. Prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field. For 5 = Periodic Straight rate type: - The system will require an input for the interest rate field but will not accept input in the interest key field. - Input in the interest spread field is allowed. - Revision schedule definition is prohibited. - Interest calculation basis "S" (special) is prohibited. - Discounted contract types prohibited. - Prohibited for Commitments, Account Receivable and Sundry contract types. - Prohibited for Syndicated Commitments and Syndicated loans. - Prohibited for Call and Notice contracts. Prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntRateVDate

        public void setIntRateVDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntRateVDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The effective date of change to new interest rate. The date when the new interest rate becomes effective. Validation Rules: Standard date format. (Optional input.) Can be back valued to the last interest schedule only. If SUSPEND.INCOME is flagged to YES in the relevant category PD.PARAMETER, then back valuing cannot be for a date prior to the date on which OVERDUE.STATUS changed to NAB. On discounted contracts,must equal date of next interest start period. On PERIODIC MANUAL contracts, if forward, must be equal to next 'R' schedule. Mandatory input if a value in NEW.INT.RATE, otherwise prohibited. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. Must be a valid date. One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Cannot be greater than the value in FIN.MAT.DATE. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited if value missing in field NEW.INT.RATE. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Input prohibited prior to first authorisation of contract. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited prior or equal to value date of Negotiated deal date of Interest.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntRateVDate

        public void setIntRateVDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntRateVDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The effective date of change to new interest rate. The date when the new interest rate becomes effective. Validation Rules: Standard date format. (Optional input.) Can be back valued to the last interest schedule only. If SUSPEND.INCOME is flagged to YES in the relevant category PD.PARAMETER, then back valuing cannot be for a date prior to the date on which OVERDUE.STATUS changed to NAB. On discounted contracts,must equal date of next interest start period. On PERIODIC MANUAL contracts, if forward, must be equal to next 'R' schedule. Mandatory input if a value in NEW.INT.RATE, otherwise prohibited. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. Must be a valid date. One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Cannot be greater than the value in FIN.MAT.DATE. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited if value missing in field NEW.INT.RATE. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Input prohibited prior to first authorisation of contract. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited prior or equal to value date of Negotiated deal date of Interest.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntRefNumber

        public void setIntRefNumber(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntRefNumber
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Interest Reference Number will be used if the User needs to link the interest rate on a deal to a rate quoted by dealers. This field may contain the reference number as quoted by the dealers. This field may be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 5 alphanumeric characters. (Optional input.) Prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntRefNumber

        public void setIntRefNumber(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntRefNumber
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Interest Reference Number will be used if the User needs to link the interest rate on a deal to a rate quoted by dealers. This field may contain the reference number as quoted by the dealers. This field may be changed at any time in the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 5 alphanumeric characters. (Optional input.) Prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

      • setIntRevisionDate

        public void setIntRevisionDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntRevisionDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates next interest revision date and associated frequency code. The interest rate will be revised on the date specified and thereafter on the frequency indicated, unless the contract has matured. Example: a) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = at one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a monthly end date. b) 31 MAR 1986 M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = at three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a quarter end date. Validation Rules: Standard date format. Mandatory for Call/Notice contracts with interest type "2" PERIODIC AUTOMATIC. Prohibited for non Call/Notice contracts. The definition of schedules is prohibited. Must be a valid date. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntRevisionDate

        public void setIntRevisionDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntRevisionDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates next interest revision date and associated frequency code. The interest rate will be revised on the date specified and thereafter on the frequency indicated, unless the contract has matured. Example: a) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = at one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a monthly end date. b) 31 MAR 1986 M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = at three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a quarter end date. Validation Rules: Standard date format. Mandatory for Call/Notice contracts with interest type "2" PERIODIC AUTOMATIC. Prohibited for non Call/Notice contracts. The definition of schedules is prohibited. Must be a valid date. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntStartDate

        public void setIntStartDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IntStartDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the date when the system will start calculating interest and commission accruals on Commitment contracts. This allows the commitment to have a grace period at the start of the commitment where no commitment fees will be accrued or applied. If this date is not input then the system will default the VALUE.DATE here. The field becomes a no-change field once the INT.START.DATE is reached. It can be modified if the value here is greater than the system date. 1-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Validation Rules: Valid for Commitment contracts only. Must be a valid date. Must be prior to the value in INT.END.DATE. Must be prior to the value in FIN.MAT.DATE. Must be equal to or after the VALUE.DATE. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non-working day.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIntStartDate

        public void setIntStartDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IntStartDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the date when the system will start calculating interest and commission accruals on Commitment contracts. This allows the commitment to have a grace period at the start of the commitment where no commitment fees will be accrued or applied. If this date is not input then the system will default the VALUE.DATE here. The field becomes a no-change field once the INT.START.DATE is reached. It can be modified if the value here is greater than the system date. 1-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Validation Rules: Valid for Commitment contracts only. Must be a valid date. Must be prior to the value in INT.END.DATE. Must be prior to the value in FIN.MAT.DATE. Must be equal to or after the VALUE.DATE. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non-working day.

        Returns:

      • setIntTaxFcy

      • setInterestBasis

        public void setInterestBasis(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for InterestBasis
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Loans & Deposits can accept the following types:

        KeyDays/Denominator
        A 360/360
        A1 360/360*
        A2 30/360
        A4 30/360
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        F1 360/365*
        F2 360/365*
        S Special
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS INTEREST.BASIS If basis "S" is used and no schedules have been defined then the system will require an entry in TOT.INTEREST.AMT Depending on the value set in LMM.INSTALL.CONDS in field S.BASIS.RATE.VAL In both the above cases the difference will be compensated for within the last accrual period thus agreeing with the user defined interest amount. Validation Rules: 1-2 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. Default = CURRENCY table value) Interest basis "S" is not allowed for Call/notice contracts. Interest basis "S" valid for fixed rate contracts only. Interest basis "S" is prohibited for Commitment contracts if the value in LCU.CALC.BASE Once authorised this field cannot be changed. Prohibited for Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. Principal schedules can only be defined for the principal maturity event when basis "S" has been defined. For deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field only "A" basis permitted.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setInterestBasis

        public void setInterestBasis(TField value)
        Set the specified value for InterestBasis
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Loans & Deposits can accept the following types:

        KeyDays/Denominator
        A 360/360
        A1 360/360*
        A2 30/360
        A4 30/360
        B 366/360
        C 366/366
        D 360/366
        E 366/365
        F 360/365
        F1 360/365*
        F2 360/365*
        S Special
        For illustrations of all supported INTEREST.BASIS INTEREST.BASIS If basis "S" is used and no schedules have been defined then the system will require an entry in TOT.INTEREST.AMT Depending on the value set in LMM.INSTALL.CONDS in field S.BASIS.RATE.VAL In both the above cases the difference will be compensated for within the last accrual period thus agreeing with the user defined interest amount. Validation Rules: 1-2 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. Default = CURRENCY table value) Interest basis "S" is not allowed for Call/notice contracts. Interest basis "S" valid for fixed rate contracts only. Interest basis "S" is prohibited for Commitment contracts if the value in LCU.CALC.BASE Once authorised this field cannot be changed. Prohibited for Accounts Receivable and Sundry contract types. Principal schedules can only be defined for the principal maturity event when basis "S" has been defined. For deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field only "A" basis permitted.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setInterestDueDate

        public void setInterestDueDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for InterestDueDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates next interest due date and associated frequency code for contracts where schedules are not defined through LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and where principal repayment is bullet in nature. In case of Call/Notice contracts, if the field is left NULL, the committed interest would not be calculated. The accruals would take place at the interest rate input. In case of fixed maturity bullet repayment contracts, the field AUTO.SCHEDS has to be set to 'YES', for this field to be used. The system will produce a single schedule for the first period. Upon reaching the scheduled event date a subsequent schedule will be generated based on the values in this field. In case of fixed maturity contracts, schedules are generated till maturity of the contract. This field will be defaulted with the value in INTEREST.FREQ field in LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION, if the value input in CATEGORY field has a record in the LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION table. However, the user may manually modify this default at the deal level. Example: a) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = at one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a monthly end date. b) 31 MAR 1986 M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = at three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a quarter end date. c) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 10 M=Monthly, 01 = at monthly intervals 10 = 10 d) M01 e) 31 MAR 1986 W , where W= weekly. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31 f) 31 Mar 1986 BSNSS, where BSNSS = every business day. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31 g) The values defined in the EB.FREQUENCY table will also be accepted in this field. The value so input will be Validation Rules: Standard date format. The definition of schedules in LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE is prohibited. Must be a valid date. An override will be required if the field is left NULL for a Call/Notice contract with interest. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. The frequency for Call deposits cannot be less than the delivery number of days, if INT LIQ ACCT is a NOSTRO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setInterestDueDate

        public void setInterestDueDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for InterestDueDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates next interest due date and associated frequency code for contracts where schedules are not defined through LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE and where principal repayment is bullet in nature. In case of Call/Notice contracts, if the field is left NULL, the committed interest would not be calculated. The accruals would take place at the interest rate input. In case of fixed maturity bullet repayment contracts, the field AUTO.SCHEDS has to be set to 'YES', for this field to be used. The system will produce a single schedule for the first period. Upon reaching the scheduled event date a subsequent schedule will be generated based on the values in this field. In case of fixed maturity contracts, schedules are generated till maturity of the contract. This field will be defaulted with the value in INTEREST.FREQ field in LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION, if the value input in CATEGORY field has a record in the LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION table. However, the user may manually modify this default at the deal level. Example: a) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = at one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a monthly end date. b) 31 MAR 1986 M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = at three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a quarter end date. c) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 10 M=Monthly, 01 = at monthly intervals 10 = 10 d) M01 e) 31 MAR 1986 W , where W= weekly. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31 f) 31 Mar 1986 BSNSS, where BSNSS = every business day. In this case, the first schedule would fall on 31 g) The values defined in the EB.FREQUENCY table will also be accepted in this field. The value so input will be Validation Rules: Standard date format. The definition of schedules in LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE is prohibited. Must be a valid date. An override will be required if the field is left NULL for a Call/Notice contract with interest. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for a date prior to the system date. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. The frequency for Call deposits cannot be less than the delivery number of days, if INT LIQ ACCT is a NOSTRO.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setInterestKey

        public void setInterestKey(TField value)
        Set the specified value for InterestKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the reference number of the appropriate interest rate which will be used for interest computation purposes. The key indicates the rate to be used for interest computation purposes on Loans and Deposit contracts. The key can take the form of an entry on the BASIC RATE TEXT (and consequently BASIC INTEREST) and PERIODIC INTEREST tables. A rate change on the interest rate table will automatically update at the End Of Day run all contracts linked to the BASIC INTEREST and PERIODIC INTEREST tables. Validation Rules: 1-4 numeric characters. (Optional input.) Mandatory input if the interest rate type is FLOATING or PERIODIC AUTOMATIC. Prohibited for FIXED, PERIODIC MANUAL and PERIODIC STRAIGHT. Prohibited for discounted contracts. Prohibited for Accounts Receivables and Sundry contracts. Prohibited for Commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setInterestKey

        public void setInterestKey(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for InterestKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the reference number of the appropriate interest rate which will be used for interest computation purposes. The key indicates the rate to be used for interest computation purposes on Loans and Deposit contracts. The key can take the form of an entry on the BASIC RATE TEXT (and consequently BASIC INTEREST) and PERIODIC INTEREST tables. A rate change on the interest rate table will automatically update at the End Of Day run all contracts linked to the BASIC INTEREST and PERIODIC INTEREST tables. Validation Rules: 1-4 numeric characters. (Optional input.) Mandatory input if the interest rate type is FLOATING or PERIODIC AUTOMATIC. Prohibited for FIXED, PERIODIC MANUAL and PERIODIC STRAIGHT. Prohibited for discounted contracts. Prohibited for Accounts Receivables and Sundry contracts. Prohibited for Commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setInterestRate

        public void setInterestRate(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified InterestRate to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the annual interest/commitment fee rate applicable on the contract. This is the rate used for interest computation purposes on Loans and Deposits contracts and for commitment fee computation purposes in the case of Commitment contracts. Negative rates can be input in some cases. To enable this, the value in field NEGATIVE.RATE should be YES. The helptext for NEGATIVE.RATE will clarify the type of contracts for which negative rates can be used. Validation Rules: 1- 10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Input prohibited for floating rate contracts. Must be greater than zero for discounted contracts. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Input mandatory for the first period on PERIODIC rate contracts. Input mandatory for fixed interest contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Input prohibited for Sundry and Accounts Receivable contract types.

        Parameters:
        param - the InterestRate to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setInterestRate

        public void setInterestRate(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified InterestRate to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the annual interest/commitment fee rate applicable on the contract. This is the rate used for interest computation purposes on Loans and Deposits contracts and for commitment fee computation purposes in the case of Commitment contracts. Negative rates can be input in some cases. To enable this, the value in field NEGATIVE.RATE should be YES. The helptext for NEGATIVE.RATE will clarify the type of contracts for which negative rates can be used. Validation Rules: 1- 10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) Input prohibited for floating rate contracts. Must be greater than zero for discounted contracts. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Input mandatory for the first period on PERIODIC rate contracts. Input mandatory for fixed interest contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Input prohibited for Sundry and Accounts Receivable contract types.

        Parameters:
        param - the InterestRate to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setInterestSpread

        public void setInterestSpread(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for InterestSpread
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the spread or margin on the contract. Indicates the spread (also known as the margin) which will be applied to the percentage interest rate derived from the BASIC INTEREST or PERIODIC INTEREST tables or in the case of PERIODIC MANUAL/PERIODIC STRAIGHT from the INTEREST RATE field. Validation Rules: 1-9 numeric characters plus a decimal point (- = a negative spread) of the form +/- 999999.999 Optional input. Default value = Null.) Prohibited for FIXED interest rate type contracts. Prohibited for discounted interest payment method. Prohibited for interest basis "S". A spread which will result in a negative interest rate is prohibited. Cannot be greater than 100%. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited for Sundry contracts and Accounts Receivable. Once contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setInterestSpread

        public void setInterestSpread(TField value)
        Set the specified value for InterestSpread
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the spread or margin on the contract. Indicates the spread (also known as the margin) which will be applied to the percentage interest rate derived from the BASIC INTEREST or PERIODIC INTEREST tables or in the case of PERIODIC MANUAL/PERIODIC STRAIGHT from the INTEREST RATE field. Validation Rules: 1-9 numeric characters plus a decimal point (- = a negative spread) of the form +/- 999999.999 Optional input. Default value = Null.) Prohibited for FIXED interest rate type contracts. Prohibited for discounted interest payment method. Prohibited for interest basis "S". A spread which will result in a negative interest rate is prohibited. Cannot be greater than 100%. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited for Sundry contracts and Accounts Receivable. Once contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIssueAccrual

        public void setIssueAccrual(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IssueAccrual
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies if any discount or premium arising from the ISSUE.PRICE specified is to be accrued to Profit and Loss over the life of the contract, and whether the amount should be accrued on a LINEAR or ACTUARIAL basis. The discount or premium arising from the issue price can be accrued throughout the life of the contract. It may be accrued on a LINEAR basis or an ACTUARIAL basis. The accrual method can be changed throughout the life of the contract if required. If the LINEAR method is used the ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT is amortised on a straight line basis between the VALUE.DATE and the FIN.MAT.DATE. The amortised amount on a given date is calculated using the formula: (See Figure 1 below) If the ACTUARIAL method is used the ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT is amortised on an actuarial basis between the VALUE.DATE and the FIN.MAT.DATE. The amortised amount on a given date is calculated using the formula: (See Figure 2 below) An Internal Rate of Return (IRR) is calculated for the deal using the formula: (See Figure 3 below) Be careful with IRR rates since, for example, a 10 year loan at 7% compounded Annually would need an IRR of over 9.9% without any compounding this is then used to calculate the amortisation amount: Validation Rules: Only NO, LINEAR, ACTUARIAL allowed. Must be NO for Call/Notice contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIssueAccrual

        public void setIssueAccrual(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IssueAccrual
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies if any discount or premium arising from the ISSUE.PRICE specified is to be accrued to Profit and Loss over the life of the contract, and whether the amount should be accrued on a LINEAR or ACTUARIAL basis. The discount or premium arising from the issue price can be accrued throughout the life of the contract. It may be accrued on a LINEAR basis or an ACTUARIAL basis. The accrual method can be changed throughout the life of the contract if required. If the LINEAR method is used the ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT is amortised on a straight line basis between the VALUE.DATE and the FIN.MAT.DATE. The amortised amount on a given date is calculated using the formula: (See Figure 1 below) If the ACTUARIAL method is used the ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT is amortised on an actuarial basis between the VALUE.DATE and the FIN.MAT.DATE. The amortised amount on a given date is calculated using the formula: (See Figure 2 below) An Internal Rate of Return (IRR) is calculated for the deal using the formula: (See Figure 3 below) Be careful with IRR rates since, for example, a 10 year loan at 7% compounded Annually would need an IRR of over 9.9% without any compounding this is then used to calculate the amortisation amount: Validation Rules: Only NO, LINEAR, ACTUARIAL allowed. Must be NO for Call/Notice contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIssuePlAmount

        public void setIssuePlAmount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IssuePlAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This is a NOINPUT field which identifies the Profit & Loss amount which has arisen through specifying a Drawdown Issue Price which is different than the contract nominal amount. This field is defaulted to the Drawdown Issue Price (DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC) minus the contract nominal amount (AMOUNT). e.g. Loan amount 10 M Drawdown Issue Price 11 M Issue P&L Amount 1 M Validation Rules: 1-19 Numeric characters (Standard amount field). (NOINPUT field. Default = See details).

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIssuePlAmount

        public void setIssuePlAmount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IssuePlAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This is a NOINPUT field which identifies the Profit & Loss amount which has arisen through specifying a Drawdown Issue Price which is different than the contract nominal amount. This field is defaulted to the Drawdown Issue Price (DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC) minus the contract nominal amount (AMOUNT). e.g. Loan amount 10 M Drawdown Issue Price 11 M Issue P&L Amount 1 M Validation Rules: 1-19 Numeric characters (Standard amount field). (NOINPUT field. Default = See details).

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIssuePrice

        public void setIssuePrice(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for IssuePrice
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The price a bond is issued at, as a percentage of the nominal value. When purchasing bonds an issue price is quoted as a percentage of the nominal amount, this may be more or less than 100%. The price entered here will be used to calculate the amount which the customer will actually pay/ receive at contract initiation, stored in the field DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC. The difference between the Nominal and the Drawdown issue price is stored as the ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT. Validation Rules: Must be numeric in the range 0-999.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setIssuePrice

        public void setIssuePrice(TField value)
        Set the specified value for IssuePrice
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The price a bond is issued at, as a percentage of the nominal value. When purchasing bonds an issue price is quoted as a percentage of the nominal amount, this may be more or less than 100%. The price entered here will be used to calculate the amount which the customer will actually pay/ receive at contract initiation, stored in the field DRAWDOWN.ISSUE.PRC. The difference between the Nominal and the Drawdown issue price is stored as the ISSUE.PL.AMOUNT. Validation Rules: Must be numeric in the range 0-999.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing
