      • setLCUCalcBase

        public void setLCUCalcBase(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LCUCalcBase
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates whether the commitment fee is calculated on the Original / Unused value of the Commitment /Tranche amount. O = Commitment fee would be calculated between VALUE.DATE and FIN.MAT.DATE for the value in AMOUNT field. U = Commitment fee would be calculated on the unused total commitment amount. This includes the unused amount in current as well as future tranches, for a deal defined in tranches. Period for which fee would be charged is between VALUE.DATE & FIN.MAT.DATE. TO = Commitment fee would be calculated for the period covering the D.D.START.DATE & D.D.END.DATE for the respective TRANCHE.AMT TU = Commitment fee would be based on the 'available' unused funds. This means that the unused amount of the tranches that fall in the current commitment fee period is considered for calculation. This field cannot be changed after authorisation. Validation Rules: 2 type AAA (alpha A-Z, a-z) character of the form: U = Unused amount, O = Original amount, TO = Tranche Original, & TU = Tranche Unused (Optional input. Default = O ) Input allowed for Commitment contracts only. Fees under the Unused basis can never be taken in advance. For LCU.CALC.TYPE values RC or NC, values in this field cannot be TO or O

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLCUCalcBase

        public void setLCUCalcBase(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LCUCalcBase
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates whether the commitment fee is calculated on the Original / Unused value of the Commitment /Tranche amount. O = Commitment fee would be calculated between VALUE.DATE and FIN.MAT.DATE for the value in AMOUNT field. U = Commitment fee would be calculated on the unused total commitment amount. This includes the unused amount in current as well as future tranches, for a deal defined in tranches. Period for which fee would be charged is between VALUE.DATE & FIN.MAT.DATE. TO = Commitment fee would be calculated for the period covering the D.D.START.DATE & D.D.END.DATE for the respective TRANCHE.AMT TU = Commitment fee would be based on the 'available' unused funds. This means that the unused amount of the tranches that fall in the current commitment fee period is considered for calculation. This field cannot be changed after authorisation. Validation Rules: 2 type AAA (alpha A-Z, a-z) character of the form: U = Unused amount, O = Original amount, TO = Tranche Original, & TU = Tranche Unused (Optional input. Default = O ) Input allowed for Commitment contracts only. Fees under the Unused basis can never be taken in advance. For LCU.CALC.TYPE values RC or NC, values in this field cannot be TO or O

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLCUConversion

        public void setLCUConversion(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LCUConversion
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Conversion rate to be used for translation of Loans to commitment currency equivalents. This field will be used to provide equivalents for commitment availability/exposure purposes for Loans denominated in currencies different from the currency of the commitment. Any subsequent revaluation will be reflected in AVAIL.AMT of the Limit. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point of the form: 999999.9999 (Optional input. Default = mid rate from CURRENCY table.) Input allowed if the drawdown is in a currency other than the commitment currency, otherwise prohibited. An override will be required if the value in this field is outside the tolerance indicated on the CURRENCY table. Input allowed if a valid commitment number is inserted in COMMITMENT NO otherwise prohibited. Input allowed for Loan contracts only. This field cannot be changed once authorised.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLCUConversion

        public void setLCUConversion(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LCUConversion
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Conversion rate to be used for translation of Loans to commitment currency equivalents. This field will be used to provide equivalents for commitment availability/exposure purposes for Loans denominated in currencies different from the currency of the commitment. Any subsequent revaluation will be reflected in AVAIL.AMT of the Limit. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point of the form: 999999.9999 (Optional input. Default = mid rate from CURRENCY table.) Input allowed if the drawdown is in a currency other than the commitment currency, otherwise prohibited. An override will be required if the value in this field is outside the tolerance indicated on the CURRENCY table. Input allowed if a valid commitment number is inserted in COMMITMENT NO otherwise prohibited. Input allowed for Loan contracts only. This field cannot be changed once authorised.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLCUType

        public void setLCUType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LCUType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates whether the facility is revolving or non revolving and also whether the facility is cumulative or not. If commitments were defined in tranches, facility is provided to define whether the unused balance of an earlier tranche may be carried forward to the next tranche or not. If such carry forward is permitted, then the commitment is deemed to be of cumulative type. N = NON REVOLVING This indicates that Loan will be deducted from the Commitment Available Amount but repayments will not reinstate the Available Amount. This also indicates that the facility is non cumulative.. R = REVOLVING This indicates that the Loan will be deducted from the Commitment Available Amount and any repayments will reinstate the Available Amount. This also indicates that the facility is non cumulative. NC = Commitment facility is non revolving and cumulative. RC = Commitment facility is revolving and cumulative. Validation Rules: 1 alphabetic character of the form: N = Non Revolving R = Revolving (Optional input. Default = N.) Valid for Commitment contracts only. After authorisation, this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLCUType

        public void setLCUType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LCUType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates whether the facility is revolving or non revolving and also whether the facility is cumulative or not. If commitments were defined in tranches, facility is provided to define whether the unused balance of an earlier tranche may be carried forward to the next tranche or not. If such carry forward is permitted, then the commitment is deemed to be of cumulative type. N = NON REVOLVING This indicates that Loan will be deducted from the Commitment Available Amount but repayments will not reinstate the Available Amount. This also indicates that the facility is non cumulative.. R = REVOLVING This indicates that the Loan will be deducted from the Commitment Available Amount and any repayments will reinstate the Available Amount. This also indicates that the facility is non cumulative. NC = Commitment facility is non revolving and cumulative. RC = Commitment facility is revolving and cumulative. Validation Rules: 1 alphabetic character of the form: N = Non Revolving R = Revolving (Optional input. Default = N.) Valid for Commitment contracts only. After authorisation, this field cannot be changed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLastDayAccrual

        public void setLastDayAccrual(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LastDayAccrual
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The accepted values in the field LAST.DAY.ACCRUAL are BEGIN, MAT, ALL & NO. If the field is flagged BEGIN, interest calculations would include one additional days interest in the first If the field is flagged MAT, interest calculations would include one additional days interest in the last If the field is flagged ALL, interest calculations would include one additional days interest in each of the I(Interest) For value NO existing functionality would continue. Can be defaulted from the LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION record with modification permitted at the record level. The number of days for which interest will be calculated Value date : Maturity date : 31 May 01. I schedules every month end. NO 31 Jan 01 28 Feb 01 31 Mar 01 30 Apr 01 31 May 01 Total no of days Validation Rules: Only allowed values are BEGIN, MAT, ALL & NO This field will be a NO CHANGE field, once authorized.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLastDayAccrual

        public void setLastDayAccrual(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LastDayAccrual
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The accepted values in the field LAST.DAY.ACCRUAL are BEGIN, MAT, ALL & NO. If the field is flagged BEGIN, interest calculations would include one additional days interest in the first If the field is flagged MAT, interest calculations would include one additional days interest in the last If the field is flagged ALL, interest calculations would include one additional days interest in each of the I(Interest) For value NO existing functionality would continue. Can be defaulted from the LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION record with modification permitted at the record level. The number of days for which interest will be calculated Value date : Maturity date : 31 May 01. I schedules every month end. NO 31 Jan 01 28 Feb 01 31 Mar 01 30 Apr 01 31 May 01 Total no of days Validation Rules: Only allowed values are BEGIN, MAT, ALL & NO This field will be a NO CHANGE field, once authorized.

        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLimitReference

        public void setLimitReference(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LimitReference
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the Credit Line number under which the transaction was granted. If no input is made in this field the Limits system will provide a default value according to the LIMIT.REFERENCE record which has its Field Application Ident. set to LD. If no match is found in selective Reference the default value will be the Reference with its Field Reference blank. For Deposit & Sundry contracts, a reference can be specified if required. These limits are updated purely for information only. If no specific deposit type has been defined on Limit Parameter, the DEFAULT.DEPOSIT limit reference will be used. The credit line number generated will be NNNN-01 where NNNN is the ID of the Limit Reference record described above. Validation Rules: 3-7 numeric characters. (Conditional input. Default if applicable = LIMIT.REFERENCE table entry.) Must be a valid reference on the LIMIT.REFERENCE table. The contract drawdown date must be prior to the limit expiry date. An override will be required if the contract drawdown date is prior to the limit start date, which is itself after the system date. Input prohibited for Commitments with STA = Y(es). Drawdowns under Commitments with STA = N(o) must have matching LIMIT.REFERENCE as the Commitment. Commitments with STA = N(o) must have LIMIT.REFERENCE according to LCU type, i.e. LCU type N(on-Revolving) - REDUCING LIMIT REFERENCE. LCU type R(evolving) NON-REDUCING LIMIT REFERENCE. Where input permitted, LIMIT.REFERENCE must match requirements specified in LIMIT.PARAMETER for that contract. An override will be required if the line expires prior to the contract final maturity date.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLimitReference

        public void setLimitReference(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LimitReference
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the Credit Line number under which the transaction was granted. If no input is made in this field the Limits system will provide a default value according to the LIMIT.REFERENCE record which has its Field Application Ident. set to LD. If no match is found in selective Reference the default value will be the Reference with its Field Reference blank. For Deposit & Sundry contracts, a reference can be specified if required. These limits are updated purely for information only. If no specific deposit type has been defined on Limit Parameter, the DEFAULT.DEPOSIT limit reference will be used. The credit line number generated will be NNNN-01 where NNNN is the ID of the Limit Reference record described above. Validation Rules: 3-7 numeric characters. (Conditional input. Default if applicable = LIMIT.REFERENCE table entry.) Must be a valid reference on the LIMIT.REFERENCE table. The contract drawdown date must be prior to the limit expiry date. An override will be required if the contract drawdown date is prior to the limit start date, which is itself after the system date. Input prohibited for Commitments with STA = Y(es). Drawdowns under Commitments with STA = N(o) must have matching LIMIT.REFERENCE as the Commitment. Commitments with STA = N(o) must have LIMIT.REFERENCE according to LCU type, i.e. LCU type N(on-Revolving) - REDUCING LIMIT REFERENCE. LCU type R(evolving) NON-REDUCING LIMIT REFERENCE. Where input permitted, LIMIT.REFERENCE must match requirements specified in LIMIT.PARAMETER for that contract. An override will be required if the line expires prior to the contract final maturity date.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLiquidationCode

        public void setLiquidationCode(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LiquidationCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is no longer used. If your wish to liquidate the contract other than automatically then please refer to the Helptext for field LIQUIDATION.MODE. Validation Rules: 1 numeric character. (Optional input. Default value = "1" Automatic.) Liquidation code "1" is the only value allowed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLiquidationCode

        public void setLiquidationCode(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LiquidationCode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is no longer used. If your wish to liquidate the contract other than automatically then please refer to the Helptext for field LIQUIDATION.MODE. Validation Rules: 1 numeric character. (Optional input. Default value = "1" Automatic.) Liquidation code "1" is the only value allowed.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLiquidationMode

        public void setLiquidationMode(TField value)
        Set the specified value for LiquidationMode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the manner in which overdue payments are handled. The default for all contracts is AUTOMATIC. There are three options available: AUTOMATIC SEMI-AUTOMATIC MANUAL AUTOMATIC will liquidate across the settlement accounts on the contract. MANUAL will create a PD contract instead. SEMI-AUTOMATIC will only raise a PD contract if insufficient funds exist on the settlement account. For further details see the helptext in PD.PARAMETER where these settings are controlled from. Validation Rules: If the PD product is not defined for the current company then the only allowed setting is AUTOMATIC.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setLiquidationMode

        public void setLiquidationMode(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for LiquidationMode
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field identifies the manner in which overdue payments are handled. The default for all contracts is AUTOMATIC. There are three options available: AUTOMATIC SEMI-AUTOMATIC MANUAL AUTOMATIC will liquidate across the settlement accounts on the contract. MANUAL will create a PD contract instead. SEMI-AUTOMATIC will only raise a PD contract if insufficient funds exist on the settlement account. For further details see the helptext in PD.PARAMETER where these settings are controlled from. Validation Rules: If the PD product is not defined for the current company then the only allowed setting is AUTOMATIC.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMarginRevDate

        public void setMarginRevDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for MarginRevDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates next margin revision date and associated frequency code. The margin rate will be revised on the date specified and thereafter on the frequency indicated. Example: a) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = at one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a monthly end date. b) 31 MAR 1986 M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = at three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a quarter end date. Validation Rules: Standard date format. Mandatory for Call/Notice contracts except for type "FIXED". Prohibited for non Call/Notice contracts. Must be a valid date. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for Commitment contracts, Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMarginRevDate

        public void setMarginRevDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for MarginRevDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates next margin revision date and associated frequency code. The margin rate will be revised on the date specified and thereafter on the frequency indicated. Example: a) 31 MAR 1986 M 01 31. M = Monthly. 01 = at one monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a monthly end date. b) 31 MAR 1986 M 03 31 M = Monthly. 03 = at three monthly intervals. 31 = the last day of the month. which represents a quarter end date. Validation Rules: Standard date format. Mandatory for Call/Notice contracts except for type "FIXED". Prohibited for non Call/Notice contracts. Must be a valid date. An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table. An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Input prohibited for Commitment contracts, Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Parameters:

        nothing

      • setMatAmount

        public void setMatAmount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for MatAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: While inputting a Certificate of Deposit (CD) contract, the maturity amount of the Deposit should be entered here. Based on the maturity amount, the tenor, interest capitalisation (if applicable) and the rate of interest, the initial amount is calculated by the system and populated in the Amount field. Once a value is entered in this field, the amount is calculated using the below mentioned formula: Amount = Mat.Amount / (1+(r*k/(360*100)))^n Where r = rate of interest (%) n = number of Periods of capitalisation of interest (In the absence of any I schedule, the contract is treated as a single period contract) k = number of days in a period (only A basis permitted) Examples Contract 1 Maturity Amount = USD 1 Million Rate of Interest (r) = 10% p.a Value Date = Jan 01, 2001 Maturity Date = April 01, 2001 k = 90 days (A basis) n = 1 (no I schedules) Amount = USD 975609.76 Contract 2 Maturity Amount = USD 1 Million Rate of Interest (r) = 10% p.a Value Date = Jan 01, 2001 Maturity Date = April 01, 2001 Interest Capitalisation = Monthly on Feb 01, March 01 & April 01 k = 30 days (A basis) n = 3 (no I schedules) Amount = USD 975410.95 Note that in Contract 2 since interest is capitalised on a monthly basis the number of days in a period and the number of periods is different from those in Contract 1. Validation Rules: Input allowed only for deposit type contracts Standard T24 Amount Field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMatAmount

        public void setMatAmount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for MatAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: While inputting a Certificate of Deposit (CD) contract, the maturity amount of the Deposit should be entered here. Based on the maturity amount, the tenor, interest capitalisation (if applicable) and the rate of interest, the initial amount is calculated by the system and populated in the Amount field. Once a value is entered in this field, the amount is calculated using the below mentioned formula: Amount = Mat.Amount / (1+(r*k/(360*100)))^n Where r = rate of interest (%) n = number of Periods of capitalisation of interest (In the absence of any I schedule, the contract is treated as a single period contract) k = number of days in a period (only A basis permitted) Examples Contract 1 Maturity Amount = USD 1 Million Rate of Interest (r) = 10% p.a Value Date = Jan 01, 2001 Maturity Date = April 01, 2001 k = 90 days (A basis) n = 1 (no I schedules) Amount = USD 975609.76 Contract 2 Maturity Amount = USD 1 Million Rate of Interest (r) = 10% p.a Value Date = Jan 01, 2001 Maturity Date = April 01, 2001 Interest Capitalisation = Monthly on Feb 01, March 01 & April 01 k = 30 days (A basis) n = 3 (no I schedules) Amount = USD 975410.95 Note that in Contract 2 since interest is capitalised on a monthly basis the number of days in a period and the number of periods is different from those in Contract 1. Validation Rules: Input allowed only for deposit type contracts Standard T24 Amount Field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMatureAtSod

        public void setMatureAtSod(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for MatureAtSod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Defaulted from Flag LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION table. If set to YES, maturity entries would be raised during Start of Day process. This rule is applicable for all types of contracts with or without schedules. All scheduled events like principal, interest, commission etc., would be processed during start of day. Required STMT.ENTRY(s) and CATEG.ENTRY(s) would be generated during start of day. CONSOL.ENT.TODAY records would be raised during SOD for all deal level updations like repayment of principal, capitalisation of interest or liquidation of contract. If not set to YES, maturity entries would be generated during End of Day process. Validation Rules: Optional Input field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMatureAtSod

        public void setMatureAtSod(TField value)
        Set the specified value for MatureAtSod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Defaulted from Flag LD.TXN.TYPE.CONDITION table. If set to YES, maturity entries would be raised during Start of Day process. This rule is applicable for all types of contracts with or without schedules. All scheduled events like principal, interest, commission etc., would be processed during start of day. Required STMT.ENTRY(s) and CATEG.ENTRY(s) would be generated during start of day. CONSOL.ENT.TODAY records would be raised during SOD for all deal level updations like repayment of principal, capitalisation of interest or liquidation of contract. If not set to YES, maturity entries would be generated during End of Day process. Validation Rules: Optional Input field

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

Input must be a positive value.

      • setMisFundingDept

        public void setMisFundingDept(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for MisFundingDept
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used within the Management Information module to define the Department which funded this Contract. It is used in the generation of cost of funds entries when either the MIS.INTEREST.KEY or MIS.INTEREST.RATE field is used. Validation Rules: Must be a key to a valid record on the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER file. Mandatory. If not defined, value would be defaulted from the value of the field DEFLT.FUND.DEPT associated with the appropriate COMPANY field in MI.PARAMETER.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMisInterestKey

        public void setMisInterestKey(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for MisInterestKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the reference number indicating the Management Information System (MIS) cost-of-funds rate. One single change in the MIS INTEREST RATE table will automatically update during end of day processing all the applicable M.I.S. Interest Rates on all contracts which contain the code. Validation Rules: 1-3 numeric characters. (Optional input.) Input prohibited for discounted transaction types. Input in this field will only be allowed if MIS.INTEREST.RATE is blank. The code will be checked against the BASIC.RATE.TEXT table. Input prohibited for Commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMisInterestKey

        public void setMisInterestKey(TField value)
        Set the specified value for MisInterestKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the reference number indicating the Management Information System (MIS) cost-of-funds rate. One single change in the MIS INTEREST RATE table will automatically update during end of day processing all the applicable M.I.S. Interest Rates on all contracts which contain the code. Validation Rules: 1-3 numeric characters. (Optional input.) Input prohibited for discounted transaction types. Input in this field will only be allowed if MIS.INTEREST.RATE is blank. The code will be checked against the BASIC.RATE.TEXT table. Input prohibited for Commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMisInterestRate

        public void setMisInterestRate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for MisInterestRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Represents the financing rate for the funds. It will be used to determine the Management Information System (M.I.S) Account Profitability Analysis. When a rate is entered, the system will use this rate for Management Information System (M.I.S) Account Profitability Analysis. The rate will be entered as a FIXED Interest Rate Type. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input.) Input will only be accepted if MIS.INTEREST.KEY is blank. Input prohibited for Commitment contract types. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setMisInterestRate

        public void setMisInterestRate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for MisInterestRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Represents the financing rate for the funds. It will be used to determine the Management Information System (M.I.S) Account Profitability Analysis. When a rate is entered, the system will use this rate for Management Information System (M.I.S) Account Profitability Analysis. The rate will be entered as a FIXED Interest Rate Type. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input.) Input will only be accepted if MIS.INTEREST.KEY is blank. Input prohibited for Commitment contract types. Once the contract has been authorised this field cannot be changed. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNegativeRate

        public void setNegativeRate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for NegativeRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The values in this field can be YES, NO or Null. If set to YES, this would enable negative interest rates to be input in the following fields : (i) INTEREST.RATE (ii) MIS.INTEREST.RATE (iii) NEW.INTEREST.RATE (when subsequent rate amendments are to be made in a contract) (iv)Definition of R schedules with negative rates. (iv)In case of contracts where INT.RATE.TYPE is either FLOATING or PERIODIC.AUTOMATIC, a negative rate can be stipulated in the INTEREST.SPREAD field such that the sum of In the case the field is set to NO or Null, the above functionalities will not be available. However during the tenure of the contract, if due to changes in the BASIC.INTEREST/ PERIODIC.INTEREST key, the interest rate on the contract becomes negative, such rate would be truncated to 0%. Once input and authorized, this field becomes non-inputtable. Default value is NO. Validation Rules: This field will not accept the value YES in the following cases

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNegativeRate

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The values in this field can be YES, NO or Null. If set to YES, this would enable negative interest rates to be input in the following fields : (i) INTEREST.RATE (ii) MIS.INTEREST.RATE (iii) NEW.INTEREST.RATE (when subsequent rate amendments are to be made in a contract) (iv)Definition of R schedules with negative rates. (iv)In case of contracts where INT.RATE.TYPE is either FLOATING or PERIODIC.AUTOMATIC, a negative rate can be stipulated in the INTEREST.SPREAD field such that the sum of In the case the field is set to NO or Null, the above functionalities will not be available. However during the tenure of the contract, if due to changes in the BASIC.INTEREST/ PERIODIC.INTEREST key, the interest rate on the contract becomes negative, such rate would be truncated to 0%. Once input and authorized, this field becomes non-inputtable. Default value is NO. Validation Rules: This field will not accept the value YES in the following cases

      • setNewComRate

        public void setNewComRate(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified NewComRate to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the new commission rate for the contract. Indicates the new commission rate for the contract, or in the case of Commitment contracts the rate (or rate tier) applicable to commitment commission accruals. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus decimal point. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Input allowed for Loans and Commitments only. When commission payment method is discounted, rate must be greater than zero. Input prohibited unless a value is present in field COMM.RATE. Must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Multivalue field for Commitments only. Input prohibited prior to first authorisation of contract. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts.

        Parameters:
        param - the NewComRate to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNewComRate

        public void setNewComRate(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified NewComRate to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the new commission rate for the contract. Indicates the new commission rate for the contract, or in the case of Commitment contracts the rate (or rate tier) applicable to commitment commission accruals. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus decimal point. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Input allowed for Loans and Commitments only. When commission payment method is discounted, rate must be greater than zero. Input prohibited unless a value is present in field COMM.RATE. Must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Multivalue field for Commitments only. Input prohibited prior to first authorisation of contract. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts.

        Parameters:
        param - the NewComRate to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNewIntRate

        public void setNewIntRate(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified NewIntRate to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: New interest rate to be applied. Represents the new interest rate on a contract, or in the case of Commitment contracts the rate (or rate tier) applicable to commitment fee accruals. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Input prohibited for FLOATING rate contracts. Input prohibited for interest basis "S". One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Input prohibited prior to first authroised contract. Input prohibited for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Zero rate allowed for Commitments only. Input must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Multiple rates on commitment contracts required for each amount input. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field.

        Parameters:
        param - the NewIntRate to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNewIntRate

        public void setNewIntRate(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified NewIntRate to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: New interest rate to be applied. Represents the new interest rate on a contract, or in the case of Commitment contracts the rate (or rate tier) applicable to commitment fee accruals. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input. Multivalue field.) Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Input prohibited for FLOATING rate contracts. Input prohibited for interest basis "S". One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Input prohibited prior to first authroised contract. Input prohibited for PERIODIC AUTOMATIC contracts. Multiple rates allowed for Commitment contracts only. Zero rate allowed for Commitments only. Input must be a positive value. If the rate is greater than MAX.INT.RATE, specified in the PERIODIC.INTEREST table, then an override message will be given, otherwise override will be if the rate is greater than 100. Multiple rates on commitment contracts required for each amount input. Input prohibited for forward dated contracts. Input prohibited for deposit type contracts with value in Mat.Amount field.

        Parameters:
        param - the NewIntRate to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNewSpread

        public void setNewSpread(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for NewSpread
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The new interest spread for contract. Validation Rules: 1-9 numeric characters plus a decimal point (- = a negative spread) of the form +/- 99.99. (Optional input.) Prohibited for FIXED interest contracts. Mandatory if a value in SPREAD V DATE, otherwise prohbited. One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Cannot be greater than 100%. Input permitted on authorised contracts only. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Cannot result in negative interest rate. Prohibited for commitments. Input prohibited for discounted interest payment method. Prohibited for Interest basis "S". Input prohibited for forward dated contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setNewSpread

        public void setNewSpread(TField value)
        Set the specified value for NewSpread
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The new interest spread for contract. Validation Rules: 1-9 numeric characters plus a decimal point (- = a negative spread) of the form +/- 99.99. (Optional input.) Prohibited for FIXED interest contracts. Mandatory if a value in SPREAD V DATE, otherwise prohbited. One forward dated action can be outstanding at any one time. Cannot be greater than 100%. Input permitted on authorised contracts only. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable. Cannot result in negative interest rate. Prohibited for commitments. Input prohibited for discounted interest payment method. Prohibited for Interest basis "S". Input prohibited for forward dated contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setOurRemarks

        public void setOurRemarks(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified OurRemarks to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Remarks for internal use only. These remarks will not be notified to the customer. The main purpose of this field is to maintain a record of special instructions or restrictions which apply to this contract. Validation Rules: Free format up to 15 lines maximum 55 type A (alphanumeric) characters per line. (Optional input.) Only 15 lines allowed.

        Parameters:
        param - the OurRemarks to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setOverdueStatus

        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: If the contract is overdue, then this field identifies the status of the underlying PAYMENT.DUE contract. Validation Rules: This is a NOINPUT field.

      • setOverride

        public void setOverride(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified Override to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains all the override messages which the user has confirmed during input. At validation,the system may generate a series of screen override messages to indicate some anomaly within the transaction (e.g. maturity date is not a working day for this currency). User may change the data or override the message. If the contract is subsequently displayed or printed, all override messages are shown. Validation Rules: (System generated. Multivalue field.) This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        param - the Override to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setOverride

        public void setOverride(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified Override to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains all the override messages which the user has confirmed during input. At validation,the system may generate a series of screen override messages to indicate some anomaly within the transaction (e.g. maturity date is not a working day for this currency). User may change the data or override the message. If the contract is subsequently displayed or printed, all override messages are shown. Validation Rules: (System generated. Multivalue field.) This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        param - the Override to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setParticipantNo

        public void setParticipantNo(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified ParticipantNo to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the identity of the relevant participant. An expansion in this field results in the expansion of all syndicate related fields. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric customer number or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) customer mnemonic. (Mandatory input. Multivalue field.) Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Permitted for Syndicated loan and Syndicated Commitment contracts only. If the value in SYNDICATE.AGT is other than "AGENT" then this information will be held on a memorandum basis only. The borrower cannot be a participant.

        Parameters:
        param - the ParticipantNo to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setParticipantNo

        public void setParticipantNo(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified ParticipantNo to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the identity of the relevant participant. An expansion in this field results in the expansion of all syndicate related fields. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric customer number or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) customer mnemonic. (Mandatory input. Multivalue field.) Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Permitted for Syndicated loan and Syndicated Commitment contracts only. If the value in SYNDICATE.AGT is other than "AGENT" then this information will be held on a memorandum basis only. The borrower cannot be a participant.

        Parameters:
        param - the ParticipantNo to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPayingAgent

        public void setPayingAgent(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PayingAgent
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the customer or bank who is acting as the paying agent for the contract. A Paying Agent is responsible for the payment and receipt of funds generated by the contract. If a Paying Agent is specified, this customer will be used to provide the defaults for settlement accounts and instructions for the deal, in the fields: DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT PRIN.LIQ.ACCT INT.LIQ.ACCT CHRG.LIQ.ACCT COM.LIQ.ACCT PRIN.BEN.BANK1 PRIN.BEN.BANK2 BENEF.PRIN.ACCT INT.LIQ.ACCT INT.BEN.BANK1 INT.BEN.BANK2 BEN.INT.ACCT The Paying Agent, if specified, will be used as the beneficiary of any Swift payment message. The value may be changed at any time during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: Must be a valid entry in the CUSTOMER file. An override will be required if the customer entered is not a bank, as defined in ACCOUNT.CLASS.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPayingAgent

        public void setPayingAgent(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PayingAgent
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the customer or bank who is acting as the paying agent for the contract. A Paying Agent is responsible for the payment and receipt of funds generated by the contract. If a Paying Agent is specified, this customer will be used to provide the defaults for settlement accounts and instructions for the deal, in the fields: DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT PRIN.LIQ.ACCT INT.LIQ.ACCT CHRG.LIQ.ACCT COM.LIQ.ACCT PRIN.BEN.BANK1 PRIN.BEN.BANK2 BENEF.PRIN.ACCT INT.LIQ.ACCT INT.BEN.BANK1 INT.BEN.BANK2 BEN.INT.ACCT The Paying Agent, if specified, will be used as the beneficiary of any Swift payment message. The value may be changed at any time during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: Must be a valid entry in the CUSTOMER file. An override will be required if the customer entered is not a bank, as defined in ACCOUNT.CLASS.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPenaltyKey

        public void setPenaltyKey(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PenaltyKey
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is not used at present.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPenaltyRate

        public void setPenaltyRate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PenaltyRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to arrive at the penalty spread that will be calculated when the LD contract becomes PD and crosses the period specified in PE.SWITCH.PERIOD in the relevant PD.PARAMETER record. When such period has been exceeded, the difference between the value in this field and the interest rate on the underlying contract will form the penalty spread in the PD record. This rate will be applied on the outstanding amount in the LD contract (referred to as OP in PD.AMOUNT.TYPE). For example: LD Contract amount 1,000,000 First principal payment 100,000 Contract rate 10% Penalty rate 15% PE.SWITCH.PERIOD in PD.PARAMETER 2 days As a result of the above settings, 2 days after the first principal payment becomes PD (i.e effective the third day), the penalty spread will be applied at 5% (15%-10%) on the outstanding LD principal of 900,000. Once a PD contract is created with the first PD.BALANCE, all subsequent PD balances will source the (latest) penalty rate from the PD contract itself (irrespective of PD.PARAMETER setting). Validation Rules: Input in this field is allowed only if LIQUIDATION.MODE is set to MANUAL or SEMI-AUTOMATIC. Input is allowed in this field only if CONTRACT.METHOD and PENALTY.KEY in the relevant PD.PARAMETER is set to NULL (in other words, input in the PENALTY.RATE field in the relevant PD.PARAMETER record is mandatory). In such a case, the value in the PENALTY.RATE in the contract will take precedence over the value in the PD.PARAMETER record. Subsequent to the input in this field and authorization of the LD contract, if the PENALTY.RATE in PD.PARAMETER is deleted and replaced with a CONTRACT.METHOD setting, then, when the LD contract becomes overdue, the rate in PENALTY.RATE in the LD contract is ignored and the penalty spread (if any) is calculated according to the CONTRACT.METHOD in PD.PARAMETER

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPenaltyRate

        public void setPenaltyRate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PenaltyRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to arrive at the penalty spread that will be calculated when the LD contract becomes PD and crosses the period specified in PE.SWITCH.PERIOD in the relevant PD.PARAMETER record. When such period has been exceeded, the difference between the value in this field and the interest rate on the underlying contract will form the penalty spread in the PD record. This rate will be applied on the outstanding amount in the LD contract (referred to as OP in PD.AMOUNT.TYPE). For example: LD Contract amount 1,000,000 First principal payment 100,000 Contract rate 10% Penalty rate 15% PE.SWITCH.PERIOD in PD.PARAMETER 2 days As a result of the above settings, 2 days after the first principal payment becomes PD (i.e effective the third day), the penalty spread will be applied at 5% (15%-10%) on the outstanding LD principal of 900,000. Once a PD contract is created with the first PD.BALANCE, all subsequent PD balances will source the (latest) penalty rate from the PD contract itself (irrespective of PD.PARAMETER setting). Validation Rules: Input in this field is allowed only if LIQUIDATION.MODE is set to MANUAL or SEMI-AUTOMATIC. Input is allowed in this field only if CONTRACT.METHOD and PENALTY.KEY in the relevant PD.PARAMETER is set to NULL (in other words, input in the PENALTY.RATE field in the relevant PD.PARAMETER record is mandatory). In such a case, the value in the PENALTY.RATE in the contract will take precedence over the value in the PD.PARAMETER record. Subsequent to the input in this field and authorization of the LD contract, if the PENALTY.RATE in PD.PARAMETER is deleted and replaced with a CONTRACT.METHOD setting, then, when the LD contract becomes overdue, the rate in PENALTY.RATE in the LD contract is ignored and the penalty spread (if any) is calculated according to the CONTRACT.METHOD in PD.PARAMETER

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPositionType

        public void setPositionType(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PositionType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the Foreign Exchange position type for this transaction. Use of this field will enable the User to update any designated position with Loans and Deposits transactions which involve a currency conversion. This field is to be further defined, locally. Validation Rules: 1-2 alpha characters. Optional input. Default to TR (trading). The User must define at least one Foreign Exchange position type for Trading position (TR). Any input in this field will be checked against the FX POS TYPE table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPositionType

        public void setPositionType(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PositionType
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Identifies the Foreign Exchange position type for this transaction. Use of this field will enable the User to update any designated position with Loans and Deposits transactions which involve a currency conversion. This field is to be further defined, locally. Validation Rules: 1-2 alpha characters. Optional input. Default to TR (trading). The User must define at least one Foreign Exchange position type for Trading position (TR). Any input in this field will be checked against the FX POS TYPE table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPrinAddress

        public void setPrinAddress(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified PrinAddress to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the Principal Amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified, or it will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) For Loans, DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits, PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Once a Loan contract has been authorised any amendment will impact future events only. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited when input in both PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 and PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or PRIN.BEN.BANK.2.

        Parameters:
        param - the PrinAddress to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPrinAddress

        public void setPrinAddress(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified PrinAddress to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: May contain the full name and address of a Beneficiary Bank, in respect of the Principal Amount, where no Agent details are maintained. This field serves three functions; in the case of 3 party transfers it will enable the branch to indicate the name and address of the customers bank if that bank is not set up on the database. In the case of 4 party transfers this field will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 if it is not specified, or it will take the place of PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 if it is not specified and PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 is specified. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Multivalue field. Optional input.) For Loans, DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits, PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid entry on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Once a Loan contract has been authorised any amendment will impact future events only. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited when input in both PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 and PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or PRIN.BEN.BANK.2.

        Parameters:
        param - the PrinAddress to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPrinBenBank1

        public void setPrinBenBank1(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PrinBenBank1
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The customer number of the bank to whom principal payments are to be physically made. If input, this field indicates that physical principal delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent or, alternatively, the correspondent of the customers bank. If transfers involving 4 parties are required an additional entry will be required in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. or If the second correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in PRIN.ADDRESS (a freeformat field) and BENEF.PRIN.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid customer on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) PRIN.ADDRESS * * * * D) BENEF.PRIN.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are freeformat fields. Once a Loan contract has been authorised any amendment will impact future events only. Input in this field will be checked against the AGENCY table which holds the Bank's name and address for all outputs produced by the system. 'Autorouting of payments' Standard payment details held on the Agency table for the contract customer will be used in this field when payment is required only if no input is made by the user. It is permitted to enter non-standard instructions whenever necessary. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 alphanumeric Customer Mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = blank.) For Loans the account specified in DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits the account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different customer number to that specified in PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 or PRIN.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPrinBenBank1

        public void setPrinBenBank1(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PrinBenBank1
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The customer number of the bank to whom principal payments are to be physically made. If input, this field indicates that physical principal delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent or, alternatively, the correspondent of the customers bank. If transfers involving 4 parties are required an additional entry will be required in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. or If the second correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in PRIN.ADDRESS (a freeformat field) and BENEF.PRIN.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid customer on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) PRIN.ADDRESS * * * * D) BENEF.PRIN.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are freeformat fields. Once a Loan contract has been authorised any amendment will impact future events only. Input in this field will be checked against the AGENCY table which holds the Bank's name and address for all outputs produced by the system. 'Autorouting of payments' Standard payment details held on the Agency table for the contract customer will be used in this field when payment is required only if no input is made by the user. It is permitted to enter non-standard instructions whenever necessary. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 alphanumeric Customer Mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = blank.) For Loans the account specified in DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits the account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different customer number to that specified in PRIN.BEN.BANK.2. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 or PRIN.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPrinBenBank2

        public void setPrinBenBank2(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PrinBenBank2
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The Customer number of the second bank involved in four-party transfers of the principal component. In the case of 3 party transfers the recipient bank where the customer maintains his account. If input, this field indicates that physical principal delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent. If transfers involving 4 parties are required an additional entry will be required in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or If the first correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in PRIN.ADDRESS (a freeformat field) and BENEF.PRIN.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid CUSTOMER on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) PRIN.ADDRESS * * * D) BENEF.PRIN.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are freeformat fields. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) Customer mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = none.) Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different number to that specified in PRIN.BEN.BANK.1. For Loans, the account specified in DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits, the account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Once the contract has been authorised, and the contract is a Loan any amendments will impact future events only. For Deposit contracts this field may be changed any time up to maturity. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or PRIN.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPrinBenBank2

        public void setPrinBenBank2(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PrinBenBank2
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The Customer number of the second bank involved in four-party transfers of the principal component. In the case of 3 party transfers the recipient bank where the customer maintains his account. If input, this field indicates that physical principal delivery is to be made to a bank other than our correspondent. It contains the identity of the customers bank who will receive the funds from our correspondent. If transfers involving 4 parties are required an additional entry will be required in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or If the first correspondent is not set up on the database then entries will be required in PRIN.ADDRESS (a freeformat field) and BENEF.PRIN.ACCT. The customer indicated in this field must be a valid CUSTOMER on the data base. The following are valid combinations for the specification of pay and receive (settlement) instructions. FIELD NAME COMBINATIONS 1 2 3 4 5 6 A) PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 * * * B) PRIN.BEN.BANK.2 * * * C) PRIN.ADDRESS * * * D) BENEF.PRIN.ACCT * * * * * * Note: A & B must be valid customers. C & D are freeformat fields. Validation Rules: 1-10 numeric character Customer code or 3-10 type A (alphanumeric) Customer mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = none.) Must be a valid CUSTOMER number or mnemonic. Must be a different number to that specified in PRIN.BEN.BANK.1. For Loans, the account specified in DRAWDOWN.ACCOUNT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. For Deposits, the account specified in PRIN.LIQ.ACCT must be a valid Nostro account appearing on the NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Once the contract has been authorised, and the contract is a Loan any amendments will impact future events only. For Deposit contracts this field may be changed any time up to maturity. Prohibited for Commitment contracts. Prohibited for non-bank customers if input appears in either PRIN.BEN.BANK.1 or PRIN.ADDRESS.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPrinIncLimamt

        public void setPrinIncLimamt(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified PrinIncLimamt to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to control the update to Limits when a 'B' schedule has been used in the LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE application to effect a schedules Principal Increase. Validation Rules: System generated

        Parameters:
        param - the PrinIncLimamt to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPrinIncLimamt

        public void setPrinIncLimamt(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified PrinIncLimamt to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field is used to control the update to Limits when a 'B' schedule has been used in the LD.SCHEDULE.DEFINE application to effect a schedules Principal Increase. Validation Rules: System generated

        Parameters:
        param - the PrinIncLimamt to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPrinLiqAcct

        public void setPrinLiqAcct(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for PrinLiqAcct
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the account number where entries are made for the reimbursement of the principal at liquidation. If the account through which reimbursement is to be made is not known the User can choose to enter one digit (from 1 to 9) which will identify the text (defined in LMM.TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the Customer. This will result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. The defaulting process looks firstly at the SEC.ACC.MASTER record using the portfolio no. If no default found uses the CUSTOMER.CCY.ACCT record and finally if still no default found takes details from the AGENCY record and NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. These settings can be overriden by using ACCOUNT.PARAMETER to set the account default method. If a Nostro account is specified then the appropriate liquidation instructions will be required in PRIN.BEN.BANK.1, PRIN.BEN.BANK.2, PRIN.ADDRESS and BENEF.PRIN.ACCT. This field can be changed at any time during the life of the contract; such changes will not be retrospective. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner proceeds for settlement may directly be drawn down from/to an account denominated in any currency. In case the underlying Contract Customer (eg. Customer.id in MONEYMARKET,Counterparty in FOREX, etc.) has a record in CUSTOMER.SSI application, then the account number in this field gets defaulted as per the definition for that Customer from CUSTOMER.SSI.For more information on the usage of this feature please refer to CUSTOMER.SSI application. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters-relating to a Customer Account, a Nostro Account. or 3-10 alphanumeric account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = Drawdown account.) Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. An account entered that is not equal to the default account will require an override. The system will check for posting restrictions and require an override if necessary. If a Nostro account is specified, it must be a valid entry on NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Prohibited for Commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setPrinLiqAcct

        public void setPrinLiqAcct(TField value)
        Set the specified value for PrinLiqAcct
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the account number where entries are made for the reimbursement of the principal at liquidation. If the account through which reimbursement is to be made is not known the User can choose to enter one digit (from 1 to 9) which will identify the text (defined in LMM.TEXT) to be printed on the advices sent to the Customer. This will result in the funds being applied to an interim account in the applicable currency. The defaulting process looks firstly at the SEC.ACC.MASTER record using the portfolio no. If no default found uses the CUSTOMER.CCY.ACCT record and finally if still no default found takes details from the AGENCY record and NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table. These settings can be overriden by using ACCOUNT.PARAMETER to set the account default method. If a Nostro account is specified then the appropriate liquidation instructions will be required in PRIN.BEN.BANK.1, PRIN.BEN.BANK.2, PRIN.ADDRESS and BENEF.PRIN.ACCT. This field can be changed at any time during the life of the contract; such changes will not be retrospective. Effective T24 release G12.1, input of an account denominated in a currency other than the deal currency is also permitted. In this manner proceeds for settlement may directly be drawn down from/to an account denominated in any currency. In case the underlying Contract Customer (eg. Customer.id in MONEYMARKET,Counterparty in FOREX, etc.) has a record in CUSTOMER.SSI application, then the account number in this field gets defaulted as per the definition for that Customer from CUSTOMER.SSI.For more information on the usage of this feature please refer to CUSTOMER.SSI application. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters-relating to a Customer Account, a Nostro Account. or 3-10 alphanumeric account mnemonic. (Optional input. Default value = Drawdown account.) Must be a valid ACCOUNT number or mnemonic. An account entered that is not equal to the default account will require an override. The system will check for posting restrictions and require an override if necessary. If a Nostro account is specified, it must be a valid entry on NOSTRO ACCOUNT table. Prohibited for Commitment contracts.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvision

        public void setProvision(TField value)
        Set the specified value for Provision
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the Provision percentage that has been applied for this contract. If the contract is eligible for Provisioning, system updates this field during COB according to the rules defined in ASSET.CLASS.PARAMETER. Allows Manual input as well (by changing PROVISION.METHOD field to MANUAL) to override the System classification. Accounting entries would be raised online in accordance with the new Provision percentage.. When PD exists for the contract, this field should match the Provision percentage in the corresponding PD contract. Validation Rules: Input allowed only when PROVISION.METHOD is MANUAL. Holds Null when there is no asset classification. Maximum of 3 Numeric characters. Allows '0'(Zero) as a Value.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvision

        public void setProvision(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for Provision
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates the Provision percentage that has been applied for this contract. If the contract is eligible for Provisioning, system updates this field during COB according to the rules defined in ASSET.CLASS.PARAMETER. Allows Manual input as well (by changing PROVISION.METHOD field to MANUAL) to override the System classification. Accounting entries would be raised online in accordance with the new Provision percentage.. When PD exists for the contract, this field should match the Provision percentage in the corresponding PD contract. Validation Rules: Input allowed only when PROVISION.METHOD is MANUAL. Holds Null when there is no asset classification. Maximum of 3 Numeric characters. Allows '0'(Zero) as a Value.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setProvisionAmount

        public void setProvisionAmount(TField value)

        Field description: Indicates the total amount provisioned for this contract. Validation Rules: No-Input field Standard Amount field.

        Parameters:
