        public void setTotIntTax(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for TotIntTax
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The total amount of tax payable on the interest due on this contract. If an interest tax rate or key is specified on this contract this field will represent the total amount of interest tax which has been computed by the system. When interest is liquidated the tax due is added/deducted automatically and the net amount paid to the counterparty. Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (System generated.) This is a NOINPUT field.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTotInterestAmt

        public void setTotInterestAmt(TField value)
        Set the specified value for TotInterestAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The total computed interest for the life or current/first period of the contract. Specifies the automatically calculated interest amount due for the current interest period for all interest types except for basis "S". The following considerations should be borne in mind: a) This field requires input when the interest basis is "S" and when interest schedules have not been defined. b) When the interest basis is "S" and interest schedules have been defined then this field will be updated by the system with a value representing the interest amount defined for the current/first interest period. c) When the user has defined interest schedules this field will only show the interest due for the first/current interest period. d) If the interest rate type is "floating" or there is an interest rate review scheduled in the middle of the current period, then an estimated amount will be calculated for the remaining contract life. e) For interest basis "S" the system will accrue into P+L based on the rate provided the difference will be compensated for within the final period thus agreeing with the user defined interest amount. f) For Commitment contracts the value in this field will be computed taking into account the value in LCU CALC BASE and BAND LEVEL IND. g) For CALL/NOTICE contracts, when the INTEREST.DUE.DATE (Field 148) is left blank this field will be written with the value '0' (zero). Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input.) Input prohibited for all contracts, except when interest basis "S" is used and interest schedules have not been defined whereupon input is mandatory. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. For interest basis "S" the value input or the sum of the interest schedules must be within a tolerance of 5% when compared with the product of contract value * rate * period. See note above. For interest basis "S" if the variance exceeds 1% an override will be required. See note above. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTotInterestAmt

        public void setTotInterestAmt(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for TotInterestAmt
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The total computed interest for the life or current/first period of the contract. Specifies the automatically calculated interest amount due for the current interest period for all interest types except for basis "S". The following considerations should be borne in mind: a) This field requires input when the interest basis is "S" and when interest schedules have not been defined. b) When the interest basis is "S" and interest schedules have been defined then this field will be updated by the system with a value representing the interest amount defined for the current/first interest period. c) When the user has defined interest schedules this field will only show the interest due for the first/current interest period. d) If the interest rate type is "floating" or there is an interest rate review scheduled in the middle of the current period, then an estimated amount will be calculated for the remaining contract life. e) For interest basis "S" the system will accrue into P+L based on the rate provided the difference will be compensated for within the final period thus agreeing with the user defined interest amount. f) For Commitment contracts the value in this field will be computed taking into account the value in LCU CALC BASE and BAND LEVEL IND. g) For CALL/NOTICE contracts, when the INTEREST.DUE.DATE (Field 148) is left blank this field will be written with the value '0' (zero). Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input.) Input prohibited for all contracts, except when interest basis "S" is used and interest schedules have not been defined whereupon input is mandatory. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. For interest basis "S" the value input or the sum of the interest schedules must be within a tolerance of 5% when compared with the product of contract value * rate * period. See note above. For interest basis "S" if the variance exceeds 1% an override will be required. See note above. Input prohibited for Sundries and Accounts Receivable.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTotPrincTax

      • setTotalCapCharge

        public void setTotalCapCharge(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for TotalCapCharge
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the sum of the capitalised charges with respect to the type of contract. Where the charges decrease the principal this figure will be negative, for an increase to the principal this will be positive. This field is cleared after authorisation of changes

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTotalCapCharge

        public void setTotalCapCharge(TField value)
        Set the specified value for TotalCapCharge
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Contains the sum of the capitalised charges with respect to the type of contract. Where the charges decrease the principal this figure will be negative, for an increase to the principal this will be positive. This field is cleared after authorisation of changes

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTotalCommAmount

        public void setTotalCommAmount(TField value)
        Set the specified value for TotalCommAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the commission amount due on this contract. Specifies the automatically calculated commission amount due for the current commission period for all commission basis except for basis "S". The following considerations should be borne in mind: a) This field requires input when the commission basis is "S" and when commission schedules have not been defined. b) When the commission basis is "S" and commission schedules have been defined then this field will contain a value representing the commission amount defined for the first/current commission period. c) When the user has defined commission schedules this field will show the commission accrued in the first/current commission period only. d) If the commission rate type is "floating" or there is a commission rate review scheduled in the middle of the current period, then an estimated amount will be calculated for the remaining contract life. e) For commission basis "S" the system will accrue into P+L based on the rate * principal value * days; the difference will be compensated for within the final period. f) For Commitment contracts the value in this field will be computed taking into account the value in LCU CALC BASE. g) For CALL/NOTICE contracts when COMM.DUE.DATE (field 149) is left blank, this field will be populated with the value '0' (zero). Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input.) Allowed for Loan and Commitment contract types only. Input is prohibited for all contract types except when commission basis "S" is used and commission schedules have not been defined whereupon input is mandatory. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. For commission basis "S" the value input or the sum of the commission schedules must be within a tolerance of 5% when compared with the product of contract value * rate * period. See note above. For commission basis "S" if the variance exceeds 1% an override will be required. See note above. Input in this field is prohibited when schedules are defined.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTotalCommAmount

        public void setTotalCommAmount(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for TotalCommAmount
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the commission amount due on this contract. Specifies the automatically calculated commission amount due for the current commission period for all commission basis except for basis "S". The following considerations should be borne in mind: a) This field requires input when the commission basis is "S" and when commission schedules have not been defined. b) When the commission basis is "S" and commission schedules have been defined then this field will contain a value representing the commission amount defined for the first/current commission period. c) When the user has defined commission schedules this field will show the commission accrued in the first/current commission period only. d) If the commission rate type is "floating" or there is a commission rate review scheduled in the middle of the current period, then an estimated amount will be calculated for the remaining contract life. e) For commission basis "S" the system will accrue into P+L based on the rate * principal value * days; the difference will be compensated for within the final period. f) For Commitment contracts the value in this field will be computed taking into account the value in LCU CALC BASE. g) For CALL/NOTICE contracts when COMM.DUE.DATE (field 149) is left blank, this field will be populated with the value '0' (zero). Validation Rules: 1-14 numeric characters plus a decimal point. (Optional input.) Allowed for Loan and Commitment contract types only. Input is prohibited for all contract types except when commission basis "S" is used and commission schedules have not been defined whereupon input is mandatory. Once authorised this field cannot be changed. For commission basis "S" the value input or the sum of the commission schedules must be within a tolerance of 5% when compared with the product of contract value * rate * period. See note above. For commission basis "S" if the variance exceeds 1% an override will be required. See note above. Input in this field is prohibited when schedules are defined.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setTradeDate

        public void setTradeDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for TradeDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the date an issue was traded. This field, if specified will be used to provide the default base for the VALUE.DATE. The VALUE.DATE will be defaulted by adding the days delivery for the CURRENCY to the TRADE.DATE, using the holiday definitions of LD.BUS.DAY.CENTRES. Validation Rules: Optional Field, no change allowed Cannot be greater than today.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        Set the specified value for TradeDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Specifies the date an issue was traded. This field, if specified will be used to provide the default base for the VALUE.DATE. The VALUE.DATE will be defaulted by adding the days delivery for the CURRENCY to the TRADE.DATE, using the holiday definitions of LD.BUS.DAY.CENTRES. Validation Rules: Optional Field, no change allowed Cannot be greater than today.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setUseDefPiRate

        public void setUseDefPiRate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for UseDefPiRate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: When this field is set to yes, then a deal with periodic interest can bevalidated without setting a starting interest rate. The starting rate will be automatically set from the schedule after it is defined using the first interest rate reset value. Validation Rules: Yes or No Defaults to No

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

        nothing

      • setValueDate

        public void setValueDate(TField value)
        Set the specified value for ValueDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The value date (or start) of the contract. The value date of the contract and, in the case of Commitments with no value in INT.START.DATE, the date from which interest (commitment fees) will start to accrue. The system will ensure that this date is a working day in the Country/Region(s) defined in the field BUS.DAY.DEFN. If a TRADE.DATE is specified, this field will be defaulted using the number of delivery days for the CURRENCY, and the LD.BUS.DAY.DEFN. If no TRADE.DATE is defined the current system date value will be used. This field is used as the effective date for interest puposes for the principal. The date used as the value date for accounting movements will be the DRAWDOWN.ENT.DATE, which may be different. Validation Rules: 1-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. Default equals system date.) An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Must be prior to FIN.MAT.DATE. For Commitment contracts must be equal to or prior to INT.START.DATE. Forward dated contracts not allowed for Commitment contract types. If the back-value exceeds 15 days, an override will be required. If the forward-value exceeds 15 days, an override will be required. Value date of drawdown under a commitment cannot be prior to the VALUE.DATE nor after the FIN.MAT.DATE of the commitment. Once the contract has been authorised, this field cannot be changed. Drawing under a commitment contract cannot be input before DD.START.DATE in the commitment contract An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setValueDate

        public void setValueDate(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for ValueDate
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: The value date (or start) of the contract. The value date of the contract and, in the case of Commitments with no value in INT.START.DATE, the date from which interest (commitment fees) will start to accrue. The system will ensure that this date is a working day in the Country/Region(s) defined in the field BUS.DAY.DEFN. If a TRADE.DATE is specified, this field will be defaulted using the number of delivery days for the CURRENCY, and the LD.BUS.DAY.DEFN. If no TRADE.DATE is defined the current system date value will be used. This field is used as the effective date for interest puposes for the principal. The date used as the value date for accounting movements will be the DRAWDOWN.ENT.DATE, which may be different. Validation Rules: 1-9 type A (alphanumeric) characters. (Optional input. Default equals system date.) An override will be required if the date as defined on the HOLIDAY table is a non working day. Must be prior to FIN.MAT.DATE. For Commitment contracts must be equal to or prior to INT.START.DATE. Forward dated contracts not allowed for Commitment contract types. If the back-value exceeds 15 days, an override will be required. If the forward-value exceeds 15 days, an override will be required. Value date of drawdown under a commitment cannot be prior to the VALUE.DATE nor after the FIN.MAT.DATE of the commitment. Once the contract has been authorised, this field cannot be changed. Drawing under a commitment contract cannot be input before DD.START.DATE in the commitment contract An override will be required if the date is not defined on the HOLIDAY table.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setVdDateAdjustment

        public void setVdDateAdjustment(TField value)
        Set the specified value for VdDateAdjustment
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Defines the Value Date Adjustment type to follow. Based on the adjustment type and the business centres the adjustment value date of the contract is determined. Valid date adjustments are as follows : o null the actual value date of the contract o FOLLOWING the value date is the next business day after the value date of the contract o PRECEDING the value date is the first preceding business day before the value date of the contract o MODIFIED the value date is the next business day after the value date of the contract providing that it does not fall into the next calendar month. In which case the value date will be the first preceding business day. Validation Rules: 1-20 alphanumeric characters. (Optional input. Default = null). Must be either null, "FOLLOWING", "PRECEDING", or "MODIFIED". Functionality should be used only for Trade date system

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setVdDateAdjustment

        public void setVdDateAdjustment(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for VdDateAdjustment
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Defines the Value Date Adjustment type to follow. Based on the adjustment type and the business centres the adjustment value date of the contract is determined. Valid date adjustments are as follows : o null the actual value date of the contract o FOLLOWING the value date is the next business day after the value date of the contract o PRECEDING the value date is the first preceding business day before the value date of the contract o MODIFIED the value date is the next business day after the value date of the contract providing that it does not fall into the next calendar month. In which case the value date will be the first preceding business day. Validation Rules: 1-20 alphanumeric characters. (Optional input. Default = null). Must be either null, "FOLLOWING", "PRECEDING", or "MODIFIED". Functionality should be used only for Trade date system

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setVdPriorAdjust

        public void setVdPriorAdjust(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for VdPriorAdjust
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Defines a value date adjustment in working or calendar days. This adjustment will be made prior to any other ajustment (See LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS field VD.DATE.ADJUST). Validation Rules: Format nnC or nnW where nn = 1 to 2 numeric characters W = Working days C = Calender days (Optional input)

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setWalkInCust

        public void setWalkInCust(java.lang.CharSequence param, int idx)
        Set the specified WalkInCust to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates a) the name and the address of any short term or 'casual' walk in customer or b) an alternative address for correspondence purposes. This field will be used where a branch does not wish to open a specific customer record for 'one off' or casual customers. It will be used in conjunction with a miscellaneous customer number. Alternatively this field will be used in instances where an existing customer requires correspondence to go to an alternative address. The values recorded here will always take priority over the values held on the customer record. This field can be changed at any point during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input. Default value = none.) Input prohibited unless a valid customer number is present in CUSTOMER.ID. Input in this field will generate an override message. Input prohibited if DELIVERY LINK is SWIFT.

        Parameters:
        param - the WalkInCust to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setWalkInCust

        public void setWalkInCust(TField param, int idx)
        Set the specified WalkInCust to a specific position in collection.
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: Indicates a) the name and the address of any short term or 'casual' walk in customer or b) an alternative address for correspondence purposes. This field will be used where a branch does not wish to open a specific customer record for 'one off' or casual customers. It will be used in conjunction with a miscellaneous customer number. Alternatively this field will be used in instances where an existing customer requires correspondence to go to an alternative address. The values recorded here will always take priority over the values held on the customer record. This field can be changed at any point during the life of the contract. Validation Rules: 1-4 lines of 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multivalue field. (Optional input. Default value = none.) Input prohibited unless a valid customer number is present in CUSTOMER.ID. Input in this field will generate an override message. Input prohibited if DELIVERY LINK is SWIFT.

        Parameters:
        param - the WalkInCust to append
        idx - the position in collection
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setYieldMethod

        public void setYieldMethod(TField value)
        Set the specified value for YieldMethod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field can be used to indicate whether yield method of calculation should be adopted instead of straight discount method. Valid input to this field is either "YES" or "NO". If the field is flagged to "YES", the interest amount would be calculated under yield method. If flagged to "NO" interest amount would be calculated under straight discount method. Under the yield method an Applied Interest Rate would be used for calculation of the interest amount using the below mentioned formula; Applied Interest Rate = (r/100) / (1+(r*nd/100*yd)) r = rate of interest (%) nd = Number of Days yd = Number of Days in a year The following example would illustrate the difference under straight discount method of interest calculation and yield method of interest calculation; Contract Details Value Date : Jan 01, 2001 Maturity Date : April 01, 2001 Amount : USD 1 Million Rate of Interest : 10% Interest Payment Method : Discounted Interest Basis : A Under the straight discount method the interest amount calculated would be USD 25000 for 90 days. Under the Yield method, the applied interest rate would be calculated using the above formula which would be 9.7561%. Based on this applied rate the interest amount calculated would be USD 24390.24 for 90 days. The amortisation of interest amount under the yield method would be at the applied interest rate calculated for each period. Validation Rules: Input allowed only if Int Payment Method is Discounted Default is "NO"

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing

      • setYieldMethod

        public void setYieldMethod(java.lang.CharSequence value)
        Set the specified value for YieldMethod
        Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the object is not modifiable.

        Field description: This field can be used to indicate whether yield method of calculation should be adopted instead of straight discount method. Valid input to this field is either "YES" or "NO". If the field is flagged to "YES", the interest amount would be calculated under yield method. If flagged to "NO" interest amount would be calculated under straight discount method. Under the yield method an Applied Interest Rate would be used for calculation of the interest amount using the below mentioned formula; Applied Interest Rate = (r/100) / (1+(r*nd/100*yd)) r = rate of interest (%) nd = Number of Days yd = Number of Days in a year The following example would illustrate the difference under straight discount method of interest calculation and yield method of interest calculation; Contract Details Value Date : Jan 01, 2001 Maturity Date : April 01, 2001 Amount : USD 1 Million Rate of Interest : 10% Interest Payment Method : Discounted Interest Basis : A Under the straight discount method the interest amount calculated would be USD 25000 for 90 days. Under the Yield method, the applied interest rate would be calculated using the above formula which would be 9.7561%. Based on this applied rate the interest amount calculated would be USD 24390.24 for 90 days. The amortisation of interest amount under the yield method would be at the applied interest rate calculated for each period. Validation Rules: Input allowed only if Int Payment Method is Discounted Default is "NO"

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set
        Returns:
        nothing
